text: I feel kind of guilty writing this review but honestly my food was disgusting - mealy tomatoes, wilted greens, packet of high fructose corn syrup dressing, stale bread even though it's a bakery. Everything about it was really, really gross. I can't fathom how this place is getting good reviews.
Angel hair pasta with grilled chicken and spinach, sun dried tomatoes is awesome. Pairs great with the sweet bread
The turkey turkey was one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Everything about it was amazing. I also had the monster cookie and that was also delicious. I will definitely come back here
Bread is great! I ordered the pasta and it was good. Very cute small place w great chocolate cake. Cute out door seating. Perfect for a little lunch trip!
I come here about twice a week and I either order the tortilla salad or pollo diablo. This place is amazing and truly a gem.
Panes Bread Cafe has good food. Their sandwiches are tasty and some of their other things are delicious as well.
Amazing sandwiches and delicious sides..gotta try the Mexican pork sandwich!!! Soooo goooood!!!

It's unassuming, but once we found this place, we fell in love with it. Terrific sandwiches and great fresh baked bread if you're having people over. While it would be easier if they took credit cards, I don't feel that it is worth docking any stars for. My personal favorite is the pompazo.

I haven't been to Pane's for several years, but I still rate their BLT and rice pudding with white chocolate chips as the best I've ever eaten.  Making a special trip to Panes when we visit Chicago this summer.
Addictive food. Love this place when I'm on my way home from work. It is a must to go to. My family can't get enough of the sandwiches here
I really like this place. Very good food. The staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable. I had on different occasions the pork and the chicken sandwiches. The soups are also good.

This place is a great deal for the quality of food.  I would give it 5 stars but my delivery order was shorted a bag of chips and I was given the wrong dressing with my spinach salad.  I wish they made they're own dressing, it seems like that is the only thing that isn't home made.

If you go here and don't get a sandwich, you are out of your mind. The bread is fantastic. The roast beef is dreamy. This is better than any fast-chain sandwich you've had this year. And treat yourself to a truffle. Because you're worth it and this place is amazing.

Delicious on the go sandwich!!! Ordered the Turkey, Turkey with smoked turkey, avo, roasted red pepper, spicy mayo and tomato bread. The tomato bread was soooo tasty. Everything tied together very well. Highly recommend this sammich. Also comes with a side of chips! Coming from Boston, the cute shop felt even homier with the Red Sox decor. Chatted with the owner and she was the sweetest. May have to become a regular once I start working nearby. :) FYI, cash only!

Excellent little mom and pops place! The sandwiches are phenomenal. All the bread here is handmade and let me just say that their sweet French bread is hard to put down.  The entire menu can satisfy almost any craving with the different varieties of sandwiches available to order.

Had their portabella sandwich and it was fantastic. Their bread is homemade and was very fresh. Wifey had the pollo diablo and she loved it. Had outdoor seating, which was perfect for a summer day. Can't wait to come back to try their pizzas and pastas.  Tip:  BYOB and cash only

Love this place!  Its the best food that you can taste its homemade and done super well every time.  I have tried virtually every sandwich here and they're all amazing.  I keep going back to the Turkey Turkey and Pompazo on tomato bread (best tomato bread i have ever had with a sandwich).  I've also been back multiple times for breakfast/brunch too.   Their chilaquiles verde are authentic and the salsa is great. Last but not least, they usually have samples f their freshly baked cookies or bread that make for a nice treat while you wait for your food. I Love You Panes

Not sure how this came onto my radar, but I'm glad it did.  Stopped in for lunch Sunday...cute decor, seating for a few dozen.  I'd imagine parking to be more of a challenge on any other day.  We each ordered the Oaxacan pork sandwich and couldn't have been happier.  Delicious, marinated thick sliced pork with caramelized onions and roasted red peppers on some homemade bread.  Man, I'm sorry I was late to this party, but I'll definitely be back to try other options of the breads and pastries.

I'm in coming here for probably 15-20 years for lunch and I really like it. It's one of the best sandwiches in the city and it all bases off the bread. Not the biggest fan of the things outside of the sandwiches but the sandwiches are really good. Make sure you get a monster cookie with your meal as well.  I also really like the fact that it's a family-run business and we're supporting small delis in sandwich shops.

My client brings me a dessert from here about once a month. They're really great. The rosemary bread is absolutely delicious. The only thing I've eaten off the menu is the blanco tuna sandwich and garlic potato salad. Love them both. If I didn't worry about how much fat was folding over my pants in certain poses, I would eat here more.
Excellent sandwiches and treats, run by lovely people, a wonderful spot to sit and enjoy the neighborhood. Bring cash or check!

I was teetering between 2 and 3 stars and thought I would cave and give 2. Here is the scoop. Cash only, dirt cheap omelettes and breakfast tasty meals.  However the day I went the coffee machine was on the fritz and they could not recommend the coffee. Ok, fine. The potatoes that come with the eggs were severely undercooked(raw with bad seasoned salt) and when I sent them back they came back black but still undercooked. It's in a great location on Sheffield Street but I would honestly find another place to go for breakfast... Sorry

I live close by so it is a super convenient location for me. I am satisfied with the food but I think the breakfast could be better. The owner is super nice and other workers are great as well. Great price points.

My husband and I stopped in here tonight and had some great sandwiches. We had the Todo Italiano and Pollo Diablo.  The bread is so good, ingredients definitely tasted fresh and we loved the flavor combos. We also got a chocolate chip cookie which was delicious. Definitely coming back to try more sandwiches!

I am very thankful that I live close by. I haven't had a meal yet that was not tasty and well done. I am trying different sandwiches by the week and I haven't been disappointed.    Panes makes their own bread and gives you bread with most orders. The menu is wide ranging and doesn't change! Breakfast is amazing.  They are always on the ball with making your meal. Even when it's crowded they make your food very quickly.  Panes has very reasonable prices too which is a break from the majority of Chicago food scene.  It's cash only so keep that in mind, but they do have an ATM inside. If there's item on the menu that isn't top shelf I'd say it's their pizza but it's still good. Leave your pizza order for the pizza specialists nearby.  Their hours of operation are very generous. I don't know where'd I be without Panes in my backyard! They deserve heavy patronage every day of the week.

My favorite monthly brunch. A few blocks from my dog groomer (Kriser's on Belmont), this is the best neighborhood cafe for me to wait while they get pretty. I always order the house chilequiles and a San Pellegrino- aranciata rossa. DELICIOUS. ALWAYS.  Cash only. Do not miss this charming place.

A really cute and solid restaurant close to many common walking attractions in Chicago. This place serves pretty large portions, making it a good option for the hungry lunch or dinner guest. Their food tastes *quite* Italian in style, and ranges from Sandwiches to Salads to Pastas, to bakery fresh breads and cookies. Worth checking out! I tried the Pollo Diavola and my girlfriend had the Angel Hair pasta - both were solid.

My boyfriend and I ordered from here for lunch because the spot is super close to my place. We decided to split a pork sandwich and their beef one. Although the bread was really good the beef one lacked flavor so I decided to add some horseradish sauce I had in the fridge. The pork one was flavorful but not too heavy. The only downside for me for this place is that they are cash only and the atm they have charges a fee to withdraw money. :(

It is a nice little spot in my neighborhood and the bread for the sandwiches is always fresh.  I want to like it better, but the food is relatively bland.  The terms Spicy Mayo and Diablo generally mean at least a hint of spice - not here.

I recently moved from Chicago to Portland, and this is one of my top 5 restaurants I will miss from Chicago! (not kidding when I say I shed a tear when I left.) I feel like I'm visiting family every time I'm here. Great service, AMAZING FOOD, and very, very affordable. Plus, you get free bread if you're dining in. 100 stars.

Whichever sandwich you choose, order it on their homemade tomato bread!  It is dangerously good.  I always stop here for lunch after getting my hair done next door.  I am never disappointed.  Quick service.  Cash Only.
Sandwiches and salads are both delicious. The bread they use for the sandwiches is amazing (try the tomato bread, it tastes like pizza). I highly recommend this place.

I always am looking for a good (healthy) sandwich. This place is truly great. So happy I found it. I will be coming back all the time. If you have not been here, please get here as soon as you can. It is much better than Blue Door Farm Stand. It is very inexpensive too.

The best sandwich shop ever. Hands down. Excellent little place that I have been patronizing for 20 years. Sandwiches and pasta are all good choices. Never had anything I didn't like here. Grab a cookie as dessert. Excellent.

I would have ordered a Sandwich but I did not realize that the back of the menu had the sandwiches. I ended up with the Spicy Penne. Overcooked noodles, unwarmed sauce, it was edible but barely. Oh and the white bread must have sugar in it it was so sweet, the other bread which you got less of was good with herbs. I might have bought the bread loaf but they don't take credit cards but are so kind to have an ATM machine there. Only ended up there because Pompei was closed. I had hoped for some really good Italian but no such luck at Panes Bread.
Cute, cozy spot for casual dining. Monster cookies are amazing. Don't forget to bring cash!
Delicious and cheap breakfast! I got the bacon egg and cheese. It was served on their bread along with potatoes. My friend got the French toast which had a great presentation. Sit outside if you can!

I live really close to panes and have tried many items on their menu. The omelettes are really well portioned for 7-8$, but aren't very flavorful. The sandwiches always have something missing, I don't know what it is. They are just good, not amazing. I always expect more from their bread based on the name of the place - I've had their tomato bread which is pretty good but the bread that comes with salad and soups is super average. Tastes like regular white bread to me.  So overall - Pros: relatively quick, cheap, fresh hot food, big portions Cons: taste is average, cash only
Wow!! What a fabulous find! So inexpensive! Huge portions! And delicious, real, fresh, homemade food!! Will be coming back!
Excellent! Absolutely one of the best sandwich shops around! Delicious fresh baked bread, homemade soups and reasonably priced! You have to check it out!!!

Have lived in the area for a few months and finally decided to stop by for carry out lunch, and was not disappointed! The pasta I ordered was fresh and cooked perfectly, with plenty of leftovers for later! Came with two delicious bread rolls as well, so I will be coming back to try more of the baked goods. My roommate and been there for brunch on the weekends, and has nothing bad to say either. A great meal alternative to all the lunch chains nearby, an absolute gem of a neighborhood food spot. All the employees I interacted with were friendly and efficient, and there's an adorable dining space for dining in. It's totally worth grabbing cash from the ATM beforehand, can't wait to go back and try what else they have to offer!

6 Years after my last review-Panes remains consistently the best place to get a salad, sandwich or pasta dish for lunch or for a quick dinner.  Wonderful staff, wonderful food.   I think the only thing that has changed since 2010 is that they now deliver. Thank you Panes!
We ordered the turkey club, chicken club and the tortilla soup. Excellent food and service. Friendly staff.  We will be back!

One of the best sandwiches in town! Big portion, comes with potato chips, perfectly toasted bread for a nice crisp. I'll be coming back to try out the other 15+ sandwiches they offer. CASH ONLY! We also got the monster cookie due to its popularity on Yelp, and it didn't disappoint. 5 stars

Ordered delivery from here and am so glad I did. I ordered The Popular and my boyfriend ordered the Todo Italiano. Both were delicious but The Popular was definitely the winner! Delivery was on time, but there is a small delivery fee. Would definitely want to go to the cafe next time and see what else they have.
Some of the freshest sandwiches in all of chicago. The people are friendly and the value for your money is great. I love the tables outside in summer!
Amazing sandwiches for a great price!! In addition to an excellent service. I come here every week!

We checked this place out for the first time on a Sunday morning. It has a very local and mom & pop shop vibe to it, kind of similar to Aje Cafe nearby. They have some outdoor seating options and can definitely get crowded when busy. It's cash only and you wait in line to order, then they bring it to your table. We ordered sandwiches this time and they were both delicious and very filling, although all the brunch items I saw at other tables looked equally as amazing. Menu items are customizeable which is always nice, all their bread options are fresh and homemade. Next time I need a loaf of bread for dinner, I won't hesitate to come here to pick some up as they double as a bakery. We also ordered pizza bread and the monster cookie, both were so good but left us bursting at the seams when our meal was finished. I will be back here many times, whether it be for lunch or brunch. I wish it wasn't limited to cash only but it is what it is. I highly recommend checking this local place out if you're craving a sandwich or some breakfast made from fresh ingredients!
great food... tomato bread is great (turkey turkey) and the pollo diablo is awesome

I'm not sure how I haven't been to this place before today; it's so good! I got the portobello sandwich, side of potato salad (a little bland, tbh) and the chocolate chip banana bread which totaled out around $17. Would have been cheaper if I had some self control, but definitely worth it!
Classic sandwich spot that makes their own bread and sauces. This lunch spot is a must see if you live nearby. I highly recommend getting the turkey turkey!

I went to Panes years ago and remembered the reason I've not been back the minute after I ordered and was told 2 sandwiches would not be ready for 15 minutes, freaky slow!!! Plus cash only, come on. We ordered 2 sandwiches the super panes and the red pepper  and mozzarella neither had much filling and the bread got real soggy from the sauce. The bread was to airy and light for me kind of reminded me of one of the cheap Jewel loaves of bread. Both sandwiches came out hot which was not mentioned on the menu which on a hot day I was hoping for a cold crispy sandwich. I see they have other breads they might be better. Customer service was lacking, when I called before I came in and asked about the menu I was told don't look on line the menu on there is 20 years old , you might want to address that right?
Outstanding! One of the best sandwich shops in the city... the chocolate balls and other assorted desserts are a phenomenal addition on top. It's a wonderful, family owned place...
cash only, oaxacan pork is very good. Very homely place.

Tip1: Cash-only Tip2: MONSTER COOKIE Panes is a great place to grab a sandwich right by the Wellington brown line stop. They have a ton of options on house-made bread, as well as pizzas and pastas too. I ordered the roasted beef sandwich which came with onions, tomato and avocado. Portion size was generous and it came with chips too...for only like 7 bucks or so. Awesome sandwich! And be sure to get one of their monster cookies. Perfect way to end a meal!
Breakfast sandwich was awesome.  The homemade bread is great especially with turkey and mustard.  Cash only though is a negative
Fuck this place, they don't tell u it's cash only till u get there east of ducking time

Wow these sandwiches are delicious!!!! Great reasonable prices as well! The sandwiches come with lays also. Super filling but all the ingredients taste very fresh. Will definitely be back to try more of the sandwiches soups salads and pastries !

I LOVE Panes.  I have never had a bad meal here and love how everything is cooked fresh.  The restaurant itself is cozy and the staff are very friendly/inviting.  Anytime I can't figure out what I want to eat I come here.  Luckily, there is an ATM in the restaurant because I always forget it's cash only.  The food is an amazing value for what they give you and I always leave with leftovers.

This place is a real gem. I only stayed away so long because it's cash only, but duh! Of course they have an ATM, dummy!  It's family owned, adorably decorated, the staff is so nice, and the whole place smells amazing! I want to come and hang out, read, study, draw, and write. Why why WHY have I wasted so much life not eating at Panes?! The bread is beautiful. So soft and warm and with a perfect crunchy crust! The flavors are so pure and delicious! I had a sandwich with a gorgeous, fresh, (I'm guessing house-made) pesto that was even better than my grandma's! (Yeah. That is impressive.) For a VERY reasonable price, you get a huge sandwich big enough to share and chips. I was too full for desserts, but they looked sooooooo amazing! I will definitely be back and am kicking myself for not trying it sooner!

I work in the neighborhood and end up getting lunch here at least once a week. I have tried many of their sandwiches and have never came across a sandwich I did not like. Also their baked goods and soups are excellent. If you're in the area you have to try one of their sandwiches and make sure to get it on the homemade tomato bread! As a heads up though they are cash only (checks too but who still writes those now a days)
The sandwiches are decent and are their USP The breads however are overrated and very dry.. Tried them multiple times to give them the benefit of doubt. Was a fail every time

Order the oxacoan on tomato bread. You will not be disappointed. I've tried most the other sandwiches and this is hands down the best one. The other ones don't even compare. Cash only and call ahead to place your order.

We are frequent customers of Panes Bread Cafe. Last weekend we ordered 2 salads to go. We got home, and discovered they forgot the salad dressing! We had no dressing at home, and decided to call them up to let them know about the mix up. We thought it would be fair to get 1 credit for a salad in the future, since they left out a major component of a salad....dressing! The lady on the phone said we could either come back in and pick up the dressing, or she could give me a credit for dressing on a future order. How does one give a credit for just dressing, when it's included in the salad and not an additional cost? Poor customer service - she cared more about giving us a $8 credit for a future salad than retaining a long term customer. Very dissapointed.
This place is great! I recommend anything on the menu! I have been coming here for over a decade! The only downside is that they don't accept credit card.
Really great sandwiches and bread. Can take awhile to get the great sandwich but most of the time worth it. Expect to wait about 15 min for it

I've been here twice so far and both times were yum! Omelette safe huge and delicious with red potatoes. I wish they had other chips besides plain potato chips though to go with sandwiches. Also, they only take cash or checks.
My personal favorite sandwich shop in town. They have so much more than that, but I'm so addicted to my roast beef, I never branch out there. Wife loves the turkey sandwiches; she's had them all!
Have yet to have anything bad here. My boyfriend and I eat here about 3 times/ week because it's so good! Cute little place and the staff is great.

Honestly, it can't get much better for the price and quality.  This place is family owned and it shows when you're there, and I mean that in a good way.  Panes is a great example of what a small family owned joint brings you. Unique food at a great price, and that includes their brunch menu as well.  Some top lunch/dinner recommendations are the El Diablo, Super Pannes and Sunny California. Now.. if you are a hipster, only shop at Nordstroms, or consistently watch the TV show "Girls", please just stay away.  I don't need you ruining it.

There need to be more places like Panes.  I'm saddened it took me so long to discover Panes despite living a couple blocks away.  I say there need to be more places like Panes because it's very reasonably priced everything and perfect for that lunch when you don't know what you want. They've got about a dozen sandwich options most of which come on some of the best tomato focaccia type bread you'll ever have. And a lot of the sandwiches are creative. I had the spicy philly which was kinda like a cheese steak with a bit of chipotle mayo thrown in there. It was absolutely incredible. and despite only costing about $7.50, I got two meals out of it (admittedly had an appetizer to start with). Great, quaint atmosphere with a bit of random everything, but again perfect for when you're not sure what you want. The pizzas look quite good and they have salad and even pasta options.  Only downside is that it's cash only which is a pain if you don't realize. But can't wait to go back!!
We live across the street which can be very dangerous. We get panes ones a week and it never disappoints. High quality tasty sandwiches for a great price. Highly recommend!

I *LOVED* this place. This year I have the goal of visiting new restaurants --out of the ones I already know and love. Today I found this little gem through Yelp. What an amazing find! I had the green chilaquiles which were absolutely awesome. I'd rather have them be spicier (that's just me), but they were really good. A generous plate of chicken, scrambled eggs and tortillas with green tomatillo sauce + cream and queso fresco. Sided with breakfast red potatoes, this was a real winner. My kids had the mac & cheese which was made from scratch and really good. A highlight of this breakfast was the banana bread --which is made from scratch and baked in-house! This tasted gloriously while sipping my coffee before my chilaquiles came. Really good service, very clean and priced right. I cannot say enough good things about this place. Oh, it's cash only, so bring those crisp bills with you. I'll go back for sure and try the sandwiches and other breakfast dishes.
still very delicious. i ordered a Super Panes sandwich. absolutely DELICIOUS. the sweet bread they use is fantastic.

Very good sandwiches and solid soups.  I would recommend the Turkey Turkey sandwich (it's what I usually get), but the other sandwiches are generally good as well.  The bread tastes fresh and the spreads are tasty.

This restaurant has my favorite sandwich in the city - The oaxacan pork sandwich is a delicate blend of pork, onions, peppers, and some great seasonings. I savor every bite while eating here. My wife and I go here 2x per month, and would be here more if we lived closer.  Because the oaxacan pork sandwich is so good, I have yet to try another thing on their menu. It is so good, that I could probably eat it daily. Restaurant is very cozy and a fun, very casual place to take a date.

Great small town deli in the big city.  I had the roast beef sandwich and tasted the Pollo Diablo sandwich, both were very good. The garlic oregano bread is delish also. I'd recommend the place to anyone looking for a new lunch/food spot.

Panes is really nothing special. I came here for lunch after reading a lot of good reviews. I ordered a chicken sandwich with tomatoes and pesto. It was adequate for the meal, honestly totally forgettable in terms of taste and quality. The pesto lacked flavor that I end up adding a lot of table salt and pepper to the sandwich. The side chips were stale. My main gripe was that a sandwich made in a bakery should have really fresh, delicious bread. However, this sandwich's bread was totally average. I don't think I'll be back to Panes. It is fine for an average lunch if you are in the area.
Best sandwiches I've ever had! The super panes is so good... Their sauces are top notch. Warning: cash only

I was really excited to try this place because my friend had told me that it was good here. I decided to go in one day around 4:30pm to give it a try. I looked at the menu for a bit and ended up ordering their "The Popular" sandwich. It was decent I should say. It wasn't like "omgsh this is the best sandwich I have ever had". It was kind of dry and not the best with flavor. I give 3 stars because it was okay and their tomato bread that the sandwich came on, was good.

I came here on a Sunday evening with a friend and we had great service, we were the only ones there! I ordered the quesadilla with veggies, and a small salad. I have to say I was disappointed based on the reviews. It was a ton of precooked spinach, red pepper and squash. Not very tasty, I would get plain cheese if I came again. The mash potatoes on the side were great though. The salad was okay, some of the lettuce was soggy and wilted, and they didn't ask what dressing I wanted, and gave me a packet of t marzettis light Italian. My friend got the red pepper and mozzarella sandwich and it looked really good! She liked it a lot, she also said the tortilla soup was different, but good (she mentioned it tasted like refried beans). The monster cookie was delicious!! I want to come back her le for brunch. I think the vegetarian selections for lunch/dinner are pretty generic and pre-cooked veggie heavy. Seems like a great place for a quick bite though.
The super panes sandwich is amazing. Warm bread with butter and fresh ingredients. Price is solid too!

I got the chicken club - it was warm and delicious. The bread is homemade and the crispy bacon, fresh avocado and hot chicken went together perfectly. They could have added a few more chips but besides for that, cute place with good sandwiches !
Love their sandwiches. They are delicious. Fresh baked bread daily.  Only bad thing is: cash only, but they do have an ATM machine in the store now.

Having recently moved to Chicago with my partner, who is a Chicago native, he introduced me to Panes Bread Café, a Chicago staple since 1994! This place is amazing!! The place is really cute, and the food is just delicious! My partner ordered the Super Panes, which he last had about 10 years ago, and he said it was just like it was when he had it last and it brought back great memories! I selected the Spicy Philly, and it was truly delectable! The bread was very fresh, and the sandwich was made up of the best quality of ingredients, and ample sized as well!  They also have a various selection of desserts, which we did not order on this visit, but all of them look so good, a must on the next visit!  This will be a go to for us on many occasions, so glad I was able to experience such a great establishment!

I love this place! We eat here 2-3 times a month (and have been for over 5 years). Obviously, it's our 'go to' place for a quick, inexpensive, delicious bite.  I usually get the veggie cabra (my fav. sandwich) or the feta salad. We also love their weekend breakfast menu. The chilaquiles (get them with extra avocado) are sooooo yummy, and they are served with some awesome breakfast potatoes. Don't forget to grab a loaf of freshly baked bread to go (it's called Panes after all...and their bread is delicious!).

Panes is my absolute favorite neighborhood sandwich shop! If you are looking for a friendly, neighborhood place with consistently good food check this place out. My only compliant is that it's cash only, but they quickly make up for that.  I've lived within two blocks of Panes, in 2 different apartment, for over 4 years. Saying they are my "go-to" or "regular take-out" place would be an understatement.  Fresh bread, great sandwiches, awesome brunch, did I mention BYOB? Yeah, BYOB brunch! Suggestions: I love the Turkey Turkey (on sourdough, not the tomato bread it comes on), the Popular, the Pollo Diablo (I suggest adding avocado), and the Roast Beef. Also, the cookies are amazing.  Delivery, carry-out, or dine-in, this place is a can't miss.

Been coming to this place for years! Yummy, fresh, made-upon-order sandwiches. The fresh and made-in-house bread is probably the best part! Cute little patio is a nice touch during warm weather. Can't beat the price either.
Solid menu with generally very fresh and tasty offerings, and nice staff to boot. But 5 stars for having the best Chilaquiles on the planet.

Went here for the first time today and will now make this a regular spot. Had the chicken club, all of the ingredients were very fresh and the bread was amazing! Very good value as the sandwiches are big and fairly inexpensive for Chicago ($7-8), can't wait to try the salads and soups!

Timing was on our side today common here. We were able to park across the street directly across from the restaurant. You order your food at the little bakery counter, part for it, then sit and wait for it to be brought out to you. The bread from our sandwiches was made right there. It tasted fresh, but had a little thyme or rosemary in it, which i don't care for. I had chicken with bacon and cheese. They have us chips, but i didn't eat them. What i really enjoyed was the little do-it-yourself filtered water setup. You can refill it as much as you wanted. It was a small, family owned, quant place.
Best sandwich shop in Chicago. I don't visit the city without making a trip here. The Chicken Club on Sweet French bread is outstanding.
Every time we come into the city I have to stop by. Sandwiches are the best I've ever had, the bread is what truly makes the sandwich. Delicious!!
This place is the best for sandwiches, bread is made there and drool-worthy, home made potato salad/coleslaw to die for, little hole in the wall- must try

Nothing short of incredible. I live in the area and stopped in last week for the first time and got the popular. It was delicious! Friendly people and great atmosphere too.  They have a customer for life

This is my favorite sandwich shop in Chicago.  Very good sandwiches, very good value, very good service, very nice people. Chicken Club has always been my go to and stand by sandwich here.  However, I have enjoyed the entire menu, including sandwiches, pastas, desserts. Great cookies.  Lots for which to choose. Location is Sheffield and Wellington, Brown Line, Illinois Masonic Hospital.   Cash only.

There are a few things on the menu that are outstanding (Super Panes). I would say most sandwiches are mediocre though (Pollo Diablo, The Popular). Also, be careful when doing carry-out, I've received the wrong sandwich on several different occasions.
Love this place! The bread was so fresh and good. Turkey turkey with bacon is what I ordered and it was huge! Good portions and their baked goods look amazing . Will be back!

Food is great. They only take cash or check. I refuse to support places that expect me to pay the atm 3 dollars because they do not want to pay for cc machines, the cost of which I would be happy to have passed on to me. The bigger reasons places only take cash is so that they can hide income for tax breaks. It's a mom and pop mentality that you just need to get over in a modern world. I won't be back until they take credit or back cards.

Stopped by Panes Bread Cafe on an urgent bread craving - ordered two sandwiches (Super Panes and Roast Beef) Okay amount of deli meat, great portions and sauces..the bread was fantastic :q Perfectly chewy and toasty, would eat again just for the bread. The space is large! We sat outside in the sidewalk area but the inside has ample seating. Cash only though. Overall, wouldn't go out of my way but would definitely come back if I'm in the neighborhood for reasonably priced sandwiches!

Where do I start? Panes has been a top favorite of mine for almost 8 years now. And by favorite, I mean favorite restaurant of all time. I guess I must mention that sandwiches are one of my favorite foods, so this place is my heaven.  Homemade bread, fresh ingredients, and a variety of options. Their soups, salads and pasta's are also very delicious; my favorite being the mac n cheese. Their monster cookie is a must try.  My favorite sandwich is the Roast Beef. I love that all the sandwiches come with a side of Lay's chips. It's a perfect meal. The prices have been hiking up more than I'd like in the last few years, but even so it's still very affordable.  Anyway, I love Panes. So good. They have a cute patio and it's BYOB.  CASH ONLY!

I had the Sunny California, which was really good.  I also got a loaf of the honey wheat bread to go, which I really liked.  Looking at everybody else's orders as they came out, almost everything looked pretty good, so I'll definitely be back!

One of my favorite hide aways in lakeview.. feels like ur going to someone home to enjoy a meal....  great food & nice service.... I have many favorites here... use to live near this place but since I've moved further away I love that they deliver... daily specials & great prices, I suggest everyone try it!!!  Oh they have delicious desserts!!! Try the Bread pudding... YUMMY!!! BON APPETITE!!!!

While I was in Chicago visiting a friend we were trying to decide on what to do for lunch. Subway came up as an option and I mentioned maybe we try something unique to Chicago since I can get Subway back home anytime. She suggested Panes and I double checked to make sure I could get a sandwich, since I was really wanting one at this point and she said yes. So we drove over there and parked on the street.  I decided I wanted a Turkey Club and ordered and just as I was getting out my credit card, the woman working said they don't take credit, it was cash or check only. Being that I didn't have any cash on me, my friend picked up my tab.  I ordered the turkey club, with no cheese and a water. I asked for a pickle, because I'm pregnant and really, what pregnant woman doesn't love pickles? I mean, come on! But they didn't have pickles, so, better luck next time. The sandwich comes with a side of potato chips (which to me, tasted like Lays). I asked for water and she pointed me to this little side bar, that had a set up for old fashioned plastic glasses and a little freezer well for ice and a special little spout, just for water. It was quite cute. After my friend finished ordering and paying, they gave her a number to put on a stand when we chose a table.  I went and got water and sat down. The cafe itself is cute and small. It has very tall ceilings and an open feel. It has about 12 tables inside, maybe 15 at most and a seating area outside as well. After I sat down, I noticed an ATM, in case you didn't have cash.  They brought our food out within 5 minutes of sitting down and everything looked great. Once I took one bite of my sandwich I realized I had been there before. I asked my friend if her brother lived near there and she said he did, about a block away (at one time, he's since moved) and I asked if she had brought me there before and she remembered a time when we had been there. How funny! Something as simple as a turkey sandwich, but I remembered it from my past, and about 13 years ago too I might add. So if that says anything about the flavor. It definitely stands out.  We spent some time reminiscing from that visit so many years ago and I noticed she didn't order a sandwich, but she had what appeared to be eggs. I asked what it was and she told me Chilaquiles Verdes. Which I had never heard of before. However, my well traveled friend, who recently spent close to a year in Mexico, knew exactly what they were and explained the ingredients to me. Crispy tortilla strips, simmered in fresh green tomatillo sauce, shredded chicken breast, scrambled eggs and potatoes. She offered a bite to me and I gave it a try. It was pretty good, with a little spicy kick to it.  After we were done eating we bussed our own table and put our stuff in the designated area. It was good, so good I remembered it from so many years ago. What a nice blast from my past. I'd recommend giving it a try if you're in the area, it's a quaint little cafe.
The only restaurant in the city I travel for; amazing place, unbeatable quality and prices. Eat here once a week at least, try it out if you haven't been. Their brunches on weekends are a tradition

I'm laughing out loud about how much I enjoy Panes. Their sandwiches are amazing, lots of that has to do with the fresh baked bread they use. I rock the Super Panes to quench my taste for ham turkey and bacon in one bite. My roommate swears by the Oaxaccan Pork. Guess what? They also serve breakfast sandwiches which are bomb dot com ... and maybe the best french toast i've ever heard. Hello! It's a bread cafe.

The Pollo Diablo is my go-to sandwich! This original bad boy of spicy chicken and spicy mayo NEVER FAILS!  The other winner is the Tortilla Salad, I usually ask for spinach instead of lettuce and ask for extra avocado - delicious!  Other standouts are the Cream of Tomato Soup (so creamy and sooooo good!) and the Monster Cookie (you just have to!). The owner and staff are nice people.  I work close by and have been coming here regularly for almost 8 years. They definitely notice when l haven't been coming in a while or when I deviate from my normal Pollo Diablo!

Quite possibly the best sandwiches in the city...the best sandwich bread at a minimum. The "Super Panes" is my favorite selection, the "Pollo Diablo" is a close second.  Don't miss an opportunity to give this place a shot the next time you're considering going the Subway or Jimmy Johns route.  Panes is guaranteed to win your business!
They have great, fresh bread and delicious sammies. The monster cookies are huge and absolutely amazing. Heat them up before you eat them. :)
The Turkey Turkey was sensational. Lots of delicious ingredients on tomato bread. Monster cookie, yummy!

By far one of the best sandwich places in the city.  Food is always very fresh, including the bread!  Great combinations on the menu but always check the specials board for some true gems.   ***MAKE SURE TO BRING CASH***. They only take cash or check and I've had to do the walk of shame to an atm a couple times.

The food is great, the menu has changed and now I want to eat there even more. Ironically, I lost my wallet (chasing kids and left on table). The owner came running out but I had already left. Called hours later, money still in wallet and waiting for me at restaurant with a smile. I've been going here for a very long time. Never a disappointment. My only suggestion: "can we get the sandwiches a little faster...hard to wait b/c they are so good!".
Cozy place , I went there few years back  and went back again and is just great food affordable with a lot of taste !

Very nice people, the sandwiches are bomb!!!! I had the chicken club and it was so good.. They bake their own bread and their bread is so good a little crispy on the out side and the inside nice and soft. Must try, u wont regret it.

The sandwiches here may be a mix of fire biscuits and a full turkey on thanksgiving. I would highly recommend the turkey turkey. Only problem is only cash... Get with the times it is 2015.  Kind Regards, Your son
There is only one Panes. From homemade breads  and sandwiches,  to delicious soups and creative desserts,  I love this place!

The chicken diablo? was pretty good! I wish I asked for a different kind of bread though, I didn't realize that I had to specifically ask for it. The chicken tortilla soup was meh, it tasted like a normal chicken broth soup, there was no tortilla in it, just carrots and hard chicken. Would stick to only the sandwich next time.

Panes saved my butt last week when when I worked overnight shifts and just didn't have it in me to cook. I ordered a sandwich - often the Oaxacan Pork or Turkey Turkey - and asked that half be packed to go for dinner while I ate the other half in house. They were more than obliging and even gave me extra chips each time (hopefully it wasn't a pity move!). I live a block away and use Panes as my regular go-to for something fast, delicious, and time-saving. Their Monster Cookie is the best little gift to lock up for a friend or roommate who is feeling down; the homemade bread selection doesn't leave me wanting for a neighborhood bakery. It's great that it's a mom&pop place, which makes me feel so much better about patronizing it.

Neighborhood gem! Incredibly delicious sandwiches & desserts! Smaller space but great for dates or just spending some time reading or writing! The goat milk chocolate chip caramel cheesecake is UNDENIABLE!

I love this place.  I've been stopping here for10+ years, not as often now that we've moved north.  But any time I know I'm driving by, I make a point to stop and buy the banana bread (a must) and the Pompazo chicken sandwich.  THE BEST !!!

The Pollo Diablo sandwich made on their fresh baked Tomato Bread is something to write home about. When it comes to dining out, I never choose chicken because nothing compares to the tender, juicy beer-can chicken off the grill at home. But Yelpers convinced me to try this Pollo Diablo sandwich here at Panes, and I am so glad I did. Juicy, delicious and sooooooo tender! This sandwich is described on the menu to have some kick to it, but I never discern such. I think they dilute the sriracha with too much mayo.  FYI, when I ask for onions added to any of their sandwiches, all they have to offer are sweet caramelized onion. I like happen to enjoy these onions, but some people probably wouldn't --they are super sweet! They are so sweet in fact, I had to inquire about their preparation. And the answer is yes, the onions are caramelized with sugar. Stuffed mushrooms are well executed, and the surrounding marinara sauce is a great touch, but... $3.75 for 4 small 'shrooms is steep. Taking home fresh loaves of bread is always a win. They are super delicious and very reasonably priced. I like the country white for homemade grilled cheese.  I love how they roast the vegetables for the sandwiches, rather than putting them on an oily grill. I am usually afraid to order Portabella sandwiches at any restaurant, because I know that mushroom is a sponge for oil. Panes takes the danger out of ordering mushrooms; their roasting process is spot on!  Go to Panes and order off their menu freely. I'm quite certain everything is a win.  They just know how to create tasty stuff. But with that said, whatever you choose, do not order a monster cookie! I repeat: Do NOT order a monster cookie. They are too good and I want them all to myself. #cookiemonsterindisguise

Panes is a neighborhood gem. Fantastic sandwiches (pollo diablo, todo italiano just to name two) and amazing desserts, especially the carrot cake. Be sure to try your sandwich on their tomato bread. This place never disappoints.
Best sandwich's I have had in Chicago. All of their bread is homemade. The Turkey Turkey makes me wanna dance. Cash only.

They were open on New Year's Eve when everyone else nearby was closed. And I'm glad they were. I had a little pizza, and the staff was super chill and made a pretty good hot, flavorful and simply but well presented pizza for under $7 after tax. They had a readily available drinking water station, and didn't pressure me to buy anything more than what I wanted. This is a cool place that I'll definitely eat at again.
Everything is amazing. Especially the Pollo Diablo, tomato bread, and the meatball sandwich (the meatball is a special only). The Pollo Diablo ON tomato bread is really good too.

This is my favorite neighborhood cafe. They deliver exceptional value in both food quality and service. I've never had anything here that disappoints. The sweets are very hard to avoid... especially those damn monster cookies. Great kid friendly staff. They also have a great breakfast menu served on Sundays.

I asked my husband to bring home bread, so he stops here on his way.  He actually bought white bread (like a brick) monster cookies (just plain awful - like sawdust and they smelled bad) mint brownies (my mouth tasted like toothpaste for hours after) and banana bread which frankly I'm just not willing to try.  What a horror.
I've only been here twice, and both times I got the Pollo Diablo.  Great great great sandwich.  Food is super cheap too, under $10.  Highly recommend if you are in the area and want something quick!

I had the pollo Diablo and my friend had the ham and cheese. Even though they were both simple sandwiches we both enjoyed them. They bake their own bread for the sandwiches and you can tell once you bite into it. This place is quaint and cozy and I enjoy supporting small businesses. Cash only. Also I tried the ginger roll with pumpkin cheesecake and white chocolate ganache and it was just the right amount of sweet.
Very very  good sandwiches ,however , I am Bummed about the price increase to $7.25. Used to be worth it but now there are similar priced places where u get a lot more for the same price.

After a late Saturday night, I returned my rental car to the Enterprise on Sheffield and went looking for a breakfast place to sit and enjoy some coffee while I finally woke up.  I was headed for the Wellington Brown line stop when I saw the sign for this  quirky little shop.  A bread cafe.  Sounds perfect! I ordered a breakfast sandwich with bacon and cheddar and a cup of coffee.  In short order, a paper-lined plastic basket was delivered to my table with my sandwich and an order of breakfast potatoes.  The sandwich was divine!  The eggs were perfectly cooked, there was just enough cheese, and the bacon was crispy (without asking!)  The bread was pillowy soft, but not in a wonder-bread kind of way.  In a we-know-how-to-bake-delicious-bread way.  I don't like a sandwich that has such hard bread that the fillings go splat! right onto the table. The potatoes were rather bland, even with the little cup of ...chili sauce? that came with it.  I was expecting some kind of hot sauce, but it was only a little bit spicier than ketchup.   The dining room of this little place is so cute.   There's an eclectic mix of signs and pictures, but my favorite is a painting that looked like it was WPA-era (it wasn't) and depicted bread-making as being similar to giving birth.  I guess it's not far from the truth, actually.  Isn't bread the staff of life?  And the bread here is really, really good.

Pollo diablo was really good.  The sandwich is pretty big so was going to only eat half but it was to good!  8 bucks for a sandwich and chips not bad.  Got the BBQ sauce on the side and it was super salty but warm and good.  Def will be coming here a lot during my lunch breaks.  Bring cash! Update- came here again and ordered the pompanzo or whatever.. The last sandwich on the menu.  Super good!!! How do they get the chicken so juicy? Yum!  Had to give the BBQ sauce one more shot but it was extremely salty and pretty unbearable!  Never ordering that again.  Also not that big of a deal but prices online are different from the actual place.  All the sandwiches are around 8-9$ bucks.. Can't wait to try something else here! Turkey turkey isn't horrible but not the best thing here.. If anything just get the tomato bread cause that was the best thing about the sandwich.. Everything else was average!

I finally had cash on me (this place is cash only) and a hankering for a quick take-out brunch so I ventured in to Panes Bread Cafe. Between my husband and I, we got the House Chilaquiles and the Popular Sandwich. The chilaquiles was unique in the type of sauce they cooked it in, the texture was on point, and it had a great medley of Mexican flavors layered inside. The side of potatoes were wonderful as well. The sandwich was equally as flavorful: the tomato bread the perfect sweet and savory base, and the caramelized onions a wonderful addition. You can tell everything here is homemade and well thought out, we will absolutely be back to try some other things on the menu!

Great little bread/sandwich shop!  Sandwiches are good, sweet French bread is outstanding!  Soups are good.  Desserts are usually very good.  They deliver quickly.  Prices are very reasonable.  It is cash only which I don't mind at all.  I'd much rather give my money to the local business than to the Visa corporation.  The only thing wrong with this place is the turkey they use.  It is a chopped/pressed sort of meat kind of like a chicken nugget type of meat.  I can't believe they are still using this turkey, but whatever.  I just don't order anything with turkey on it.  One other complaint is that the portions of meat on sandwiches can be kind of hit or miss.  Service is good, but usually not overly friendly.  Overall, I highly recommend this place!  I would give them 5 stars if they had better turkey...

One of my fave sandwich spots! The food is delicious and inexpensive - all sandwiches are less than $6. They make their bread fresh every day and boy does it make a difference. My personal favorite is the Oaxacan Sandwich but I am also a fan of the Tuna Blanca and the Roasted Beef. I also look for their potato salad (garlicky and yummy) as well as the chocolate mousse dessert (it's like heaven). Don't forget to check out the daily specials on the board. It is a small restaurant but I usually have not had an issue with getting seating. If you are ordering to go, it will take about 10-15 minutes but the wait is worth it. Also note that this place is cash only.

This place is CASH ONLY (personal checks are accepted here as well).   My intention was to get a sandwich or soup, but with $2, it didn't get me far enough for have a real meal.   They have an ATM on site though, but it was out of order.  How did I know that?  My husband was assigned to fix the machine, and that was why I was here.  Make sense now? Anyways, I got myself a mint chocolate cookie for $1.75.  I'm assuming the tax was included because the price was what exactly listed on the menu.  It was delicious and not too tiny.  Everyone seemed to be friendly and was not too crowed like other cafe places in Lakeview neighborhood.  I wish I wasn't "poor" so that I could try their food.  Other patrons were dining in there and they did look appetizing...oh bummer!   They do have wifi available...and a nice patio!

Another great review to add to the list!  Panes is one of our favorite places in our neighborhood.  The Turkey Turkey and Chicken Tortilla Salad are my favorites and everything is fresh and tasty each visit.   The prices are awesome and a great value for the quality.

I'm not really sure why it's taken me so long to write this review-especially since I've been coming here at least once a week since January. The sandwiches are all pretty big and come with a side of chips. The pizza is better most of the other pizza I've had in Chicago, the salads (especially the chicken tortilla salad) are huge and the mac in cheese is the perfect comfort food. Panes is the kind of place that you could spend an hour relaxing in. Everyone that works there is always has a smile on their face. It's cash only so make sure you come prepared.

Delicious home made bread and sandwiches. Great value and great chill atmosphere. I've not had a bad soup or sandwich here and always consistently good - difficult for some of the neighbourhood restaurants to do. Beware it's cash only.

Panes Bread Cafe is a neighborhood gem that has been near the corner of Sheffield and Wellington for 1,000,000 years.  Ok, it's only been 20 years.  20 YEARS!!!!   How do I know?  I used to live around the corner when they opened up.  '93 or '94.   20 years later Panes is still one of THE best sandwich shops in the City of Chicago.  Sadly, they have had a massive price increase over the years:  their excellent, best in the city sandwiches now cost $5.95 instead of $4.95.  the nerve. The same lady has been running the place the entire time (forgive me, Panes Lady...after 20 years and 200 sandwiches, I should know your name, but I don't!).  She's 20 years older, I'm 20 years older, and Panes still completely blows the doors off of nearly every other sandwich joint in the city.  Quietly, calmly, and efficiently, I might add. It's cash only.  So if you don't have $10 in your pocket, don't come.  They don't deep-fry anything, so if you're looking for a gut-bomb, this ain't yer joint.  And they do great pastas, fresh bread to go, and some simple yet not-every-day desserts as well. Panes is small, so seating is tight, and at lunch time it's hard to get a seat.  But they are excellent at carry out, so take it to go and enjoy it at your own place where you have all the room in the world to savor the outstanding ingredients and fresh bread that make their sandwiches so spectacular. The Popular, the Pompazo, the Pollo Diablo, the Roasted Beef, the Super Panes...all are FABULOUS.  But don't ask me about the Oaxacan Pork - because I don't want you numskulls ordering it and then there won't be any left for me!  (Ok, it's really, really good!) For pastas, their Panes Linguini is a rock solid takeout winner at only $7.50. Panes is just great all-around:  great people, great place, great sandwiches, great pastas, great bread, great prices, and a great 20 year track record. Panes, congratulations on 20 years, and please, please, please stay open for 20 more!

I distinctly recall visiting here during a Chicago visit circa 2007.  Seven years later, Panes was remembered fondly.  I sought this place out again upon returning to Chicago in March 2014 because what ever better to do on a winter evening of a blustery -15 degrees than to walk two miles for a sandwich and a tiny buckeye.  Slipping on ice works up an appetite.   For less than the price of the generically vapid and unvaried chain deli lunchtime sandwich, you can support a lovely little local deli with fresh bread and giant sandwiches made to order.  My favorite is the Pollo Diablo.  It's not that spicy if you're a spicy lover.  The sandwiches are hearty and huge.  See pics; they're totally instragram worthy.   I love taking friends here for lunch.  They love it and they love the prices.  It's cute and no frills and a hidden gem.

Best sandwich shop in the city.  Bread is fresh, delicious and makes the sandwich.  I've lived in the neighborhood for 14 years, and Panes has been there for as long and longer, and there's a reason why.  Don't forget to bring cash though.  No cc's accepted.

The sandwiches are amazing, you can't go wrong here. I will be back often. I had two appointments today with an hour in between so I wanted to grab lunch and thought I would see what you want. They're very small not a lot of seating they do have outside seating. My lunch was absolutely amazing, and then the smells  from them making fresh bread was

I've heard great things about this place, but only recently, after moving to Lakeview, did I finally get to try it. I've had the Popular, the Pollo Diablo, and the Sloppy Pollo. The Popular is definitely my favorite so far, but everything I've had has been very tasty.  The only negative is that this place is cash only, which is a little inconvenient, but it definitely won't stop me from going back!
Bad attitude.  I ordered a coffee which apparently is hard to make since it took forever.

Super fresh, great spot for lunch. Like so many other say it's important to know that they're check or cash only. Everything here tastes like it's just been made - and most of it has. The homemade bread is awesome - especially love the tomato bread and also one of the loaves that has rosemary in it. All the desserts I have has there have been awesome. My standbys are the chicken tortilla salad and the turkey turkey sandwich - but everything I have had has been great. Soups are great in the colder months. Cute place to eat in or take away.
This place is phenomenal. Great sandwiches for a great price. Love bringing my pup over to sit on the patio.

Panes is especially for those days when you realize you're spending way too much on eating out but you also just happened to not bring a lunch. They have delicious, huge sandwiches at a very reasonable price. I got the special written on the chalkboard which was a steak sandwich with mushroom & pepper jack. The bread is crispy on the outside and warm and toasty on the inside. All the ingredients are fresh and very hearty. I can easily split the sandwich into two meals.  Come here if you have 45 minutes to spare and relax. It is one of the best places for lunch if you want something quick.   Bonus! Sometimes they have bread out on the front counter to sample.

I lived right next to Panes for a year, and I fricken loved this spot. Here's what I recommend: 1.) Order Pompazo. 2.) Take a bite or two of the sample cookie they likely have on the counter. 3.) Enjoy some of that free filtered ice water (note: ice is there, just lift up that black knob and use the ice scooper they place in an empty cup). 4.) Grab a copy of today's paper that they have on display for you. 5.) Get caught up on current events while you enjoy the wonderful atmosphere of a mom & pop restaurant in Chicago. 6.) Eat Pompazo and resist making a bunch of noises prompted by the pure deliciousness. 7.) Leave feeling satisfied. 8.) Return next day and repeat steps 1 through 7. Enjoy.

Fantastic sandwiches with fresh bread... Love this place to pick up to go as well as have a nice relaxing meal there. It used to be our place in the winter or when sick for the bread and soups, but it has now become a favorite at all times of the year!

Such a great lunch place. It's a very cute place. A good amount of outdoor seating. It's cash only. They have a large menu but only a few options (if that makes any sense). It's a bakery, so they stick to sandwiches and pastries. I tried the turkey, turkey sandwich. It was delicious and so big. I can't wait to go back to try their desserts
I have gotten sandwiches from here multiple times and they are always amazing! It is a must try and it's a great price.

This is one of my favorite sandwich and salad places in Chicago. Everything is fresh and delicious. I enjoy their turkey turkey sandwich on focaccia and their chicken tortilla salad best. I always have to get a monster cookie for me and my husband. I even gave their monster cookies to all my wedding guests.

I love the sandwiches from here. They are fresh and delicious. I also enjoy eating at the location as is is usually clean and presentable with AC and space to talk and eat. I DO NOT LIKE the fact that they do not accept credit cards, there would be more business here if credit cards were accepted. Had to deduct a star for this. Change it and I'll add!. :) very much enjoy Panes so far though.
Absolute best sandwich place. Get the turkey turkey on tomato bread or the pollo diablo. Cash only! You can't go wrong with panes

Stopped in with my daughter for lunch before the Cubs game yesterday.  Seemed like it took a long time to get just 2 sandwiches.... but then I realized why: They were not just thrown together.  They were expertly crafted, warm and toasty.  Great bread.  Great ingredients.  Great value!  I wish it were closer to home.  Can't wait to go back!

The Super Panes sandwich is awesome!  Fresh bread, delicious toppings and it is a good size.  This place is small and gets packed around lunch.  Cash only so plan accordingly.  I go out of my way to stop here if I am in the area.

Omg I love panes. I would go here once a week when I lived in Chicago, but now i go whenever I'm back in town. I normally get the spicy chicken and it's delicious. The bread always seems like it was baked the same day. And the truffles are to die for.

I ordered the spicy philly sandwich (to go). The bread was a bit mushy for my taste and although it looked like it would have a strong (hot/spicy) flavor, it was quite bland. The filling didn't have a ton of taste either, and the cheese was barely present. It was messy to eat and overall, a big miss on flavor. Served with a small bag of Lay's chips. $7 is a good price in Chicago for what would appear to be a filling sandwich, but it just wasn't that great. I would give this place another shot to try their other breads or desserts, all of which looked really appetizing in the pastry cases.

California with grilled chicken. OMG. This sandwich is hitting all the right spots right now!!!  By far one of my favorite establishment in this. The crunch on this sandwich...but yet so airy inside. Love, love, love this place.

Really excellent sandwiches that a decent price (even for the neighborhood!). By really excellent, I mean that the ingredients were all balanced and fresh.  I also love bread so anyone with great bread gets 5 stars in my book!

I have had the B.l.t and the Oaxacan Pork so far. The Oaxacan Pork was fantastic, but truth be told the B.l.t was to die for. It was a symphony in your mouth. Yes I know how that may sound and I do not care. I really don't get how places like Subway even exist when you can eat and I do mean truly eat at a place like Panes Bread Cafe. The two sandwiches I so far have had were filling and truly delicious. They were real food.. It is authentic, nothing fake or inauthentic about this cafe in the least little bit. Plus do not skip the deserts which are really beyond yummy. Everyone here is super friendly and they really take pride in their work.

This place has the BEST Sweet French Bread - if you are get ting a sandwich get it on this - if you are getting something else, order a side of it.  You will not be sorry!  Also the perfect way to finish off your meal is with one of their amazing Buckeyes.   Bethany H

CASH ONLY! Just a heads up. Their bread is really good. I had the Diablo chicken sandwich and it was really good and really cheap. I also had the pasta which was pretty good. I like their bread they give you before you eat because you can tell they are fresh. The monster cookie was really good too. Is it mind blowing? No, but it is clean, friendly, good and cheap.

The reviews here are incredible, but I must have swung and missed during my experience, since I thought the food was pretty average. The Pizza Bread appetizer/starter was pretty bland and my Pollo Diablo was served on some pretty tasty bread but was light on filling...this ended up being a blessing in disguise, since I walked to DMK next door for a stellar chocolate shake.  The potato chips on the side were also pretty plain and there were not many of them.  But I love anything BYO and the outdoor patio was perfect two days ago for sitting outside with my big (11 peeps) team of friends. If I lived closer, I might try other things on the menu but I'm not sure I'd be back.  I will give Panes big props for being priced appropriately...for $6.50, you get an average sandwich of average size.
Omg love this place! Super friendly and clean .great sitting area in the front ! Soup and the cookies r da bomb!!

The bread is great! That's what makes it. Local - fresh - family owned. What more could you ask for.  Turkey, Turkey was very good. Had their coca cola cake with goat cheese cream cheese frosting. Also very good.

One of my favorite places in the city.  Always fresh, always tasty.  The prices are very affordable and the food is delicious.  It's a local place you feel good giving your money to because of their customer service and because it's a family-owned business.  Highly recommend!

The Popular sandwich is pretty good. The monster cookie is great if you want something sweet! The food is solidly good, not great. I've never left disappointed but also never blown away. Just a sandwich.  The prices are ok. My big complaint is CASH ONLY.  I live just down the street and would probably go there much more often if they took cards but I never cary cash. Especially now that City Dough is across the street. CD is not as good but I've gotten lunch from there a couple times now just because I didn't have cash, even though I would have preferred Panes.

In Order of Importance Final Word: Great (semi)hidden neighborhood gem.  More than just sandwiches.  And don't forget that it's BYO. The Deets: * Food: The bread is fresh and great (it's also a bakery).  90% of the sandwiches are better than mom's.  Pasta and side dishes hold their own too.  Just a great quick neighborhood staple. * Service: n/a.  No wait staff.  The lady behind the cash register is usually pretty friendly though! * Atmosphere: Eh.  Definitely not a white table cloth spot, but if you can get a seat at the few tables they have outside during the summer, you'll be in great shape. * When: More times than I can count.
The real deal. Excellent sandwiches and baked goods. We tried the Oaxacan Pork, it was delicious and a generous portion (big enough for two). Nice front patio too.

This place is a great little cash-only cafe in Lakeview. It's an order-at-counter-and-get-served-at table place and the staff was very friendly. There's an outdoor patio to go along with the indoor seating.  I got their Pollo Diablo sandwich, which was a great value at $7. The bread was unbelievable and fresh out of the oven. Their baked goods looked great too. Unfortunately, they don't have WiFi, otherwise it might be worth 6 stars.

Great prices! I had the tortilla salad and it was really good! Friendly staff and nice interior. The reason I don't give the place a five was because they only took cash. Kind of annoying since I had to go out and look for an atm.

Awesome food, my wife has been visiting this place since she was a child. Took me last week for my first time and it was just delicious. We had attempted to come a few months ago but it was cash-only and we didn't have cash. I'm usually not so happy when restaurants take cash only because it makes it an inconvenience for people who dot carry cash as myself. But since my wife kept saying how great it was we made sure to bring cash... Definitely great and we  recommend the "pollo diablo" with tomato bread.
Love this place. I always get the sandwiches.. right now I'm eating a veggie combo-something. SO GOOD

I've been to Panes 5 times in the past 2 weeks so I feel I can write an meaningful review:  Dessert- white chocolate rice pudding, banana nut bread, m&m cookies- 4 stars. the rice pudding was actually 5 stars because it's one of my all time favorite desserts and this place has some of the best I've ever had Sandwiches- I've had 4 diff types I can't the specific names but definitely not above 3 stars. the Philly was not good and I wouldn't order that again, chicken pesto was meh and prosciutto was decent, meatball sub was decent but the meatballs could be more flavorful.  Bread- good bread if you're looking for something to add to dinner this is definitely a solid bread place 4 stars for bread Pasta- 2 stars. Bland. I ordered some creamy tomatoe basil pasta and added the meatballs. It wasn't a bad flavor it just had no flavor.  Coffee- 1 star. Definitely skip the coffee. It is terrible  CASH ONLY!  which is annoying.

I came here because my friend said they have the best French toast he's ever had. This was after I was done raving about the French toast at Lula Café... So naturally I had to check this place out. Well... The French toast was okay, it was a bit dry and just was mediocre, and.... That's all. I tried the bread pudding too, which was ok. They had some good chocolates though... The Oaxaca chocolate was good! As far as the atmosphere... Very casual and the shop itself is small. Not really my kind of place. Cash only too.

So happy we found this place! The sandwiches were delicious, the prices were great, and we tried some of the peanut butter Buckeyes and totally fell in love. A great little place to enjoy a nice sandwich! I had the Ponzo -- so yummy. We'll be back!

Very tasty sandwiches. The best part is the bread; they probably have the best sandwich bread in the city. My only complaint is the Pollo Diablo is not spicy at all. Also, spicy mayo is basically an oxymoron.
Amazing sandwiches! Me and my friend aren't from the area and it was by far the best place we ate all trip. Cheap too. You will not be disappointed!

This place is awesome. They have fresh bread to buy including banana bread. The soups and salads are good but the sandwiches are what they're best at. The portobello is my favorite. It is cash only but there is an ATM close by.

Pretty solid sandwiches and they make their bread fresh everyday.  Make sure to bring cash because that's all they take - which is a pain.  I always get the club or the turkey turkey.  Desserts are pretty tasty, too.  Nice spot to take someone who has never been there and impress them with your neighborhood gem sandwich shop finding skills.  Definitely will get ya some street cred.

When it's a cold day or your just in the move for a comfort sandwich, head over to panes. I'm a fan of their tortilla soup and the roast beef! Mmmmm!  Do know that they only take cash so check your wallet before you make your way there.
Great food it's near my house and I go in at least once a week for a soup and a sandwich. Recommend going for Sunday brunch, French toast or chalaquiles taste great!!!  Heads up Cash or check only

I had the oaxacan pork and the pollo diablo. They both were toasty, soft, warm, and tasty!  I do wish the flavors were a bit more intense, but I would recommend. I'll definitely return when in the area. Oh yes, and cash only.
Had a chicken sandwich from there, it was tasty, but got food poisoning (it was the only thing I ate that day when it hit).

Nom. So glad I was finally able to try Panes! I know Panes is mostly known for their sandwiches, but this is definitely a hidden excellent breakfast gem. Came in with the boyfriend on a snowy Saturday morning and it was basically empty. Panes has a casual atmosphere with a great homey feel to it. You order at the counter and then find a seat. We had a really difficult time deciding what to order, they have several omelet, egg scramble, and breakfast sandwich options. I ended up going with the roast beef egg sandwich and the boyfriend got an egg scramble with  veggies that he added bacon to. Our breakfast was incredibly inexpensive, I think the prices at Panes are a few dollars less than most breakfast places in the area.  Our food was up quickly and brought to our table. My sandwich was phenomenal! Plenty of perfectly cooked roast beef, muenster cheese, sweet caramelized onions, and scrambled egg on, what was definitely, a freshly baked sandwich roll. The flavors complimented each other so well and I had to forfeit some monster bites to my dining companion because it was so huge. The sandwich came with really tasty roasted potatoes. The boyfriend had an egg scramble with veggies and bacon that was incredibly flavorful. It also came with the roasted potatoes and a green salsa. We were given a basket of bread with our meal that just makes me want to come back and try ALL of their breads! Overall, I definitely recommend Panes for breakfast and will be returning for lunch!

Must try!  Panes is my absolute favorite and my neighborhood go to! You can't go wrong with any of the sandwiches,  fresh bread, or Sunday brunch.  Prices are reasonable but it is a cash only establishment. My favorites are the Turkey Turkey, Oaxacan Pork, Chicken Club, and the Chilaquiles or French Toast at brunch.

For lunch I ordered a House salad w/ Honey Mustard and Pollo Diablo (spicy chicken sandwich. Everything tasted great and the side of bread was a nice addition to the meal. I would have to say the Pollo Diablo wasn't as spicy as I anticipated, but besides that I had a full stomach until that evening. Definitely will return!

I love this place!! I have frequented it often. The prices are amazing (remember to bring cash, cash only). I don't frequent places often but the salads and sandwiches here, keep bringing me back. You can't go wrong.
Their bread & fresh-made desserts have me frequently stopping by to pick up a loaf for home and a goody box. Recommended: Cream Puffs Buckeyes & Truffles Olive Oil & Rosemary Baguette

My FAVORITE sandwich shop in Chicago.  I have been ordering the same item off of their menu for far too long, but it's just that good. I love the turkey turkey sandwich and their baked goods are divine.  I do wish they took other forms of payment besides cash, but it's worth the while. It also gives off a mom and pop vibe which is fun.

Did not enjoy my experience here! I came here after my victory at Integrity Motors with my new car (see my review) but I did not enjoy myself. I was in such a great mood after getting my car I wanted to eat and I've heard such great things about this. For starters, incredibly packed. I can forgive this because its supposed to mean its good right...? Lady taking my order seemed wayyyyy to overwhelmed. Again, forgiveable but I had a bad taste in my mouth.   Then they were out of tomatos... really? at a sandwich place? I was enjoying watching the pets on the patio until a rather ugly looking dog took an ugly looking dump right next to me by the window.  What?? The owner didn't even pick it up. AGAIN - I can't blame Panes but wow I was getting on my last nerve. Food comes, cash only (thankfully I had some on me) and my bread is soggy.  Just why, Oh Lord, just why. Left feeling disappointed and still hungry. Oh well, got my new car and this wasn't going to get me down.
Best sandwich place in the city of chicago! The turkey turkey is my favorite! Top it off with a monster cookie and you'll be in heaven.

Here for the first time and I love it. I got the Oaxacan pork sandwich which is the perfect combo of fresh bread, and a filling portion of meat and roasted peppers and sweet caramelized onions, accented with a very yummy savory sauce (chipotle mayo?) Comes with chips, which I could take or leave. The price is very agreeable also. I'm obliged to mention the cute and comfy ambience. Also, double doors keep the cold out which is nice as it is now January. :) I would return.

Woah. I have never had a sandwich on such fresh, warm, flavorful bread before!!! The bread truly makes the Panes experience. I would go back for another turkey club any day!! Positives: large menu, casual, amazing bread for all sandwiches Negatives: freezing cold in the restaurant during the winter, very busy but small seating space, fountain soda with no free refills

Food here - good. Seating here - cramped. I went here to try to write some comedy sketches with two funny ladies.  Loud and cramped on a weekend with delicious sandwiches was probably not the best working environment.

Shhhh don't tell Chez Fayala in SF, but I'm having a love affair with Panes Bread Cafe here in Chicago. Its placement just a block away from CorePower Yoga, its delicious tomato bread, large sandwich menu, and adorable atmosphere has enticed me to return again and again. I just scarfed down a whole sandwich between the Wellington station and Fullerton, if that's any indication if how delicious these sandwiches are. Or how hungry I was. Or how shameless I am.  Regardless, Panes makes sandwiches the way they should be made - with fresh bread, slightly toasted. So far I've had the Popular (a chicken sandwich on tomato bread with caramelized onions), the Turkey Turkey, and the portobello sandwich. The Turkey Turkey was, by far, my favorite. The other two were lacking slightly in flavor, but still gobbling-down-worthy. So next time you are in the market for a $7ish sandwich, head on over to Panes and eat some good food. They also have pizzas, pastas, salads, soups, and pastries, but I can't attest to any of those. And don't forget to bring cash or your checkbook! This place is old fashioned.

This bakery is close to me and I get baguettes occasionally.  They have a few varieties.  I like the rosemary.  I got a banana bread loaf and it was a little dry.  The prices are right but they only accept cash or cheques.

It's been a long while since I've stepped foot into Panes, but as I can see it's still going strong. My mother used to work late a lot and I would hang out at her office. So often times was our solution to dinner? Panes! I would always get their amazing BLT, chips, and a nantucket nectar. So good! It's a cozy little place, probably sits no more than 10-15 people, but the smells coming from the kitchen (which is 10 feet from the dining area) are amazing. I've had the goat cheese pizza on occasion, that too, is also one of my top 5 items to order. I better get my butt over to Panes soon! I'm starting to crave the BLT!
Stopped in to pick up some chocolate truffles. Yummy! Would have considered food here (all looked and smelled delightful), but was stuffed from brunch. FYI: cash or checks, no credit cards.
Delicious free bread -  Serve yourself water / ice bar - Quick turn around... This place is solid we had the egg spicy thing and it was great... A little oily but delicious.

I had high expectations of this place. I got a chicken sandwich (dont remember which one) but that says it all, cuz if I can't remember, it wasn't anything great. I wasn't impressed. Cute decor. Maybe had I tried something else I would've given it more stars....

3 words: Chicken Tortilla Salad. Just do it, you can't go wrong. Whatever dressing is on that salad is like crack... So amazing! My co-workers and I order out from here probably 2 times a week and it never fails. Sandwiches are good too but hard to go back after this salad. Cash only kinda sucks but just have to be prepared.

My wife and I have pretty high standards when it comes to quality food even though we have a very small budget right now in residency. Hence the reason we have been to Panes for dinner approximately 20 times since we moved to Chicago 1.5 years ago.  Seriously in love with their sandwiches and their soft breads.  My favorite's would be the Roast Beef (and I never order roast beef sandwiches), Pollo Diablo, Spicy Pollo, The popular, Super Panes.  Their pizza is pretty good and their pasta is also pretty good but neither are quite on the same level as their sandwiches.   The soft fresh bread is really what makes these sandwiches so addictive.  Very good quality.

I love this place the food is awesome! they have great soups and I've heard the pizzas are good but I have not tried them yet. I always get the turkey turkey sandwich which is amazing!!! They take some time making a couple sandwiches but when you get them it will be so worth it!
