They also have a cute pet friendly patio which I love to visit with my puppy :) Yeah yeah they don't take credit cards but their prices are quite reasonable and it is very good :D Too bad for my wallet I live a block away because it contributes to me being a regular :P you cant go wrong with this place! You can also buy loaves of bread to take home for breakfast or whatever !! I think they bake it there thats why its so good!!

Sandwiches=Great.  fav= the Super Panes Cash Only= Bad. I know credit cards take a small percentage of every sale, but I suspect that  you would gain more business by taking CCs, enough to cover the expense. In other words, I would probably eat here more often but I chose not to because I don't keep too much cash in my wallet.  And their coffee is below-average.

Love love love their food.  Always freshly made & reasonably priced.   The sweet French bread is to die for!   I don't live nearby but it's worth the trip & they never disappoint. Cash or Checks only.

Panes Bread Cafe is my go-to lunch place in the Lakeview area. The bread is so fresh (they sell the loaves right at the front) and the sandwiches, which are always made to order always fill you up and leave you satisfied. It's a great little place to catch up with friends and have a great meal. The soups, salads and desserts (mmmmm, the desserts!) are fresh and delicious as well. Yum! Can't wait to go back!

I love Panes! I live a few blocks away, and Panes is definitely my go-to lunch/dinner/whenever when I want something simple but delicious and don't want to cook for myself. My usual sandwich rotation includes The Popular and the Todo Italiano, but the Pollo Diablo is great, too. The woman behind the counter is super friendly, prices are reasonable, and there is ample seating inside and a cute little patio for when the weather is nice. A great neighborhood spot.  Also, you can buy loaves of their bread (tomato bread! sourdough! rosemary bread! oh my!) for cheap, so make sure to pick some up on your way out!
I love the Pollo Diablo sandwich! You have to have change or a check. No debit card accepted.

Typifies the modest neighborhood sandwich shop/bakery. Refreshing compared to the trendy spots nearby (DMK Burger, Fish Bar). I love this place - the food is good and the prices are fair. It's a small place, casual, and has an area for outdoor seating. I usually order the Pollo Diablo. It does get a little busy around meals.
MONSTER COOKIE!  great bread too - love the veggie cabra and the blt with cheese
Was very excited to eat here until I walked in and saw it was cash only!  Seriously?!?!  Is this 1950?!  You won't get my business until you operate in this century!

Best sandwich shop in the neighborhood. The sandwiches made on their tomato bread are AMAZING! My go-to sandwich is the Portobella on their tomato bread. All sandwiches always come with chips. The reason I cannot give this place 5stars is because they only except cash :/ total pain in the neck sometimes as I do not carry cash on me ever! Staff is always friendly and the sweets are also good. Get the peanut butter ball!

I didn't love this place as much as everyone else seems to love it...food was alright... customer service wasn't that great... however, It is very cheap and the taste is pretty good. I didn't like the fact that the bread was too crispy.. I usually like my bread a little crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I got the pollo diablo (chicken sandwich) which came with chips as well, I would recommend this for anyone that loves chicken, it was very flavor-able. I also got a salad... forgot which one.. I believe it was greek salad or something similar to that, I remember it having olives and grilled chicken... which was really good! This place is definitely better than all the other healthy sandwich shops and a lot cheaper as well... so can't complain. If I was in the mood to eat healthy, I wouldn't mind coming here again.

I have been eating here since 1995.  I love the bread they use on their club sandwich and I also love that for years they had Fresca on tap.  Bring back Fresca!  We moved away from Chicago over ten years ago but this is the first place we go when we come back to visit.  Sometimes we even go twice!  You seriously cannot get anything like Pane's on the West Coast, believe me, I've looked.

Honestly, I do not understand what all the hype is about. I find Panes' sandwiches to be substandard, at best. I've lived in the neighborhood nearly my entire life, and have been to Panes several times throughout the years, and after eating there today I finally felt compelled to write a review.  First off, their bread is really nothing to write home about. The roll I had today was just about one step up from a hamburger bun, and on par with a grocery store bought French roll. And the turkey they serve is just awful! I mean slimy, super processed, doesn't even mildly resemble what would come from a real turkey awful! I also shared a chicken sandwich with my husband and it was just edible (which is more than I could say for the turkey).  The only reason I gave this place two stars is because at least the prices are reasonable, and the only reason I've given this place so many tries is because it's close to my house, and sandwiches are my husband's favorite food. But we both agreed that today is officially our last time eating at Panes.  In a city full of amazing restaurants there is no need to waste your time, money or calories at Panes. If you want a great sandwich head over to Birchwood Kitchen and get a taste of what flavor and quality really are. And if you want something cheaper, stick with Jimmy John's or Potbelly's ... both are better than Panes!

Delicious, affordable sandwiches and great desserts. The Turkey Turkey sandwich with avocado on tomato bread is probably the best lunch option in the area.  The cream puff is a great pick-me-up, as is the monster cookie.

Their sandwiches are fantastic plus they are right around the corner from where we live so super convenient. Only downside is they are a cash only establishment. I have tried the the popular, the sloppy pollo, and the spicy philly. The spicy philly was definitely my favorite. The beef was tender and juicy, plus just the right spice. Also all kinds of bread to try and all of them are soft and delicious. I definitely recommend the tomato bread. A little on the small side as far as seating is concerned and they are always packed during popular times so I suggest coming in an off time.

This place is amazing. The sandwiches are incredible, and it's always hard to choose because they all sound so good and there is a lot of variety. The meals are inexpensive, and the restaurant has a charming, homey vibe. Love going here for a casual dinner with friends.

What is my favorite thing to do in Chicago?  Is it taking in a ballgame at historic Wrigley Field?  Is it checking out all the sights of downtown?  Is it going out to a few of the millions of bars that line the streets?  No, no, no.  It is, without a doubt, a visit to Panes for a Super Panes sandwich. The trip up to Chicago usually involves an hour long planning session detailing when my friends and I will go to Panes and what we will order.  That is usually followed up by three hours of narratives chronicling our favorite Panes sandwiches from days gone by. I'm not exactly sure what makes the sandwich so great.  I've tasted all the ingredients on their own and each is delicious but not exactly captivating.  Together, though, it all combines for an ambrosial and divine taste that is the perfect combination of salty and sweet.   For $5.95 you get the Super Panes and a bag of Lays potato chips.  You might think that is a yawn-inducing side but somehow the chips go perfectly with the sandwich.  Perhaps because it is hard to complain about anything when you are biting into a Super Panes.  For a few minutes, everything is right in the world. When I get back to St. Louis, I pretty much sit at home, stare out the window, and wait until I can go to Chicago and be reunited with a Super Panes.

Panes was my very first meal in Chicago when I moved a year ago. It is still my favorite comfort food day or night and in any season. I LOVE IT! True, it is cash only... but that adds to the charm. When you walk in you feel like you are a regular, even if it is your first time going. The food is great, they make their bread in the store, and the employees are so friendly! I love everything Panes

Do you mean to tell me I could have been coming here in 1994? When I was anticipating new Seinfeld episodes, living and hanging out in pre-hot, pre-self-conscious Andersonville, eating at The Dellwood Pickle on Friday nights, tooling around in my '93 Camry, debating O.J.'s guilt or innocence? Well, yeah. I coulda. And recently I found what I was missing. Another fine sandwich place in East Lakeview. My friend Heathcliff and I came in for a Friday Old Man lunch. The place was consistently busy but never crowded. The only challenge was the strollers. Kind of a cozy and close place which I don't think was necessarily contemplating strollers. But the clientele was a mix of local professionals, and young families. We ordered The Turkey, Turkey, and the BLT, and did the old bite 'n switch by sharing very generous-sized halves. Both sandwiches were scrumptious mouthfuls of fresh, fresh bread and an exciting combo of meats, cheese, veggies and avocado. I am officially going to stop making my own sandwiches. There are too many other people who make them better. Love the casual bakery vibe here, too. Loaves to take away, of course. Even though a polite little sign almost apologized for a price increase, all of their choices whether salads, sides, pasta dishes and sandwiches, are all very reasonable. Their generous and toothsome sandwiches are all around $5.95. They would be twice as much at Jerry's, for example. So even the prices are kind of 1994. I'm so happy I finally made it here. Yummy, yummy, yummy, got a loaf in my tummy..

5 stars, best sandwiches I've found in Chicago. The Turkey Turkey is my favorite; even though I've branched off and tried others, I always go back to the Turkey Turkey. I love sitting in there b/c it's such a unique hole in the wall that no one really talks about but it's always sure to fill up on a Saturday or Sunday morning. And for some reason their potato chips taste so good. They deliver, too, so that's a huge bonus! Also, it's cash/check only.

I'm giving Panes five stars based on one menu item. There BLT sandwich is the best in the city and to-date the best I have tasted anywhere. You must order it with cheese, after that just savor every bite. The bacon is cooked perfectly (no soggy bacon here), fresh tomatoes and lettuce, mix that with their home cooked bread :-) There is a reason this place gets great reviews, fair prices + great food = happy people.  PS: for desert try the white chocolate rice pudding, Yum!

This is a great little restaurant in Lakeview.  I have tried a lot of their items and have not had a bad one yet.  The Rosemary Olive Oil loaf is amazing!  The Sunday Omelets are a great deal; eggs, potatoes, toast, salsa and a decent price.  They do only take Cash or Checks, which can be a bummer sometimes, but since I am aware of that fact, its not really a problem.

The sandwiches are fresh and tasty. I tried the pasta special, which had spicy peanut sauce. It wasn't perfect, but was creative and generously sized. The prices are surprisingly low. The order-at-the-counter service was friendly and efficient. They don't have a children's menu, but my daughter enjoyed the tomato soup.

Very cute neighborhood establishment with great food.  I was reminded how much I love Panes after stopping in after too long since my last visit.  My favorite is the Roasted Beef sandwich.  The combination of roast beef, grilled onions and spicy mayo is heavenly.  I've tried their desserts on numerous occasions and they've never disappointed.  The pastas are always good -check the board for specials.

This place is good if you're in the area anyway. If I lived close by, I could see myself stopping by regularly for a quick bite, but I wouldn't go out of my way to try this place again. It's a cute, hole in the wall type spot. The seating is overly cramped, and on a Saturday at noon, there was a steady line of people, so don't expect to enjoy a leisurely lunch or a comfortable chat after finishing.  Water is self-serve, with an ice-bin and ice-scoop that are probably health code violations if I've learned anything from watching Restaurant Impossible. Also, it's cash only! The prices here are great - 5.95 for their blackened tilapia sandwich special, which came with chips on the side.  The sandwich was very solid, but nothing that blew my mind - the fish was surprisingly flavorful and well seasoned, and with none of that "fishy" taste I was half expecting.  The garlic mayo was better than I expected.  But, the sandwich was pretty greasy, with the bread in particular rather than the actual innards, somehow being oily to the point that when I touched the bread it left a film of oil on my fingers. I agree with a previous reviewer that a side of something lighter like salad or fruit would have been much better than chips, which tasted exactly like Lay's. Summary - solid, good-tasting sandwich, but overly greasy and nothing out of the norm - a good option for a neighborhood joint if you live in the area that offers a simple, quick bite.

The sandwich I ate here ranks among the most amazing sandwiches I've ever eaten in my entire life. And I've eaten a lot of amazing sandwiches! I came here on a Thursday for lunch with some co-workers, and the tables were surprisingly full for a neighborhood place. It is sort of cramped inside, so maybe it just made it feel packed. You order at the counter, and they give you a number for your table. Then when your food is ready, they bring it to your table. That's how it works. Nothing too revolutionary, but it got the job done. I ordered the Turkey, Turkey sandwich, which has turkey breast, chopped avocado, roasted red peppers and spicy mayo on tomato bread. OMG! I already want another and then one for the road. It was so delicious. The sandwich was soft and juicy everything I could have ever hoped for. The flavors were spot on. I ate the whole thing without a problem. Delish! It came with potato chips.  I thought the menu was very reasonably priced. My sandwich was $5.95; all of their sandwiches range between $5.25 and $5.95. Not bad at all. They also offer salads, pizzas, pastas and omelets. Then, of course, they have cookies and other sweets. Lots of variety. I guess the only negative I had is that it's cash only. I actually didn't have any cash on me at the time, so my co-worker had to front the money. It worked out fine, but if I had been alone, they would have lost my business. I know places don't want to pay credit card transaction fees, but they're missing out on a lot of business by not accepting credit cards. It's kind of my pet peeve. OK, I'm done with my cash-only rant. I feel much better now. Conclusion: GREAT SANDWICHES and BRING CASH!

The Oaxacan Pork Sandwich & the Pollo Diablo are delicious. Two sandwiches were $13 something & included potato chips. So you get top notch, fresh, delicious sandwiches for the same price as Subway- no competition.  Will be back to try more sandwiches and the delicious looking desserts.

I seriously can't get enough of this place. It's pretty small and sometimes filled with a lot of the hospital employees, but I always get my food to go so it's never really a big deal. It is a little pricy, but the quality of the food is definitely worth it. The ladies at the counter are always friendly and you will never have to wait very long for your food. All of the sandwiches come with chips and all of the pasta dishes come with bread and butter. Also, they have pretty much every kind of Nantucket Nectar juice ever made which is heaven for a lost New England girl like me! I recommend the mac and cheese and the chicken pesto sandwich (forgot the name, but it has one.) Oh yeah, and they don't take cards. :(

I actually think I eat here too much. Yet, it's just that good and reasonably priced ... I can't stay away. I must order the Chicken Club a few times a week at least; it is awesome! Recently started to explore other options there, like their chicken alfredo with broccoli - it's very good. Tried their greek salad (or similarly named) and that is also really good. A great place in general for a sandwich, coffee, pasta, or salad. No plastic accepted and the lines are long. My only complaint is that they should have a separate area for take out orders - doesn't make a lot of sense to order ahead of time only to get there and have to wait sometimes 10 or 15 minutes to actually pay and pick up your order behind walk-ins ordering as well. Now it seems they may need another phone line as I have called several times today trying to place an order and they are not picking up. They're slammed right now for sure - Sunday's are the only day they do omelets (try the goat cheese one - it's incredible). Offering omelets every day would be a good idea, too.

Cute little neighborhood cafe - a family run busines. I went there right after I had a massage next door to have a quick bite and fell in love with this colorful, warm and friendly cafe! All bread is baked freshly there, which is great. You can eat in or take some fresh bread home with you. I had a daily special: A warm salmon with tomato sandwich - very tasty and affordable. But make sure to bring cash, they do not accept credit cards.

The White chocolate rice pudding still pops up in my dreams from time to time. I am so happy I moved to a new apartment. I used to live next door and ate this every single day. Can't beat it- next best thing to home cooking in the city.

Great crowd, young and old. Although they only except cash--which I found a little inconvenient (who carries cash anymore?)--- the simplicity of getting a fresh and delicious soup and sandwich is always refreshing. I would get there a little before rush hour for lunch/dinner, simply because this little shop fills up fast...and for good reason.

Had the Pollo Diablo. It was amazing, the bread and spicy mayo were unreal. I also had the potato salad on the side which was very good. This is a great spot but don't forget that it's cash only. I will definitely come back to try other menu items. Cheap prices also.
Cute spot. good food. if your  in the area definitely stop by.

What a great neighborhood spot. I would have trouble if I lived near here, with all this carb temptation. I stopped in to grab a couple of desserts to bring for my friend's dinner, and had a tough time deciding on what to get. There were a lot of great options, and I would love to try a sandwich here. I honed in on the tiramisu and the carrot cake, both were delicious and really affordable. The downside is that they are a cash only spot. I'm not sure if the staff was just getting tired seeing as though it was later in the evening but she wasn't as friendly to me. I also wanted to select my own pieces of the dessert that I saw, obviously to pick what looked like the largest to me. I felt like I was being ignored or she didn't care to give me the option.

We order delivery from here pretty often at work. Always delicious. I particularly love the diablo. Spicy chicken sandwich on the best bread.  Prices are exceptionally cheap for the quality and size of the sandwiches. Everyone orders when we get lunch from Panes!

Panes is great!  Just last week, I was there 5 times over a 3 day span for various goodies.  The chicken club sandwich is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  Make sure you get it on the Sweet French bread and, if you're feeling a bit daring, swap in spicy mayo.  Other highlights include the cream of tomato soup (served, like many items on the menu, with a heaping side of fresh bread), the goat cheese crostini appetizer, and the myriad desserts/cookies on display in the front cases. DISCLAIMER: Yes, this place is cash only.  To everyone knocking down their ratings because of this fact, consider that this is how Panes avoids the standard 2% to 5% credit card processing fee, ultimately keeping the prices very reasonable and passing the savings on to you.  If you can't live without swiping and entering your pin, go somewhere else and let the rest of us enjoy our family-owned, not-so-hidden gem!
The sandwiches here are really good!  The atmosphere is super casual.  Great spot for lunch or even dinner if you want a really tasty, fresh sandwich!
This is my second time having Panes and its' just OK, but nothing spectacular. The sandwiches are a decent price. Its' decent.

I went here for the first time today and I will definitely be back. Pleasant people, fabulous menu of salads, sandwiches, soups and pastas and great desserts. Their prices are very reasonable too! A great local spot to support!
Sandwiches!  Everything looked and tasted fresh.  The venue was small to mid sized and was kept very clean. I recommend the chicken club and the side of mash potatoes.  Definitely won me over.

What a hidden gem!! I can't believe it took so many times walking past to finally go in. I had the Turkey Turkey and it was incredible. Everything on the menu and on the plates around me looked awesome though. I can't wait to go back and try something else.
Pollo Diablo is where it's at! My favorite from here. Sometimes I just pop in for fresh bread for my dinner.
I'm not really a sandwich fan but I ADORE this place. It's a good thing I rarely have cash on me because I'd be here every day. The Portabella and the Oaxacan Pork sandwiches are to die for.
Sandwich. Lover's. Heaven. I love to eat here.  Both the Turkey Turkey and the Pollo Diablo are tasty.  Their to-go bread loaves are also amazing - the garlic one is particularly good.

This place is definitely worth a recommendation!  It's a casually decorated place with walls chock full of Chicago and Boston pieces (the owners undoubtedly have a Boston connection) along with an eclectic mix of other decor. On to the food, I had the Super Panes sandwich and a side of Mashed Potatoes (I heard that they offered them there so I figured, why not?).  The Mashed Potatoes were savory, being buttery and just the right consistency - not too creamy.  The Super Panes sandwich was really good and came with a few fries, so the other positive reviews were definitely on the right track! Try this spot, it's a quaint, smaller neighborhood place near other cool local places like DMK Burger.

Best place in the mo-fo world. Inexpensive, well-made food. The chicken club sandwich is top 5 in my book, avocado, bacon, and ask for the spicy mayo. Cash only, bring a little extra for dessert, you've earned it.

The place did NOT give free refills (on iced tea might I add) and it's also CASH ONLY!!! Considering that it's 2012, each of those constitutes an automatic one star reduction in my book. I'm down with cash only in a cool, divy, hard to find gem, but let's be real here this is a sandwich shop in Lakeview. And there's no excuse for not offering free refills in my book. Anywhere. None. Other than that, the ambiance was cool, it's close to the Wellington stop which is convenient, and my chicken sandwich was decent as well, although it did take 10+ minutes to come out. Overall, a mediocre sandwich shop at best, but there are much better (and with the times) options available for me to come back.

DESSERT REVIEW ONLY: Needed a late-night dessert place, and found Panes online. Perfect spot! Buyckeye ball (peanut butter covered in chocolate), coca-cola cake, nutella pie, and blueberry lemon pudding... all amazing. The Blueberry lemon pudding was *incredible*. Can't wait to come back for the food based on all of the positive reviews. As always, be prepared for cash only.

I am not wowed by this place, but the food is fine. However (I will try to remain calm as I type this) they are CASH ONLY!! Minus 1 star off the bat for me because of that. Generally there is a wait for lunch, but after you wait in line for awhile you will see a small sign on the register that says CASH ONLY. Be prepared. I was debating between The Popular and the Oaxacan Pork. When I asked at the counter for their suggestion she said the Oaxacan Pork which was a little surprising because shouldn't The Popular be your 'best' sandwich? Also, the wait to get my food was easily 15-20 minutes. Rather slow for a lunch/cafe type place. Anyhow, my sandwich was fine. Would I wait in a slow moving line and pay cash for it again? Probably not. There aren't many tables here, but everyone else's food looked good. If you are in need of a place for a bite then this is fine. Just don't expect to be blown away.

Tried for the very first time today, had the Oaxacan Pork , which was very tasty. I also grabbed a small salad, which was actually a very decent size. Had the ranch dressing and can honestly say, it's the worst ranch I've ever had. Besides that, I would go back to try other sandwiches that sounded amazing.

I wasn't very hungry when I came here, which made me pretty sad, because everything on the menu sounds delicious.  I got the Tortilla Salad (good choice), and the portions are pretty big.  The fresh-baked bread is SO affordable and delicious--I've been snacking on the tomato bread, and also picked up a garlic & oregano loaf.   If you want dessert, this is a great stop!  I tried the brownie (baked with a York peppermint patty in the bottom), and it's SO rich that I couldn't even finish it (very odd, considering my limitless chocolate stomach).  The cream puff was also good, according to my friend.  I'd definitely come back!!

Panes is Perfect!  If you like sandwiches, this cafe needs to be at the top of your list in Chicago.  They have so many great choices, and you can taste the love in their food.   I ended up enjoying The Popular.  Given the name, I figured I would like it as well.  Seriously A-MAZE-ING!  How can you go wrong with grilled chicken breast, caramelized onions, spinach, roasted peppers, provolone cheese on tomato bread! Tip: Keep in mind that the restaurant is cash only.   If you need an ATM, use the one inside the Wellington Brown Line stop.  The one on the street that is slightly closer failed to dispense my cash.

Love, Love, Love Panes!! This bakery/cafe is a great little neighborhood hidden gem! Everything in the cafe is made from scratch...from the delicious warm bread your sandwiches are made on, to the amazing soup and incredible hand rolled chili cinnamon truffles, yum!  I have never eaten anything here I haven't liked... It is family owned and the staff is very helpful and friendly when you have an ordering dilemma. The only downfalls are that it is a small business, so it is cash only, be prepared to pay with out plastic. Also, since it is all homemade and made to order, you may wait a few minutes for your food, but it is well worth the wait!

Mmmm Panes....I get excited just thinking about my next visit!  My fiancee and I stopped in for lunch on a Friday afternoon and we were both seriously impressed by their offerings.  I tried the Turkey, Turkey and he had the Spicy Philly and both were fantastic-warm, freshly baked foccacia bread piled high with fresh, tasty ingredients to make a supremely superior sub! While waiting for our food I was drooling over the delicious looking Tomato Soup and stacked Grilled Cheese sandwiches at the table next to ours-the perfect meal for a cool fall day in Chicago-I know what I'll be ordering next time!  To finish off our meal we indulged in one of their Monster Cookies and all I can say is WOAH...these are well worth the extra calories!   While I do wish the woman working the counter was a little more friendly, and the fact that they are CASH ONLY is a bit of a pain, I'm still giving Panes Bread Cafe a big fat 5 stars because once I took a bite of my Turkey, Turkey all that was wrong was now so right!
Panes Bread Cafe is the best place to get a home made sandwich ever! Pollo Diablo all the way!!! only if u like it spicy haha
The bread, and the bread! :) If you need a place to grab a great lunch. Take the Brown line to the Sheffield stop. Take a left, on the corner of Wellington and Sheffield.

This place was absolutely amazing! We split an order of Pasta salad which was a huge, flavorful portion with artichoke hearts, lemon zest, feta, sun dried tomatoes, olives and an amazing dressing. This was absolutely delicious and would make a meal on its own, particularly with the homemade bread it was served with.  We each also ordered a Portobello sandwich and were blown away. The fresh tomato bread it was served on was soft and delicious. The pesto was flavorful and perfectly complimented the pieces of portobello. The sandwich, served with kettle chips, was so large, we each took half for later. It was just as delicious hours later!  I really wanted to give this place four stars for not taking credit cards (theres an ATM across the street) but couldnt because the food was so amazing!

I'll keep this short and sweet. Went here with the boyfriend so he could grab some food to go.  Like a moron, I left my phone on one of the tables.  Called the next day, and they had put it on the side for me.  When I picked it up, they wouldn't event accept a reward.  F'ing cool. Can't wait to actually try their food.

Delicious and unbelievably fresh bread and food. Be warned: they only accept cash. I'm not a huge fan of their cookies, so it's a good thing they have crumbled up day-old cookies out for sample. That usually satisfies my after-lunch sweet tooth. Loaves of bread are super cheap for the quality you get here. They have a great selection of soups, salad, bread, sandwiches, and pastas. Try everything!

This is hands down, the best sandwich place in Lakeview. Most sandwiches are right around the $6 range and come with a bag of chips. The sandwiches are delicious! The Oaxacan sandwich is AMAZING! You also can't miss out on the Monster cookie - everything delicious in one cookie!

This place is AWESOME. I'm lucky that it's just far enough east that I'm not tempted to go back and make it my daily lunch spot (parking was a challenge). But the bread was so SO good here. I went with two friends, we ordered three sandwiches and each ate a quarter of each, and then fought for the last quarter of our favorite sandwich (luckily it worked out well!) My favorite was "The Popular" (no surprise, huh?). A good amount of succulent chicken (I'm always afraid the chicken will be dry - but I was pleased), onions caramelized to perfection, on a healthy bed of spinach, some peppers, cheese -- all snug between two delicious slices of homemade tomato bread. SO GOOD.  I will surely be back again.

What a spot!  Stumbled upon this place with a simple Yelp search.  I was looking for something casual, low key and cheap.  Couldn't have asked for anything more.   The best part about this place is the quality of bread - truly amazing.  I've been twice and have gone with the turkey club each time.  It is perfect.  Comes with a side of chips.  My girlfriend, on the other hand, got pasta both times (told her not to).  This is a sandwich place that specializes in bread, people. Don't order pasta!  She wasn't crazy about it, as it was quite generic.  I tasted it and found it to be pretty bland myself. Atmosphere is pretty average.  Small place with a decent amount of small tables inside.  Probably 4 or 5 outdoor tables along the sidewalk.  We like to sit our here to people watch.  Never a dull moment in Lakeview.  Big plus - they tie a water bowl up outside and keep it fresh for the pups.  Love that play. FYI - this place is cash only.  If you happen to forget, though, there is an ATM across the street.  Just don't leave your card in it like I did! Anyhow, great spot.  Definitely will be coming back (and not ordering pasta).
One of my favorite sandwich shops. Great price and the pollo diablo is awesome!

Love this place.  It's close to my work and the food is consistently good.  My goal is to try everything on the menu there over the next year.  You can't beat 6 dollars for a super yummy sandwich. My only recommendation is that if you are short on time to call ahead and place your order.  It can sometimes take 10 - 15 minutes for your food to come out if you walk in and want it to go.  The place also has a neat patio in the summer to enjoy our sandwich outside.

I can't believe I forgot to review this when I was living in Chicago! Panes is the picture-perfect epitome of a hole-in-the-wall--a delightful, relatively undiscovered culinary gem offering delicious, homemade comfort food. My friends and I came here a lot as starving grad students. The owner is Canadian (yay!) and a Parisian-trained chef. Virtually everything is made from scratch, and you can really taste that. My absolute favorite item was the Chocolate Coca-Cola Cake with cream cheese frosting. Chocolate + Coca-Cola? How can anyone say no to that? The cake was always so moist and delicious with the perfect amount of frosting. I enjoy frosting, but it's often too overwhelmingly sweet for me. I could have eaten this frosting by the bucketload. One time, in a fit of culinary ecstasy, I ended up buying 3 slices of the chocolate coca-cola cake to take home with me. The owner laughed and gave me a 4th slice on the house. Score! Other great items include the monster cookie, pretty much any sandwich (as the bread is made from scratch) and the pasta with vodka cream sauce. I don't live in Chicago anymore, but whenever I visit, Panes is always on my itinerary.

Delightful lunch spot! Hearty soups, homemade bread galore, and filling sandwiches! I went with 3 friends, we each spent less than $10 and left stuffed!  Our fav was the Pollo Diablo Sandwich.  Enjoy!

I think this place is a gem in this area.  They make different bread everyday.  The staff is long-term.  The owner is usually there.  I always order the CHICKEN CLUB SANDWICH. which automatically comes with a bag of chips.  Their prices are reasonable and you get a large gourmet sandwich that satisfies.  Busy atmosphere.  You see a lot of regulars from the area frequenting Panes.   Good, prompt service.

Ive been wanting to come here for a long time, I live only a few blocks away. I made the trip with my bf on a Saturday afternoon and so glad we did. We went around 2p and it was busy, but we were able to grab a seat outside. When we ordered inside a self proclaimed "regular" gave us suggestions, which was really cool. I got the popular, which was great. The tomato bread was delicious. My bf got the steak sandwich on the specials board. Both of us liked our choices.  I will definitely be back. Great food and value for what you get!

Found this place on Yelp and came for lunch on my vacation in Chicago. The Service ---  You order at the counter and they bring your food to your table.  Everyone was nice.  No complaints. The Food ---  So we got the tomato soup, potato salad, sloppy pollo and the popular.  The tomato soup was really good, the best I've had in a long time.  Same thing with the potato salad.  It was pretty garlicky which I loooved!  The sloppy pollo was delish!  It had shredded chicken, onions and BBQ sauce.  The popular was okay.  It tasted like a pizza in sandwich form.  Nothing spectacular.  Both sandwiches came with potato chips. The Prices --- It was cheap.  I think each sandwich was somewhere around $6 and the potato salad around $3.  Definitely worth the money. If I'm ever in Chicago again, I'll definitely go back.  They have seating outside with umbrellas so you're not in the sun.  Great place for lunch on a nice day.

Panes surprises you with their unique and fresh ingredient mexican- italian menu. Ranging from Quesadillas to Cavatapi youll definitely find something delicious and rich in flavor to captivate your senses. This cafe is cute and a very cozy place. It is the perfect relaxed atmosphere and with its artistic Mexican decor it'll make you feel right at home. Dont leave this place without  picking up one of their homemade breads and sweet treats.

They have a lot of pastries and cookies to choose from, and I love their sandwiches (also have personal size pizzas, they taste alright). Just a tad bit pricey, but it's pretty filling overall. The service here is lacking; it's a great place to just stop in for a casual bite (lunch maybe), if you're walking by the neighborhood. Wouldn't really have a planned meal here.

Once again--how did I not know about this when it was a mere two blocks away from my home?! Elizabeth H. and I dined here and the veggie sandwich was outstanding. Total neighborhood gem that I am beyond bummed I didn't discover before moving out of state. Get in here and eat!

My boyfriend and I love this joint! Their sandwiches are amazing! It was our second time here and we will for sure be back for a third. Their tomato bread is divine! The popular and the polla diablo are excellent. I don't eat bacon, though my boyfriend had the chicken club which he loved!  Their Sandwiches are huge so I usually eat half and bring the rest home! We haven't had the desserts yet, but their banana bread and cookies look awesome! Bring cash! Yum! They also have a great patio for the days in the summer when it is not blazing out! I recommend trying this place!

This place is unreal. I've eaten here with a co-worker twice for lunch. It was been unreal both times. The bread is fantastic and the sandwiches are fresh and hot (for hot ones, obviously). I love that they give simple potato chips with the sandwiches. I had the chicken club and if I hadn't heard about everything else being so good I would get it every time. It was really, really good. I also had the Super Panes next time. That was also very good, just not as good as the chicken club. But still very good. The food is definitely affordable. Great lunch prices and atmosphere. Love the simple environment. I also tried their buckeyes. They are peanut butter balls covered in chocolate. I'm not that into chocolate but love peanut butter and they were very good.  If you are in the area, you have to try this place. I can't wait to go back.

You can't find a better sandwich for the price in this neighborhood.  Honestly with the freshness of the bread and the quality of ingredients, you'd be hard pressed to find a better sandwich period.  You'll come here and wonder why you ever went to Potbelly.  I have to try very hard to not consume two day worth of calories with one of those Monster Cookies, mm mm mm. Then you'll realize that the two ladies who usually work the cash register NEVER smile.  They aren't rude but they are so terribly dour that you realize they MUST own the joint or they'd never stay working in a place for so long being that unhappy.  Please ladies, I've seen your teeth.  You have good dental work, SMILE at us once in a while! Food/Price ratio is 5 star, Service is about a 3, so we get 4.

Went here for lunch today and got the Todo Italiano. It was very good, worth the price, and both the bread on my sandwich and the banana bread in the basket of free samples were soft, chewy, and delicious. Everything homemade bakery bread should be! The sandwich was yummilicious, but i had to dock a star for the wait. It took a good 30 minutes for me to get my order of one sandwich that by the time it came I had to ask for it to go. When i did, they replaced the homemade chips for a bag of Lays. Not cool! Don't punish the to-go people with crappy chips instead of fresh, homemade ones. I may be back, but if I do it will be when I have time to sit and wait and enjoy real chips with my sandwich.

i ate their oaxacan pork sandwich...so good.  went there with a buddy on a Friday for lunch and decided to have it again on Saturday.  ran into my buddy there with his wife...so yeah, we were both fans b/c we both ate there on back to back days.

Ok, here we go. This is one of these places were i am right in the middle between 4 and 5 with my rating, so 4,5 stars would be perfect. The first time i was here i tried the Sunny California (2,5/5) vegetarian sandwich. It was later in the evening and they were about to close. I dont know why but this sandwich was not good. The ingrediences were not well balanced and the bread was not fresh anymore. Moreover it was simply boring. I think it is not good at any time because there is no leading ingredience its only lettuce on a sandwich. When i was there i bought a carrot cake, a cookie and a brownie for the next day. The carrot cake (5/5) was overwhelming, very good, very moist and not to sweet (very important) one of the best i had. The cookie was also pretty good (4,5/5) just how you want it. The peanut butter brownie (4/5) was very good but as i am not the guy that like very heavy stuff, it was a little bit to much for me but i couldnt give it less than 4 stars because the taste was really good. After these delicious sweet desserts i thought maybe i should go there again and try one of their more recommended sandiwches so i tried the Pollo Diablo (5/5) which was genious and one of the best sandwiches i ever had. The bread killed me :D. I tried some other desserts, too. The Monster cookie (4/5), lime cheese cake (3,5/5) and white chocolate rice pudding (3,5/5) which were okay. As this place is famous for its sandwiches (especially Pollo and oaxacan Pork) i give it 5 stars but warn you to eat the horrible Sunny California, too.  Recommendations:  - Pollo Diablo - Carrot Cake (BIT) - Cookies

This is a nice, little sandwich and more spot if you want a quick bite with delicious bread.  I've been here a couple times and neither visit really blew me out of the water but everything has been good.  I went this evening with a couple friends for a quick bite.  The place was relatively empty so we were able to order quickly and pick out our choice seat.  They have outdoor seating, which we opted for on an unseasonably cool but refreshing evening.  The food came out quickly which was nice because I was starving.  I had the Oaxacan Pork sandwich which had good flavor but was a little greasy for me.  I really liked the spicy sauce although it tasted sweet rather than spicy.  I also ordered the potato salad which needed salt and pepper and was a little too "mayonaisey" but its all good.  I would definitely come back for a quick sandwich on the way home from work.   CASH ONLY!!!!

My husband and one of his buddies went here for lunch yesterday, and this afternoon we were out and about and I was suddenly ravenous for lunch.  After throwing around ideas he said, we can go to the place I went yesterday.  I felt badly because he'd just eaten there but he assured me he didn't mind going back at all.  So we did.  And when we walked in the door, his friend--who had also eaten at Panes yesterday--was sitting there at one of the tables!  Clearly neither of them could get enough... I opted for the Todo Italiano sandwich and it was delish.  Honestly, I could've probably had half of the sandwich and saved the other half for later, but why do something so ludicrous.  So I devoured both halves.  It had chicken, prosciutto, provolone, pesto and roasted red peppers - heavenly.  We also shared a chocolate chip cookie.  Nice and soft, it tasted almost like a sugar cookie with chunks of chocolate in it.   Love this place--even if it is cash only.

I had the pollo diablo sandwich and grabbed a loaf of tomato bread to go -- the pollo diablo was a pretty solid sandwich and large enough that I wasn't even able to finish it. I do wish they offered a side option besides potato chips (and besides "more bread" .. I really don't need any more of that when I'm already eating a huge sandwich). The woman at the counter told me I could order a fruit salad but that it would be an additional $3+. I'll probably come back at some point, but I think my expectations were too high after reading some of the extremely glowing reviews of the place.

This place is great, I've been coming here for years, mostly for lunch, at least once a week.  The food is wonderful, consistent; the bread is totally incredible.  Everything tastes very fresh and the seasoning is great.   Prices are very reasonable, the owners are awesome, always onsite, working.  Sandwiches are awesome, the specials are fab (the most sumptuous homemade mole ..  ohmigosh..)..  and desserts- Chocolate Clouds YUM, monster cookies are outrageous..  enchiladas are great, and the pasta dishes are excellent.  The place is clean, well run and cheerful.  Cash only.  I don't see a big deal with that.

Just go here.  More like a 4.5, prices are great and food is awesome.  I wouldn't go here for the pasta dishes, but they are still yummy.  Order a sandwhich or go for breakfast and you will NOT be disappointed. Their salads are mostly solid, but sometimes the lettuce isn't the best, still good but not 5 star rating. BRING CASH

I work nearby and have had lunch here almost weekly for the last couple years. The food is great and I love the tortilla salad! All sorts of options to choose from when it comes to the sandwiches and the bread is outstanding. Very friendly staff. And save room for dessert! :)

Perfect solution to a rainy day, to come in here and get soup and some freshly made bread. I've also had their tortilla salad which I would recommend. Delicious cookies too. They usually have samples of something available, which is always a nice little treat. This place is on the small side, so it can get crowded during lunchtime. But when the weather is nice, there's an outside sitting area. Only downfall: they only take cash. Which is understandable since it is a local, family-owned restaurant, but in this day and age it's hard to find people who always have cash on them (including me!).

The bread here is FANTASTIC- I love the banana bread and the other breakfast types. They clearly taste homemade. Their lunch sandwiches are delish too. It's mildly annoying that they only take cash, so I just have to remember to hit up the ATM before I go. I also wish they had more seating, as there can be a wait if you go during a peak time. I would say the service is average- you order, take a number, and they bring your food. Still, a must try!

This place deserves its excellent reviews.  Some of the best bread in the city - try the sweet French.  Could use a little bit more indoor seating but it will have to do!  Only suggestion - breakfast sandwich!

I got their special turkey with bacon! and it was real bacon with fresh chicken breast for 5.95!! and it was delicious! While waiting for my soon to be devoured sandwich, I also window shopped the pastries! and they looked so good! and guess what! THEY DIDN'T CHARGE ME FOR THE SMELL!! i thought only Jimmy Johns offer that. Oh the one start deduction was because they didnt take credit cards...harsh? maybe! fair? I say up to you!
Actual visit 9/21/11. I had a Roast beef sandwich on the BEST & FRESHEST bread ever !!!!   Really, the bread was out of this world !
awesome food, bad service. Dont go after 7 PM, they wont have their best selling breads available.

Great lunch spot! Every sandwich on the menu is excellent.  Their bread is made fresh everyday and all of the ingredients on their sandwiches taste fresh.  I especially love the sloppy pollo.  This place will not disappoint.  Just remember it's cash only.

I love the Pollo Diablo sandwhich.  That sandwhich deserves five stars.  Overall, Panes is pretty quick, cose by, reliable and delicious.  I also don't feel oversalted or gross after eating there.  I have tried other sandwhiches there, but I stick to the Pollo Diablo.  The banana bread wasn't overly great, cookies pretty tasty.  Love this place.

Not like this place needs another great review. Just go check it out. There are a ton of sandwiches and salads. Its super cheap...most things right around $6.  I had the greek chicken salad.  It was pretty large for $5.75.  I also tried the creamy tomato soup...it was FANTASTIC.  I had a bite of the club.  Great bread and a perfect combo of meat and everything else. You order at the counter and then they bring it to you. The place gets pretty crowded so be prepared to possibly wait for a table to open up. There is pretty easy street parking in the area and the brown line is right there.

When you walk into Panes, you wouldn't expect that you are about to have the best sandwich you've ever tasted. Panes is hands down where I go to get a delicious sandwich not just in my neighborhood, not just in Chicago, but IN THE WORLD.  The Oaxacan pork tenderloin, roasted peppers, and spicy mayo sandwich is the front-runner for my favorite sandwich IN THE WORLD, but I've had sampled many tasty runner-ups. If you must stray from the Oaxacan, the Spicy Philly and Sloppy Pollo are also delicious. The bread and the sauces make these sandwiches, so don't try to modify  perfection or I can't vouch for your order. I have also had the breakfast egg sandwich which applies the same winning equation of fresh rosemary bread and ranchero sauce. The Greek salad is also very fresh and flavorful if you're looking for lighter fare. I give Panes 5 stars, because I just can't resist the sandwiches. In all fairness though, the service is pretty slow, they don't accept credit cards, and their desserts are terrible. The brownie is dense, but tastes chalky, and the m&m cookie looks softer than it really is. I also would pass on the goat cheese crostini and the pizzas. Their fantastic bread just isn't pizza dough. Ignoring all that, Panes does deliver and you can order take out in advance, they are cheap, and the restaurant dinning area is super cute for a nice Sunday morning brunch. The owners also have a great story about opening the restaurant and always appear to be behind the counter.  Forget the hyped donut places, gourmet mini tacos, and spicy meat skewers that are overwhelming the cheap eats scene, and get yourself a ridiculously delicious sandwich from Panes.

Great sandwhiches, appetizers, and desserts. This is probably my favorite bakery-style sandwich shop in the city. Their more popular dishes are delicious across the board. Great brunch and lunch eatery, or a lighter dinner. Priced fair. Definitely has a 20-something girl friend catch-up atmosphere. A lot of couples getting some hot sandwiches to work off their hangovers. Can't say I blame them. They do what they do very well.
Great cookies...but a bread cafe without espresso & pastry?

The sandwiches are good, but it's all about the bread here. The owner is super reserved but I like that about her. She doesn't take credit cards and she doesn't care how our day is going. She just wants to serve you.  Above and beyond the sandwiches, their loafs of bread are outstanding and the pastas are awesome.

i work down the block at the hospital so this place is def in great walking distance for my lunch time. their sandwics are great chicken diablo to die for theyre salads are great too. great prices for everything on the menu they even have spanish deserts which look delicous. i think the only bad thing i can really say about the place is their cash only policy they got going on. but hey doesnt stop me from going there lol

Here is my perfect equation of how to find the perfect breakfast/lunch/dinner place on Yelp (or what I do when my fiancé asks where we should eat): I type the name of the meal into the search box, I look for 4 stars or better and (at least) 40 reviews.  This has never failed me.  Panes is one of the solutions from this magic equation. I had that ran-too-many-errands-and-now-my-body-is-achy-in-that-Saturday-way-that-is-different-from-every-other-day-of-the-week-and-now-I-want-to-take-a-nap feeling, but needed to eat first.  Panes was close and passed the magic Yelp equation, so in I went.   Panes is what I think of when I think of a local sandwich shop.   The Sandwich Shop In My Head: It smells good.   It has randomly printed, unfussy menus with well-crafted and unique sandwiches on it.   I can order with confidence because the choices are particular enough that key words and phrases accurately (if not underestimate) what comes from the kitchen. There are sweets to eat after your sandwich. I ordered the Pollo Diablo and it was delightful.  I like spicy food and this wasn't fake spicy, but legitimate spicy.  I would recommend Panes to anyone and I am hoping to find motivation to get there again very soon.

Best sandwiches ever!!! I wish I could say something about the other menu items but I'm so in love with the sandwiches I never stray from ordering one! My favorite is the Turkey Turkey, which comes on freshly baked tomato bread.  Literally every bite I want to say "mmm!"  The only downside is that they only accept cash payments, although it may be a good thing or else I would be eating here probably every day.

went there 3 times in one weekend. that should tell you enough. delicious warm bread on buttery sandwiches. good prices, great service. some of the product itself is a little cheap (processed cheese, packaged deli meat on my turkey sandwich) but it's an extremely cozy feel good little spot that makes you want to live in the neighborhood. plus great cookies and cheap brunch items.

The food is good, above average even, but, I'm giving them a lousy grade because they do not accept money.  That is, they do not accept credit cards, which is the same thing as money to many people.  This is highly inconvenient, and serves no purpose but to save the proprietor a few bucks.   Oh when I asked if there was an ATM nearby, I got a scowl in response and was told that there is an ATM nearby.  Don't worry, it is probably not your ATM so, it may cost you an extra buck or two. And the staff really is not helpful. . . it was hardly service with a smile. I can't help but get the feeling that giving you payment options is inconvenient, and doing anything but scowl behind the register is just too much for them. Honestly, why would you not take credit cards.  Not what I would call a friendly place, with not very user friendly policies.

My wife loves this place, I'm not quite there, but it is very good.  Definitely a very populare spot and is almost always busy when we've been.  A great wide selection of sandwiches and very good bread.  Don't forget your cash like I have before!  No credit card!

Delicious bread!! I didn't realize how unimportant the sandwhich fillings are until coming to Panes. I can never remember what type of sandwhich I ordered the previous time (ham? turkey? some sort of fish?) because all I can think about is the warm, sweet bread. mmmm This place is reasonably priced too. I just got a sandwhich and two moster cookies for under $10. Cash only is slightly annoying, and there isn't much to the ambience of the place...but did I mention the bread?

By far my favorite sandwich shop in the city. The first time I went there I ordered the turkey, turkey sandwich. They ran out of the tomato bread and suggested I try the sandwich on their sweet french bread. Lucky me! I have never had a better tasting sandwich. Now every time I go, no matter which sandwich I get, I ALWAYS get it on the sweet french bread. The service is great. Once when I had a carry-out order I got home and realized they gave me the wrong thing. When I called to ask about it I was promised a free sandwich on my next visit and they delivered! This is my first stop whenever I'm in the neighborhood.

Panes offers you fantastic sandwiches at basement bargain prices.  They have a great selection of sandwiches, and some really good sweet treats too.  The Oaxan Pork and The Popular are the two I've tried. Both were fantastic. It seems likea really popular spot, it was really busy when I went. Like others have said, cash only. so dont forget.

Literally the best bread I have ever had. The sandwiches are fantastic, pasta is good, and pizza is great. As you well know its cash only so that's a bummer but not a big issue. I've lived down the street from Panes for 2 years and it's always been a standard for me. A pickup order seems to take 15 mins no matter what you order.  My mom is a Foods class teacher and always expects to go here when she comes into town. It's cheap and fantastic food. You won't regret going! Oh but my mom makes better monster cookies. Sorry Panes!

LOVE THIS FOOD! The soups are hearty and homemade, very fresh. The sandwiches are also freshly made and the bread baked recently too. TAKE A LOAF HOME! Everything is melt in your mouth to die for! I also love the environment, it feels like home. The people there are very sweet and customer service focused. Great lunchtime place, or cost efficient dinner date!

I love the sandwiches and cookies here. My only complaint is that they take an inexplicably long time to create sandwiches even when its not busy. Even a phone ahead order left me waiting when I arrived.  If you are not in a hurry it is worth the wait!!

Everything I've had here has always been really, really fresh. They have good salads, soups, sandwiches, and breads. I've never had anything I didn't like, but nothing has blown me away either.  Except the peanut butter balls. I can't walk past without thinking about them. And only $0.25- $0.50. I would definitely suggest grabbing lunch here if you're in the area. It's one of those neighborhood gems you miss when you move.

Delicious i mean, DELICIOUS  bread! The sweet french baguettes are my favorite ever!  There are soups, salads, and great sandwiches.  They also have truffles and desserts ... the chocolates are unique and ... delicious... bc everything is pretty  much delicious.   They have seating indoor and outside, so its really nice to be able to eat out and bring your dog in the summer.   Panes is CA$H ONLY ... so don't forget bc if you are like me and sometimes do... it can be annoying.
Panes is great for a hearty sandwich. My fav is the spicy chicken club on the tomato bread... the best!

I've eaten here twice, and while the bread is delicious, the sandwiches I've tried (which include the Turkey Turkey, Pollo Diablo, and Super Panes) were just ok.  Nothing I would go out of my way for.  The chips are just your regular Lay's.  The price is pretty great, so maybe I'm expecting too much but after all of the glowing reviews, I just don't really get it.

This is the epitome of a great neighborhood sandwich shop.  We've been going for years and there's nothing like it.  May not seem like much from the menu but the homeade sandwiches will hook you.  We always order them on the SWEET FRENCH bread- reason alone to go there.  Can't go wrong with the roast beef and polo diablo but honestly they're all good.  Monster cookies are fantastic.
Great sandwiches, salads. A hidden gem in lakeview. Very glad I live near it. =)  Its a must try.

Amazing sandwich & bread shop!  I'm a huge fan of the El Parisino sandwich.  Everything here is extremely fresh and good.  Highly recommend the Tortilla soup! Recommend going early if you are looking to bring a loaf of bread home.

In an early Chicago lifetime, I lived near Panes. I also ate meat. In my current Chicago lifetime, I live less than a mile from Panes. I do not eat meat. But I wish I could drop my scruples and eat the roasted beef sandwich from Panes every day. It's that delicious. If you eat meat, even if you aren't usually a fan of roast beef, order the roasted beef sandwich. You won't regret it. The blend of sweet, sautéed onions, delicately tender roasted beef, spicy mayo, tomatoes, avocado, and delicious, delicious bread makes my mouth water whenever I think of it. The tortilla salad is very good. I never liked chicken, but whenever I had this salad in the past, I was pleased with the flavor combination and quality of the chicken. Back to my current Chicago lifetime, I order the portabella sandwich, which is so good that I don't miss the roasted beef while I'm eating the portabella. I think it's substantial and delicious enough for a meat-eater to love.  After I moved away from Panes the first time, it was the only thing I missed about the neighborhood. Now that I'm nearby again, it's kind of the only thing I like about the neighborhood. While I'm homesick for River West, at least I have Panes' delicious sandwiches. And that's enough to get a girl through anything, really.

Oh Panes..... you were getting closer to a 4 star review and then I had to go and be a fat kid and order a cookie. A *terrible* cookie. In my fat kid defense, it was my birthday and I wanted a treat. I saw ginormous, soft'n'chewy looking choc chip cookies in the glass case. I ordered a cookie along with my sandwich and took a seat. In a short time, I was delivered a delicious looking sandwich and a small, hard chocolate chip cookie. Um.... wtf? This is not the cookie I ordered. Unfortunately, things had gotten busy by that point and I didnt have the time or the patience to wait for someone to be available to say something to. My sandwich was quite good (i had the italiano which has chicken, prosciutto, and pesto....) not necessarily knock-my-socks-off, but above average. The proscuitto was a little sub par but this also isn't an Italian deli so there ya go. The bread was very, very good. I would come back to buy a loaf of bread. I am basically still baffled regarding the cookie situation and will never order sweets from this place again.  Overall..... good bread, decent sandwiches, service was acceptable and timely for the amount of customers in the place in terms of giving them my order and them bringing it out. If you order a sweet from this place, I would be extremely specific and point to what you want or you may end up with some reject one taken from the back. *Cash Only*

i, like most, have to knock panes for the no credit card thing. im sorry, but it just sucks.  but their sandwiches are darn good. i, for one adore the turkey turkey. the spicy mayo is just right- and the turkey is always fresh. i find myself finishing them just for sport, despite being sickly full.  in case you have room for more, the cookies/ sweets are really delicious. last time i was there, i had one of the peanut butter chocolate treats. not much seating inside or outside, but the patio is cute during the warmer months. panes is a great choice amid the potbellys/panera/other sandwich chain pack!

I had the Turkey Club and my friend had the Pollo Diablo. She liked hers and I really enjoyed mine. I had heard a few good things, but didn't know exactly what kind of sandwiches they offered. To be honest, the menu didn't really jump out at me, but wow was my choice a good one. I think they use a bread that really agreed with me. It was very good and had it's own style. As any sandwich lover knows, the bread can make or break a sammich. They follow it up by using fresh and tasty ingredients. I also liked the chips that came on the side. They were just plain, salted chips, but very good. I wanted to try some dessert, because several items looked really delicious. Unfortunately, they only take cash. My friend didn't have and cash, so after paying for me and her, there wasn't enough left on me to indulge my sweet tooth.
Have that weird ass roasted beef sandwich. It's debatable whether the ingredients are an arbitrary laundry list or rather a harmonious, special, favorite thing. The breads are tasty.

One word, I'm OBSESSED with this place (ok it's 5 words, but who's counting).  I lived around the corner from Panes for 3 years and ate there at least once a week but more often 2-3 times a week.  The only limiting factor was if I had cash, but I gladly walked to the ATM to enjoy Panes. I've had just about everythign on the menu, all of their breads, soups.  My favorites are the Turkey Turkey or the Sloppy Pollo (which is sloppy but worth every extra napkin).  I'm a soup fanatic and their tomato bisque is one of the best I've ever tried.  Love their Sunday brunch, I would always get the chicken chilaquiles, which personally beats some that I've had at authentic Mexican restaurants. This is a great neighborhood spot, stellar food, great staff.  I miss living around the corner from there and every time I come back to Chicago I have to make a stop at my favorite sandwich place.

So good. I'd put it in the Panera category as far as their options, however the quality is so far beyond! Everything's homemade and it's such a cozy little place. And yes, the CASH ONLY policy can be a pain but somehow there's something respectable and nostalgic about it here (unlike when your cab driver demands cash only). I'm moving closer to Panes very soon, and that makes me very nervous! My only complaint is with ordering out for delivery. They messed up my order and it just was not at all as good as getting it there. And I was only 2 blocks away, so one would assume it should have been fairly fresh. Hopefully they find a better system for delivery, but until then make sure to eat there for the real deal!

Love Panes! It's the best little sandwich shop in the lakeview area. The food is always fantastic. They make everything from scratch - including the bread! Also, the prices can't be beat. I always recommend this place to my friends looking for a quick, cheap and delicious bite to eat. If you are able to save room for dessert make sure to try the buckeyes. They're to die for!

What a fantastic little sandwich place!!  Extremely reasonably priced, and very good quality.  Be aware of the cash only feature, but other then that, a definite must stop through.  Happy to give my recommendation of the chicken diablo, although I feel it could be hotter.  Don't hesitate to grab a dessert on your way out.  And tell them Brandon sent you, it wont mean anything, but it sure makes me feel cool.

I hate giving just three stars to Panes, but due to recent events, I must be honest.  Hopefully after seeing this, they will pick it up a little and get back to that FABULOSITY that they are.  I live just down the street and started frequenting Panes about three years ago.  They had a cute little place, great prices and the food was INCREDIBLE! The service is okay, but I think the girls who work there are just shy, so I can respect that. The owner is a professionally trained chef who broke off from the restaurant scene years ago to open this delicious little cafe/deli/bakery  hybrid.  They make all of their food from scratch - right down the the bread (you can buy fresh bread there).   Up until recently, they never missed a beat - fresh breads, fresh fruit and vegetables, amazing service.  But recently, probably within the past three months, they have, well, kind of sucked.  On more than a few occasions the food has been yucky.  For example, I ordered a container of their fresh fruit only to find it practically fermented from being so old (no joke).  The melon was literally translucent from being in the container for so long.  And just last night, I ordered a Chicken Quesadilla (it comes with homemade salsa and mashed potatoes).  I got home from picking up my order to discover no mashed potatoes (bummer, I was feeling sick and really wanted those bad boys) and the salsa was fermenting!  The salsa has been a problem several times in the past. What is with the fermentation of their produce!?  I'm not exaggerating, the stuff was literally fermenting.  It was disappointing to see that half of my meal was missing, too. I will say that I ordered a piece of their delicious Coca Cola cake and it was every bit as wonderful as I remembered.   I really, truly love this place and I love giving this small business my service.  I also don't mind that it's cash only...shoot, if I had a small business I would do the same thing!  I just wish they'd watch some things, take the time to throw out old bread/fruit/salsa and keep the freshness going. I don't know what's going on with Panes, but they need to pick up the slack, or I'm going to take my service elsewhere.

Must try lunch spot.  Always consistent and fantastic food, the polo diablo is a must try.  Reasonable prices but bring cash! Homemade bread used for the sandwiches is very tasty...love the bread with a hint of rosemary.

I love freshly baked bread. If today I could die and go to heaven and only eat freshly baked bread....I just might take up the offer! I love good French bread (something that I wish I could make better myself) and really love to tell the world when I genuinely encounter it. Fellow bread lovers, unite! The place is a lunch place is the beginning, middle and end. The menu supports this lunch fair, focusing upon the beautiful bread (which I guess they use to make sandwiches), pizzas, and cookies. The staff is friendly (although I think French?) but perhaps a little pert for some people's taste. As I eat here only on beautiful days, I tend to eat el fresco.  Eat anything here. There are NO bad choices. I will even buy you lunch if you disagree. Unless you just don't know good food, then it's your own fault. Edit: Almost forgot: CASH ONLY!!

I live in Lakeview and have been to Panes quite a few times (my husband is a big fan of their sandwiches). However, I recently had such a bad experience and downright rude service, I will not be going back. We ordered takeout, and I chose a pasta that was supposed to come with artichokes, spinach, sundried tomato pesto and goat cheese. My husband picked up the order, and what I got was plain pasta with a few peices of eggplant, a couple chunks of raw tomatoes and a glob of goat cheese on top - no sauce.  I called and explained the mix-up, and the first person I spoke with did say if I brought the pasta back, they would make me the dish I ordered. However, given that it would have taken me another 30-45 minutes to walk back myself, exchange it, and go back home to eat it, I asked if they could just credit me for the pasta. She said, "Oh, I don't know..." So I asked if there was someone else she could ask. Another person then got on the phone (I assume this was the manager) and told me that was the pasta I ordered. I read her the description from the menu I had, but she told me they changed the menu, and I had in fact ordered the dish I received, and I must have an old menu. No apology whatsoever. I had an out of date menu, and that was all she would offer me. (Why would you change a menu, but continue to use the same names if the dishes had changed? But I digress...) So I asked one last time if there was anything she could do, and she simply said "no." I then told her that they would be losing our business since they refused to do anything to rectify the mix-up. She said, "ok." I then told her I'd be writing a yelp review as well, and again, she just said, "ok." It could have easily been fixed with a promise to credit me next time, or even just a simple apology. I was once a loyal customer, but sadly will not be returning after this horrible display of "customer service."
Cheap, good, fresh... best local place in the area. The Pollo Diablo is awesome. Cash only.

Great little lunch spot!  We found this place by chance and loved it. Bread is homemade and the ingredients were so fresh. You can tell they put the time and effort to make their food special.  I like that they only take cash because it keeps their prices down.

Food was great... I had the Pollo Diablo.... was supposed to be spicy, I was only mild.... and my Girlfriend had the all italian it was fantastic.... oh and there desert..... just remember you have to try the cheesecake...

Great sandwich shop and cafe- I came here early on a Saturday late morning soon after it opened, and there were definitely regular customers that trickled in right away. Prices were very reasonable at about $5.95 for sandwiches on home-made bread, and many unique selections. Ordered sandwiches to go for a beach picnic, including the Chicken Club, Pollo Diablo, and Oaxacan Pork. All were a hit. They also have a selection of other small desserts and treats, like tiramisu, coconut flan, potato salad, fruit salad, etc. Thought their tiramisu was great and hit the spot. I would return again. For anyone who wants to dine in, the sitting area is pleasant and clean. Very close to Wellington Brown line. Cash only.

This could be my favorite sandwich shop in all of Chicago (or that I've been to). The bread is fresh, all of the food is always great (they have salads, pizzas, and pastas too), and you can't beat the prices here. I actually hesitate to write this because of exposing it to more people. One thing they added a couple years ago was a Sunday brunch (10-3, I think) and the verdict? Amazing. Bring cash to this gem as they do not except plastic.

Panes is the place to go for lunch in this neighborhood. It's become our go-to spot to bring guests given it's amazing prices (under $6 for a sandwich or salad) and large variety of options. No out-of-towner sticker shock here. Every sandwich I've had has been delicious due to Panes' fresh homemade bread (check out the tomato bread). And the salads are always incredible crisp, none of that wilting lettuce crap. And no visit would be complete without a monster cookie. (The chocolate chip are also delicious, just make sure you ask for a fresh one.) And remember it's cash only. Wish Panes was open earlier!
This is a gem in Lakeview.  One of the best sandwiches places around.  Always fresh and delicious.  Never had a bad thing from here.

Panes is one of my all-time favorite Chicago stops.  It is located off the Wellington Brown Line and is outstanding.  I always get the Pollo Diablo.  It is very spicy and very good.  Add extra cheese for more kick.   The desserts are great too. The only reason it is not 5 stars is they still only take cash, which stinks but at least they deliver now and have for the past couple years.

I came here with my five year old because she had a couple of appointments in Illinois Masonic across the street.  It's a small counter service place, but they bring your food to you. We sat outside which is a little close to the street just because it's a pretty narrow sidewalk.  My daughter had the "Jamon Con Alcachofas" pizza which had smoked ham, artichoke hearts, roasted red peppers crumbled goatcheese and spicy tomato sauce. I had the Tortilla salad which was a typical salad named such.  We shared each others and were both happy. The prices are great and if I'm in that neck of the woods again I'd go back.

I will never return to Panes Bread Cafe. I parked my car and put enough money in the meter for 24 minutes, thinking that should be more than enough time since I was ordering to go.  But apparently not.  By the time I got back to my car with my food more than 30 minutes had gone by, and I now had a parking ticket.  Thank you very much Panes Cafe. Not to mention the fact that the 4 customers that came in after me got their food first.  And it's not that I ordered anything elaborate, it was a BLT.  How hard can that be to make, and to make quickly? After the 4 other customers received their orders I asked a woman why I hadn't gotten my food yet.  She checked in the kitchen and nonchalantly said it would be right out, and a couple minutes later it was finally ready. Once I realized I had gotten a parking ticket I went back and saw the girl I had asked about my food.  I was visibly upset but I was not yelling when I started to show her my ticket and tell her that they lost a customer.  In mid sentence she walked away and mumbled something about getting the manager.  I said that wasn't necessary, all I wanted to do was let them know that they had lost a customer because their service was so terrible.  She wouldn't listen to anything I said and kept walking away from me. There was a busboy standing there so before I walked out I told him that I will never be back because it is ridiculous to wait for 25 minutes for a BLT, AND get a parking ticket because of the wait. I was not interested in talking to the manager because I had already wasted enough of my short lunch break.  But also, I wasn't seeking compensation.  I know they won't pay for my ticket and I don't want my next lunch to be free, or whatever else they might do, because I will never be back.

Just to keep the reminder going, it's cash only! It would be horrible to walk into the this place without cash and realize you can't order any of their delicious sandwiches. I've been here a few times and it's been great every time. I recommend the Todo Italiano, the homemade pesto is awesome. The fresh bread really puts these sandwiches over the top. I've never heard anyone say a bad thing about this place and with good reason. Can't wait to try more of their sandwiches and desserts.

Great sandwich shop with a pretty diverse menu.  Panes was recommended to us by a friend since we were just visiting Chicago for the weekend and I could not have been happier with the suggestion.  I got the Pollo Diablo which was pretty good although I was expecting something a lot spicier.  We were with a group of 8 and there was just enough room for all of us to sit due to the small size of the cafe.  Everyone enjoyed their meal, the only annoyance being the no credit or debit card policy.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the mood for a good lunch or a quick dinner.
Great fresh sandwiches. Worth the walk away from Potbelly's. Cash only. Also, so many girls hang out here I dare proclaim you could meet a wife here.

Having only frequently Panes a handful of times, I'll tell you why... NO CREDIT CARDS. But, whatever, make a special trip to the bank for your extra special (and cheap!) Panes meal. They have a great assortment of sandwiches, salads, and pastas. If you're lucky, they'll also have crumbles of their yummy cookies waiting at the front of the line while you're "contemplating" super hard on your meal decision while shoveling them in your mouth. "I just don't know what to get (nom nom nom nom) maybe if I (nom nom nom nom) just focus on what meat I want (chew chew nom nom), it will make my choice easier! Ok, back to the real food. I've only had sandwiches here, but that just means I'm confident in saying that they freakin rock. If you like spicy, try the Pollo Diablo. Otherwise, go with The Popular (gee, I wonder why?!) with delicious carmelized onions/chicken or the Turkey Turkey to be safe if you're non-adventurous or something of that sort.  The wiches really are cheap here, and they come with potato chippies, which I don't even think are necessary. There's free water, some outdoor seating (though kinda loud from the El) and lovely people watching (I mean YOU, watching ME eat, ya know?!) I hear they do breakfast mighty nice and have quite the delicious pasta dishes. Perhaps more cash in my wallet will allow me to stop by here more frequently now that I live closer. Dun dun dunnnnnnn!
I ordered a turkey club, and was a little disappointed at the lack of meat on the sandwich.  I did, however, think it was well priced and the place itself was cute.

I found Panes about five years ago by accident. I no longer live in the city, but I still make the 35 mile trip into the city just to go to this place.  I have tried a few of the sandwiches, but my favorite is the Pollo Diablo. The chicken is shaved rotisserie chicken on fresh bread made in house. The sauce is a chipotle mayo that it fantastic (Ive spent bout $50 trying to find a chipotle mayo in a grocery store that tastes as good as theirs. Still trying to find it.) Needless to say, I really like this place and is the thing is miss most about the city.
Mmmm good and reasonable.  We typically get the turkey turkey  or the roasted beef.
