It's all about the Turkey Turkey and the monster cookie. I usually do take out, and recommend calling ahead to place your order. I'm almost glad they are cash only, because I would stop in every time I walked by if I carried enough cash on me!

I've been to Panes a handful of times over the years and had good experiences, so when I needed lunch before a doctor's appointment nearby I decided to visit again. Oh my god the baked lemon pudding with blueberries and sour cream was divine. I should have bought two of them. Next time I will. Also had their pasta salad, which was tasty and filling. Included in my takeout bag were a chunk of sweet bread and little tubs of butter. I don't know what people have against bread and butter, it's simply delicious, especially at Panes.

Panes is a short walk away to sandwich heaven.  CASH ONLY. Don't forget that.  They have a nice small outdoor seating area which is nice and the indoor area only has a few tables. It's casual, quick, and scrumptious. I've never walked away feeling disappointed or unsatisfied. It's definitely a great spot for lunch as opposed to your usual chains.

One visit only, on a weekend trip from New York--holy cow! Portabella mushroom sandwich with goat's cheese and spinach was generously sized and unbelievably delicious. $6 for so much goodness=one happy traveler. I'll be back next time I am in Chicago...

If you are looking for lunch, or the best sandwich on the planet, this is the place to go. If you happen to be anti-sandwich, or if you think Wonder bread is an acceptable sandwich vessel, please stay far, far away. My favorite sandwich: Oaxacan pork sandwich. The pork is evenly spiced and works quite well with their spicy mayo. The bread itself needs to be bowed down to. If you don't like pork, get the Turkey, Turkey.  MAKE SURE you have cash. They are a cash-only joint and you really don't want to walk across the street to the ATM while the others in line just glare at your ignorance.
There are no better sandwiches in the city. That's all you need to know. (In addition to it being cash only, I suppose.)

I'm giving 2 stars based on the following: 4 stars if you dine in, 1 star if you carry out.  I guess they bank on your not being motivated enough to bring your sandwich back to show them that they've forgotten to include the contents (and I wasn't).  Seriously, 2 people, 2 sandwiches, both nearly empty.  At least the bread is tasty. See "turkey turkey take away" pic above.

This is my favorite lunch spot in Chicago.  Pure heaven.  They bake the bread fresh here and have marvelous sandwiches.  Go for the tomato focaccia bread.  It is soft and packed with flavor.  The best sandwich on the menu is called "The Popular".  Sandwich is loaded with chicken, spinach and crmelized onions on the tomato focaccia bread.  Yum!  Also a winner is their pulled pork sandwich.  Just a standard sandwich but they do it oh so well.   Also worth noting are the monster cookies.  They are basically the best cookie ever.  They are huge and packed with just about everything.   On rare occasion, they have an oatmeal cranberry cookie that is alos delish. Overall the price is super affordable.  You can get a sandwich (they come with chips in the sandwich basket), a cookie, and a drink for $8 or $9 and this place is gourmet for lunch in my opinion.  FYi, it is cash only.

Great place for lazy-asses who want amazing homemade meals and desserts in one place (me!).  Friendly staff, fresh ingredients, and cute ambiance. I honestly don't need to say more- it's almost a waste of words.  But don't forget- cash only.

Panes is the best and most reasonably priced place to get a salad, sandwich, cookie, or truffle in this neighborhood. When I go to Panes with friends who've never been there before, I often end up running into them at Panes weeks later because they have become regulars. This place makes their own bread and truffles, all of which are absolutely amazing. My favorite menus items: portabella sandwich Greek salad anything on the specials chalkboard monster cookie york peppermint patty brownie ALL THE TRUFFLES THEY MAKE ALL THEIR BREADS

If only I lived closer.  Sandwiches are really good and reasonably priced.  The various desert balls are all really great too-my favorite is the one with chili powder on it.  Every sandwich I've had here I've enjoyed - I would definitely recommend the pollo diablo or the Oaxacan pork.

I'm not sure how many times I've passed by this place without ever having eaten there. It never really grabbed my attentionGranted, I'm certain a good number of those times involved me stumbling down the street but still.  Anyway, my girlfriend and I met up there one night after work and as I bit into my sandwich it suddenly occurred to me why she loved this place so much. That thing was f-ing delicious and she was right about the bread being outstanding. I devoured the turkey sandwich I had with no regrets. The prices are excellent but it did irk me that it was cash only but that's only because Meghan paid (she knew and didn't tell me.. clever girl) (she knows I like paying) (I've since learned to start carrying more cash).  I can't wait to go back and explore the rest of the menu at Panes.
Roasted Beef - the best.  The desserts are amazing - I love the coconut flan.  Love this - so fresh and amazing.

My favorite sandwich shop in Chicago.  Cheap, DELICIOUS, and friendly--not sure who the reviewers are who've had bad experiences with the staff, but I've spent just about every Sunday for the last year and everyone's been super nice.  Good coffee too.

Woohoo! Panes is as good as it gets for sandwiches, the bread is amazing and we have developed a love for their ham & cheese as well as the cream puffs.  You've got to go there! While, it's usually packed, the last time we went on Saturday at 2, it was not as crazy.
Borracho loves the Pollo Diablo sandwich! Big fan of anything that has the same name as my fighting stance.

Amazing, in one word.  I had their veggie sandwich with yellow squash, spinach, and mushrooms and a ton of goat cheese. It was exactly what i wanted and so delicious!  I also tried their truffles and bullseyes; i could seriously eat a dozen of the bulleyes they were so good!

How have I never been here before?!  The sandwiches are amazing!  Such variety, fresh ingredients, and amazing bread. Try the deserts!  Had a peanut butter ball, and Kahlua truffle. WOW! 5.95 for most sandwiches is a bargain.  This place is pure awesome. Cash only.  I went for lunch and am returning for dinner.

I have eaten here a few times, the last time was the best time for sure! Kicked off with some free brownie samples from the counter, some darn good brownies for sure! The second kick off, the one we paid for...  Cranberry bread, it was cranberry and something or cherry and something, all I know is it was amazing! One small complaint I asked if they could heat this loaf of heaven in the oven so it could be a warm alter ready to receive the religious experience of bathing in loads of butter, the first time I asked she out and out ignored the request, mind you we were the only people in the restaurant, second time she said NO, I thought she must think I was asking if they had some warm, so I asked again with more explanation, and she said NO we will burn the bread, I am not 12, and since about 12 I have heated already cooked bread in a warm oven or even microwave so that butter will melt more easily, anyway, I was a bit put off.... So I was pleasantly surprised after that back and forth, this decidedly not warm loaf of cranberry bread was moist and wonderful and the butter was soft so it spread oh so easily, this good size loaf was easily consumed most with butter but when we went through all our butter rations and a third of that beautiful bread loaf still sat winking at me...I dove in dry, holy good even unbuttered batman, it was still wonderful and soon it was all gone! Second appetizer, on what turned into a carb parade, was big soft pieces of country toast bathed in a thick layer of goat cheese, these were melt in your mouth amazing,  a stark savory flavorful contrast to the sweet beginnings we had just swam through... My main course was amazing but not as life changing as the first two, I had a roast beef sandwich and substituted the tomato bread in lieu of the standard bread for this on menu masterpiece, this sandwich was warm melty wet juicy and just plain really good and quickly disappeared!

This place has the best sandwiches in the city! They are moderately priced and extremely good. Everything is fresh and tasted amazing from the sandwiches to the salads to the cookies. They have something for everyone and everyone will love it!

Good ol' Panes... a friend of mine stopped in here on a whim many years ago and tried a truffle and a buckeye. We've been coming back ever since. The prices are extremely reasonable, especially for the area. The homemade bread makes the creative sandwiches all the more delicious. The desserts are plentiful and always incredible. I mean, come on: york peppermint patty brownies? Agave truffles? Ridiculously creative cheesecakes that I can't remember at the moment? How can you possibly go wrong? If Panes ever closes, I don't know what my friends and I will do. But looking at these reviews and the fact that buisness has been hopping all these years, I certainly don't see that happening any time soon.

This hidden gem of a restaurant is one of our best finds for lunch.  We've tried the salads, sandwiches and pizza's.  Always really good.  Hard to choose what to have each time.  My daughter and I usually will order 2 different things and share.  Staff is always very friendly.  My daughter found this by researching on YELP and reading the reviews.  Such a helpful website!
Good cookies and sandwiches poor attitudes by the staff - go for take out. Cash only!!

What a fantastic lunch!  Just wish the lady who took our order didn't give off the vibe that she had much better things to be doing at the moment. Hate that feeling like you should apologize for patronizing a business. No big deal, hopefully it was just an off day, 'cause I would definitely love to stop here again.

Love this place! The food is good, large portion and super affordable, especially for the area. Sunday brunch is really good as well, love the chilaquiles! Only 4 stars because the service is terrible.

It was alright, I guess. I'd been excited for quite some time to try it out. The neighborhood is a lot of fun and I thought that I'd found a new sandwich spot (yes, it's bread with stuff in the middle but getting it right is an art form). Sadly, I have not. Why? 1.) The service. For most of my visit, I thought I was at an ice cream shop -- I got the cold shoulder. Yikes. I understand that everyone has bad/off days, but I interacted with three people and all three avoided eye contact, acted as though they wanted to be anywhere than at Panes and doing anything else than helping me. I was beginning to develop a complex but I was relieved (ha!) to see that patrons after me were treated in a similarly dismissive way. 2.) The food. It wasn't bad but it wasn't memorable. It's times like these that i am glad I make notes about my business experiences. Hey, it's a job. I take it seriously. I ordered 'The Popular' and by description, I can understand the name: chicken, carmelized onions, spinach, peppers, and provolone. It's also supposed to be served on tomato bread. Mine was not. I don't know whether they ran out or made a mistake, but I ate my sandwich on a crunchy baguette. I am not a baguette kind of guy because, invariably, the hard sonsofb!tches rip up the roof of my mouth. This one was no different. The sandwich was not enjoyable and not what I ordered. 3.) Lack of attention. The bread thing shouldn't have happened. Either the person making my sandwich didn't know how to make it (problem), didn't care what s/he was doing (problem) or couldn't be bothered to tell me the difference in the item on which I spent my money (problem). In any of these scenarios, I can't find a satisfactory answer. When coupled with the bizarre service, it's more proof to me not to come back. Luckily for them, I am a fatty with a sweet tooth. The monster cookie came out of nowhere to give me good lovin', rock me through the night, light my cigarette, AND make me breakfast in the morning. That cookie saved this review. It's as good as everyone says. If you come here and don't order the cookie, I question your ability to read. In fact, I'll go so far as to say the cookie is the only reason to come here... and it alone is worth three stars.

OK I have been eating here for over ten years. They are always always consistent. Good value. They roast their own meats so it isn't that processed deli stuff. They make their own bread, soups, deserts, truffles, cookies, etc all in an old fashioned family owned and operated business. So many small places buy all that in not here. They do it all themselves. I have had less then perfect once or twice here but I have had many many more great ones The diablo, the  Oaxacan pork, all good. The portions are just right. Not skimpy, not too much. They are healthy sized of quality fresh foods. I like to support indie restaurants. The prices are reasonable. They give a very small bag of potato chips with your order for free. To the yelper that complained that they were too small they are the same as a place like cosi or panera would give away. Those places couldn't hold a candle to the creative quality food they serve here.

My husband and I went there for dinner tonight because of the rave reviews. Our food was terrible! I had a chicken pesto sandwhich that was bland and on rosemary olive oil bread - horrible combination with pesto! My husband's sandwhich was bland as well. In addition, the "chips" that come with the sandwhich are a tiny bag of plain Lay's potato chips - for a place that is supposed to specialize in homemade treats, plain Lay's potato chips are not a great call. Next time we're sticking with the italian place across the street or DMK - far superior places - don't waste your money on the sandwhiches.

Shhh. No one tell my husband, but I think he's got someone trying to move in on his wife! Well, ok, it's not a someone, it's a something, more specifically, this restaurant! Wowza! I think I died and went to sandwich heaven. Panes is unequivocally the best sandwich place in the City. Every thing about my sandwich screamed "Eat me! You'll Love me! You'll be dreaming about me!" I had the veggie sandwich and it was pure perfection. The goat cheese and fresh roasted veggies coated with some sort of Mediterranean dressing made me very, very happy in more ways than one. The sandwich itself was huge. You have to be super hungry to put away that bad boy. My husband had one of the turkey sandwiches and I know it was phenomenal because he 1) ate it in complete silence and 2) it was gone within a minute. We also split a pasta with goat cheese and tomatoes as a side (gluttony, I know) and it was on par with any of the great pastas we've had in the city. The sandwiches come with a bag of chips on the side and the pasta came with this insanely fresh and crisp yet chewy in the middle bread. I mean come on, that bread alone can give you a happy ending. Then, to top off the feast, I had a chocolate chip cookie. When I tell you that this was the best cookie I've ever had you will probably not believe me. Well, too bad--you now have to go and try it for yourself. I nearly fainted when I took a bite into that chunky chocolate, heavily brown sugar and butter-based baked orgasm. Believe me, you will not be disappointed with anything at Panes.  I can't believe you're still reading this--you should be on your way there now--it's that good!

Just finished my sandwich so I thought i'd yelp.   Got the turkey turkey.  Besides the bread the sandwich was a pretty standard sandwich.  The meat is definitely processed which I am not a fan of.  Just one sliver of avocado on each side of the sandwich.  But the bread was super fresh and tasty, because of that I will give the place another shot.   They do need to join the modern times and start accepting cards, cash only is a real pain in the...

cash only? seriously panes?  its 2011.  if you can't run a business that accepts modern forms of payment you shouldn't be in business. the food is good but it's not worth the inconvenience if you don't have cash on you. there are so many options for merchants today when it comes to payment processing that this kind of stuff just doesn't fly anymore.

I'd give this place five stars on the bread alone.  The food was great.  Ordering was simple, no frills and quick.  The seating sucks.  Everything is too close together and packed.  Recommend take-out.

I used to love this place but I don't know what is going on with it lately. I have gotten the rigatoni pasta with cream sauce last night and I have to say that I really think they used "Ragu" for the sauce. There sandwiches are decent but I do have to say their bread and desserts are excellent which is the only reason I have given it 3 stars. I feel there is so much potential in this place but it's just not living up to it.

Delicious sammies and deserts.  It gets busy during lunch and dinner so be ready to wait up to ten mins for both dine in and to-gos if you don't call ahead.  Parking is tough at peak times. The Turkey Turkey has been my favorite sandwich for the last five years.

I'll continue to preach the good word.....  Great food, Fair prices, Family owned. I live in the neighborhood and have been coming here for 10 years.  I have tried everything on the menu.  Sandwiches, Pastas, Salads, Appetizers, Breads, Soups, Desserts -  They are all Superb. O taste and see that Panes is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in them. ....can I get an Amen brother?
They make all of their delicious bread in house fresh every day.  You should also try of some of their amazing baked goods; totally worth the calories!

Awesome spot for lunch with incredible prices.  $4.95 for a huge sandwich plus chips - can't be beat!  Their Oaxacan Pork sandwich is absolutely to die for - super tender, perfectly seasoned and all around happiness in my mouth.  I'd give this place 5 stars but I haven't sampled the whole menu - unfortunately I discovered the Oaxacan Pork amazingness on my second visit and can't bring myself to ever order anything else!

No joke, this is the best sandwich place.  The bread is homemade (the family that runs the place is awake at 4am baking) and the meat/cheese/veggie/whatever ratio on the sandwiches is perfect, with just the right amount of sauce.  I've tried nearly all of the sandwiches and they're all great.  My most recent favorite is the popular, with Chicken, spinach, red peppers, provolone and pesto on tomato bread.  Yum! This place is particularly warm and cozy on a cold night.  Or, when it's warm out, you can sit outside and enjoy your sandwich!  The place smells of bakery goodness and the staff is kind, but not overbearing.  Be prepared for a small crowd if you go on the weekend from 10am-1pm - but Panes is, without a doubt, worth the wait!

This place is awesome. It is a family run joint that makes good honest food. Their prices are a steal when you consider the quality of the place; I love it for it's value. The Popular is probably my favorite sandwich thus far but I have a lot more to try! Where is their web page? I had to knock them a star for not having one or at least not making it easy to find.

I just had one of the best sandwiches in the recent years at this place. I ordered an oaxacan pork sandwich, and I finished it in 5 minutes. Not because it's small. It's a sizable sandwich. But it's so tasty, I devoured it. My gf ordered a sloppy pollo, and she finished it as quickly as I did. It's just phenomenal. Thumbs up from me.

SLOPPY POLLO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! ALLL THE WAYY!!! I've been here numerous times and have tried many things. Some were ehhh... ok? Some things were disappointing.. I wondered if I'd ever find something that I'd REALLY like... and there it iwas: Sloppy Pollo was on the top list for me. It was everything I expected and more. The chicken was tender and finely shredded so you would even think it was a Sloppy joe? But... a healthier version :) The BBQ was obviously home made and soooo decliious! And they're bread was lightly toasted to the texture and to the warmth. This is great to eat in this cold winter weather. HIGHLY recommend it. Ordered this 4 times now and was never disappointed. Btw, go there for their sandwiches, not so much on their desserts. I mean,... they were so-so.... not outstanding to the point that I'd force someone to buy it but if u are craving something real bad then sure, get one of their gigantic monster cookies :)
The bread here is incredible!  The sandwiches are tasty and large. My go to place for sandwich! make sure to check out their specials board for daily specials that rock.  oh and they deliver now too.

It does not get any better than this for a sandwich shop. YUMMY!and unique. Best bread this part of Chicago. Watch out though- I've seen several people get caught empty handed by their cash only policy.

can't say how much I love Panes! But I'll try! The Sunday brunch is such a deal. The chilaquiles are great and huge as are the panes brioches styled French toast. On a weeknight try the Oaxacan sandwhich! It's a zesty porkchop with authentic Mexican sweet and spicy flavor in between homemade bread. A great dinner and a big lunch!

AN INSTITUTION. What can I say???? Panes I love you. When I lived down the street I went to you almost everyday. Now that I live so far it saddens me I can only go to you when I'm at work. Your HAM and CHEESE is my most recent fascination. Every aspect of it is perfect. When I'm hangovered and weary, it lifts me UP!  And on days when I crave sweet yumminess, your SLOPPY POLLO fulfills my every wish. The juicy barbecue sauce melts in my mouth with your tender pieces of chicken. BUT how can I forget the one sandwich that started this all? The TURKEY TURKEY. Oh you amazing sandwich. I've never had one quite like you. EVER. On amazing focaccia bread, with savory spicy mayonnaise and roasted red peppers. I've had way too many of you in my life. I had to give you up for a while.  Oh and my boyfriend loves your POPULAR. Not my thang. But he swears by it, and I would never doubt his opinion. How could you ever be not good?!?!?!??! Mac and cheese, you're hardy and cheesy. You are an excellent reminder of why I love Mac and Cheese so much. Buying your daily fresh bread let me try to recreate your wonderfulness on my own time. Though I could never live quite up to you, the french bread loaf was still amazing. Panes; I miss you. You are the perfect sandwich place. And with your $6.00ish price tag for your works of art, I will love you forever.  Love, Katie

Easily one of the hidden gems of Lakeview.  The sandwhichs that are offered are all spectacular.  You can also make one to order.  I reccomend the Pollo Diablo.  Also, check the board to the right of the register for their daily specials.  They know what they are doing, and throw in some great Mexican twists on what they are offering.   It is cash only however.  I also reccomend trying something from the desert case to bring home.  Everything I have ever tried has been amazing.  Parking can be a bitch, and lunch can get crowded.  So, if you want, you can order what you want and pick it up to go (or be a jerk and pick it up and eat it there).

Definitely a diamond in the rough.  Four different sandwiches have been fantastic and the split pea soup (which I normally never order) was amazing!  Two people can be easily satisfied for under $15.  Conveniently located just off the Wrightwood EL stop, I frequent here a few times per week...Enjoy!

I was in the mood for Panera and my friend recommended we go to this place. We just ate here for lunch about an hour and a half ago and I am still nicely stuffed. I wasn't extremely hungry, so I got the caesar salad (which comes with chicken, not on their description on the menu but I was going to ask for that anyway) and it was really good. The salad came with a side of bread which was really good, fresh, and soft. It is a pretty generous portion and was just the right amount of food for me. And it's right down the street from my friend's house which is even better. I'll definitely go back if I'm back in the area; it seems like a nice hidden gem that you might walk right past if you weren't looking for it. I've also heard their cookies are really delicious!

GREAT little sandwich shop along the brown line. They have a huge selection of meats to chose from, awesome homemade breads for the sandwiches, and don't forget the cookies!  One sandwich is PLENTY for two people to share (ok, two ladies to share), and I'll be stopping in here next time I'm up north!
Fantastic sandwiches on fresh baked bread, in a nice non-crowded section of Sheffield.
I'm a little embarassed to admit that like this place so much that last weekend I got it twice in one day.

I've heard this rated one of the top five cheap eats in Chicago and I understand why. Everything is cooked fresh and homemade. The restaurant is charming and quaint. I've only ever ordered sandwiches and pastas, but been consistently happy with my selection.  It's certainly a comforting place to go for very comforting feel-good food. They always have the day's specials listed on the wall and I have never been disappointed with anything off the daily menu or the regular menu for that matter. I'm also a little reluctant to recommend the sweet french bread loaves that are baked fresh everyday since they are always out of them by the time I get there to pick one up, but they are addictive. Just be sure to have cash in your pocket because they do not take credit cards.

I got in a rut one Summer.  I'd stop in at Pane's every night and get the tortilla salad with chicken, avocado, tomato, that white, crumbly cheese, and tortilla strips on it.  I did that for about 3 weeks.  I always looked at the other stuff that they had and finally broadened my horizons.  I found out that everything they make is good.  I really love the Oaxacan pork sandwich with spicy mayo and the BLT.  Their tomato bread is good just on its own and I recommend the coca cola cake - strongly recommend.  I wish they took plastic though because sometimes I forget and I hate paying the surcharge to get cash from the ATM at Pompeii.

I'm honestly surprised at all of the overwhelming positive reviews for this place. I've been here twice, the first time I was not impressed, the second time same story. I tried a couple different things on their menu and both failed to impress. From what I remember this place was cash only, which is just a pain, there are better food options in the area, I probably won't go back.

The food here is fantastic.  The bread is fresh, the menu selections are really tasty and feel more home-made than any other sandwich option of which I am currently aware in the city.   I would so much rather have a sandwich from Panes Bread Cafe than a Potbelly's (but love those too).  Panes Bread Cafe has fresh bread.  There is only one reason I have to give this place only 3 stars rather than four or five and that is the consistently poor customer service.  They are never happy in this place.  I don't know what it would take to get service with a smile or a "thanks for coming in" from one of the owners because I've received more enthusiasm from McDonald's and KFC employees who have no ownership in their work.  It bothers me that they can't smile or be friendly.  It's just a transaction to them. They take your money and hand over the sandwich.    Go in there and try to get them to smile. They clearly need it. Their sandwiches will make you smile, just wish the owners could too.

This place is amazing. For those of you who have had a less than perfect experience, go back and try the Turkey Turkey sandwich - it'll blow your mind. I could happily live off that sandwich for the rest of my life.  You can thank me later.

Cute little cafe! Sandwiches are simple and fresh at a great price too! They make breads and desserts in house.  I usually get the pompazo sandwich with flan or chocolate cake because I;m a creature of habit. Other popular ones are pollo loco? portabello?
Very fresh bread and delicious sandwiches! They also have very good cookies and other sweets. Perfect for lunch and cheap for the size of the sandwiches. Only bad thing is that it's cash only.

While it is true that the Oaxacan is definitely the winner, most of the chicken sandwiches I've had are delish (the popular and pompazo in particular).  Salads are so-so, but the soups are usually very tasty.  The truffles are an added bonus, cookies are excellent.  They deliver and woman who runs the joint/works the counter is great.

Can six dollars buy you the most delicious sandwich in Chicago? Yes. This is Panes. Every time i step foot inside, I am immediately happy. I know what is coming. The bread they use for the sandwiches is nothing short of divine, and the the overall ingredients they offer in the sandwiches are fantastic. Sorry Jerrys, but you just can't say no to beauty for such a cheap price. The Turkey Turkey is very delicious, but the Oaxacan pork is my favorite so far. But that might not last, for I plan on eating everything on the menu. I'll eat there everyday of the week if I have to........

I must've died and gone to heaven today, because I had the joy of tasting one of the best sandwiches I had on this planet. I had the Popular Chicken and I about cried--it was so delicious! The bread absolutely sang, so crispy but not too crispy where it hurts the roof of your mouth. I've already made a mental list of other sandwiches I want to try, and the pasta dishes look divine. Panes, after visiting you once, I am a lifelong customer. This place is amazing. GO HERE. Don't question anything. Bring cash. You will fall in love.

Love this place!!! Live right down the street but the sandwiches in my opinion are worth traveling for, they also have amazing homemade soups, salads, desserts and fresh baked bread. Five stars all the way, Keep it up panes I know I will keep coming back!!

Is there any other place in the city where you can get a delicious sandwich with fresh bread and quality ingredients for under $6? I could see why the popular is named that way...it will be tempting me every time i go in. My goal: I am going to try every sandwich on their menu. Bring cash!

3.5 The Oaxacan, as other reviewers have said, is the only thing to order on this menu.  My old roommate recommended it to me and it is by far something to write home about.   I would give them more stars but here is my issue.  Outside of teh Oaxacan, all the other things on the menu that i've tried were either bad or just OK, the hummus was not good.  It was coarse and it was served already in each peice of bread.  kinda weird if you ask me.  I wanted to be able to dip my bread in teh hummer.  The pizza bread was bad, something off about the sauce.  A combo of to much salt and then the cheese was plain.  Then finally, I brought home some banana bread and it was ehhhhghh.  Dry and lacked depth in the flavors.  I'm really critical of banana bread because it's my favorite.   Anyway, Panes, I love the Oaxacan but everything else is so-so.

As the "worst storm" in the midwest since the Edmund Fitzgerald was sunk 35 years was descending upon us chicagoans, I decided to brave the storm and grab lunch here. I stepped into the nice and warm cafe and ordered up a todo italiano, which was a chicken sandwich wrapped in prosciutto with red peppers, pesto, and mozzerela. The bread with it was really good and thick, but most importantly, the sandwich great. Anyday where eating prosciutto is involved is a good day, especially when it comes in sandwich form. Be sure to bring cash though. It caught me off guard and I had to run into the wellington brown line stop to use atm. It was definitely worth risking life and limb during this ridiculously awful storm

So I went to this place because of all the good reviews I read about it, but I didn't find the big deal about this place. Although they have very reasonable prices, I didn't really enjoy the food. I ordered The Popular and if it would have been executed correctly, then I would have given at least 4 stars. I must say the bread did taste amazing, it was a tomato bread. Delish! I didn't notice the chicken on the sandwich until the very last bite because the ''layer'' of chicken was soooo thin, it didn't really contribute to the sandwich. On the left part of the sandwich; a whole chunk of spinach, on the middle; a whole roasted red pepper and on the right side; another chunk of ''caramelized'' onions. I really felt I was eating nothing but a spinach sandwich. This came with a side of chips but from the looks of it, I got the very last part of the bag...where all you have are itty-bitty chips. And I would have enjoyed it more if they actually had espresso coffee, instead of brewed....but I guess, I can get good coffee somewhere else. To top it all off, if the sandwich was better executed (more chicken and the toppings better distributed), I would have enjoyed this place a whole lot more. And the lady who took my order could have at least TRIED to smile....at least once!

Every neighborhood should have a Panes.  Relatively cheap sandwiches and quality ingredients. During my few hours there, a constant stream of customers stretched from the counter to the door.  Clearly, this is a popular joint. I ordered the Pollo Diablo (spicy chicken) sandwich.  I enjoyed it, but I wished the chicken were just a little more tender.  It definitely had a kick to it.  The cheese was nice and melty, but it will cool quickly. Panes takes longer than a shop like Potbelly's, so you should know that before going in.  The trade-off is that you have a larger menu and some cool, unique sandwiches. I'd definitely go back for lunch when I'm in the neighborhood.

Incredible.....I have not had an item off of their menu where that by the time I finished I wasnt wondering what I was going to get next time. The bread is amazing, the flavors are wonderful, and the pasta is incredible.  Seriously, you cant go wrong at this place.

Hands down, the Pompazo is the best sandwich.  Ever.  I love this place.  Always get a loaf of bread to go, too.  Reasonably priced, the sandwiches are huge and original.  Other things on the menu look really good, too, but since I live 50 miles away I don't get here nearly often enough.  When I am in the neighborhood, I have to stop by for the Pompazo.  $4.95 for a hot, flavorful, perfect sandwich and a bag of chips.  Can't beat it.

I don't want to be a Negative Nancy about this place, but it really fell short of my expectations. I have heard a couple friends sing Panes' praises and have always had it on my list of places to try, so when I had the opportunity to do just that this week I was pretty excited.  The description of two stars says it perfectly: "Meh. I've experienced better."  There was just nothing dazzling about my experience. The shop itself was cute in a kitschy kind of way, it is small and clearly independently owned which gives it some heart and soul. I like that they sell loaves of homemade bread and cookies. But that is pretty much all the love I can shed.  The food was pretty disappointing. I am someone who LOVES sandwiches and could eat them (and usually do) on a daily basis. I am not necessarily hard to please, but this place did not get the job done. My boyfriend got the linguine with chicken and spicy tomato sauce. It was bland and the pasta was kind of soggy. I got a small salad with honey mustard dressing (which tastes nothing like honey mustard and a lot like mayo) and the chicken club sandwich. Halfway through my meal I took off the remaining chicken because it was flavorless...other than charred flavor. After that, the sandwich did get better but at that point I was just eating cheese, tomato, avocado, and bacon on bread (which is not a bad combo but not what I ordered).  To top it off, the service was less than warm. The woman who took our order did not look us in the face once, although she did have a nice tone to her voice. And the other woman that brought us our food looked like she hated life, I wanted to tell her to smile.  I doubt I will be going back; it is a good location, very reasonably priced, and has a great concept...but the execution just did not do it for me.

This place by far has the freshest sandwiches in Lakeview.  All of them are unique and tasty in their own way.  It truly stands alone.  If in a rush at lunch you can call ahead to make sure it is ready when you get there.  Huge sandwiches at a great price.  The only downside is the cash only policy which kinda sucks considering most people carry debit cards nowadays...

Please let me give 10 stars, please!?! Crunch factor of the bread is legit. There's nothing soggy about it, which I love. It doesn't rip the top of your mouth, like some "sandwich chains" out there, thank you so much for that. You need some cash flow, moolah, dinero, whatever you would like to call it, as they don't accept the plastic yet. I'm ok with that though. They said eventually they will be crossing that bridge when they get to it. :) And the prices are super reasonable. A ten spot can feed 2 hungry people. Love the chicken club with avocado. Seriously. I haven't tried anything but the sandwiches, because when a sandwich is as good as this, why try anything else?  The sammie staff is friendly and helpful. It gets super duper busy on the weekends, so keep that in mind.  Two thumbs up, a bunch of high fives in honor of this sandwich heaven.

Loved it.  Unique sandwiches at a great value.  We ordered our food to go, but it looked like a great patio to sit outside and eat. Also very generous portions, and a chance to eat some vegetables, as many of the sandwiches have spinach and/or peppers.  I'm a fan!!

The Oaxacan, enough said. But seriously, this little place is great.  A cute cafe in Lakeview right off the Wellington L stop that was a staple when I first moved to the city and didn't have groceries.  There are only about 10 tables inside and a few outside in good weather, but whether you get it to stay or go it is worth the trip.   They have a fairly large menu of unique and classic sandwiches, which are delicious.  I haven't strayed much from the Oaxacan Pork sandwich once I discovered it and haven't strayed from the sandwich section at all.  They start out with delicious bread and just add delicious ingredients.  I took my mom here while she was in town and she was amazed at how good it was.  Don't forget to stop at the ATM on your way because they only take cash.

One word: amazing. The sandwich and salad ingredients are fresh, innovative, and uncomplicated. I love the daily specials and have tried a few, all were delish. There isn't a single thing I haven't enjoyed eating here. The bread is baked in house and really magnifies the quality of the sandwich. The decor is cheerful, a bit eclectic, and epitomizes your neighborhood bodega.  Things to try: Portabella salad and sandwich (sandwich is the better of the two), the tortilla salad, the veggie cabra, Super Panes, and pollo diablo. The stuffed mushroom apps are yummy! The soups are great as well.   Last point: the price. Under $10 for an incredible sandwich, YES! Most of the food is around $7. Panes is a must go to for a casual weekend lunch, absolutely love it!

Incredible. I really can't think of anything more befitting of this place. I paid $14 for two sandwiches with chips each and a bottled beverage. I would gladly have paid more. I picked the Portabella option, on tomato bread, which I could eat every day for the rest of my life. Craig got "the Popular", which he devoured in ten minutes and then talked about the rest of the day. The place itself is adorable, nicely decorated and homey (well, maybe except for the creepy downstairs bathrooms), and the service is prompt if a bit brisk. I'd go here every day if I lived in Chicago. Every. Day.

Into it.  As far sandwich shops go, this place is the best.  Their freshly baked bread and un-boring sandwiches are the key.  While I'm here for lunch, I usually pick up a loaf of banana bread to take home.  It's only about 3 bucks, and it's super delicious! They have a surprising amount of entrees besides sammies, like pasta and chicken dishes.  Don't forget to look in the deli cases!  They contain unique desserts and giant cookies.  Although I've never eaten these items, I have stared at them during lunch.   I've only gotten one thing I didn't enjoy from this place - some sort of cold pasta salad.  But, hey, can't please all of the people all of the time.

Pannes is one of the best sandwich shops in the city. They have the most amazing rosemary bread.  The people that work there ALWAYS get my order right even when I make it confusing.  I love it... Highly recommended!

Great bread weakly crafted sandwiches.  Still one of my favorite sandwich spots in chicago that I've found.  If I'm in the mood for a sandwich I come to this place or Bourgeois Pig Cafe which is my favorite so far.
6 dollars. 5 cents. Cash. That's all you need in order to enjoy one of these amazing sandwiches. Oaxacan pork. Say it with me one time: Wah Hah Kin Pork.

What's not to like about Panes? It's in my neighborhood and before I went traveling it was staple in our sunday morning or otherwise lazy days. There's a great patio and huge sandwiches. This time around I ordered a spicy pollo, but I have a long list of favorites to choose from. If you didn't know this place existed, check it out- especially on nice days.

I work across the street from Panes at Illinois Masonic so I come to grab lunch on occasion.  I love this place. First and foremost, get a length of their fresh French bread in the morning. It's amazingly delicious with a nice, crisp crust, soft and fluffy inside and it's so sweet. All of their bread is wonderful. Secondly, the owners and staff are friendly, fast and accommodating.  The sandwiches are great (Oaxacan Pork is a personal favorite) and the desserts are to die for. The carrot cake is great but is out-done by their chocolate Coca-Cola with goat's milk caramel-cream cheese frosting.  Yes. You read that right.  Monster cookies are great too! I think I'll stop by for lunch tomorrow! - Eat on!

Panes is quite simply amazing. Once you've been, there really is no reason to go to another sandwich spot. Accordingly, I've been there numerous times over the past few years and make sure to take out-of-towners for lunch. It has always been well received. All you need to know is this place offers infinitely better food for the same price as any of the chain places (Subway, Potbelly, Quiznos, etc.). The space itself is tight/cozy but theres a fair amount of seating crammed into it. It does get crowded at lunch and the table turnover can get slow at times. But between the decor and people it definitely feels like a busy cafe which is cool if you have a seat to take it all in. Usually the same woman takes the order; I'm guessing shes the owner or manager. The process seems a bit robotic and at times has reminded me of the Seinfeld Soup Nazi, but true to the show the food is worth it. Sandwiches, pastas, salads and pizza anchor the menu and everything I've had has been most excellent - I'm partial to the BLT. Additionally theres usually a good variety of deserts, sweets and cookies that are worth the trip themselves. They also offer several different fresh loaves of bread or baguettes that are great for dinner at home. The Sweet French is delicious. Basically unless you don't like food or don't carry cash there is no reason not to try out Panes.

With 4.5 stars and 244 reviews, Panes doesn't exactly need my help.  I'll keep this short and sweet: It was extremely difficult to decide on a sandwich; every single thing on the menu looked great.  In an attempt to keep it simple, I ordered the Turkey Turkey sandwich, with turkey (duh), avocado, roasted red peppers, and spicy mayo, all on tomato bread.  The ingredients were fresh and flavorful, and I'll be dreaming about that tomato bread.  Just perfect!  I'd like to try one of the other sandwiches when I come back, but it'll be difficult not to order this one again and again! Prices are pretty cheap for the city, but remember to bring cash!

For under $7, I am wowed. Consistently. The sandwiches are delicious; the pasta bowls equal two meals. I cannot complain. The order-taker is off-standish; always the same person, true. And sometimes it takes a little bit. But, tolerable because the result is delicious.
Great salads and sandwiches and CHEAP!  Get the hummus bread

Got some stuff to take to the beach yesterday from here.  It was great.  I got the tuna salad, which came with a delicious piece of bread.  My wife got a sandwich and loved it. It has very unique decor and the workers are friendly.

I've been here at least 50 times and it's the best sandwich shop I've ever been to. Unbelievable sandwiches, salads, pasta, and pizza at unbelievable prices. I love the Super Panes sandwich.  Note: Cash only

I love panes.   Awesome sandwiches with fresh baked breads, tasty toppings, and all for just $6.00.  how can you beat that?  Plus, their monster cookie is worth the trip alone.  I think I've tried over 10 different sandwiches (Pollo Diablo, Popular, Super Panes my favs).  they never let me down.  Service can be a tad slow, but that's b/c everything is made to order.  Worth the wait.

I could not love this place any more. My roommate and I probably eat here once a week (not exactly big on the cooking) and have an amazing experience every time.  My all-time favorite is the Pollo Diablo sandwich, which smashes chicken, spice and cheese onto the most delicious sourdough ever. Nom. If you like sweets, get 1-15 peanut butter balls for 50 cents apiece. They're worth it.
The bread here is delicious!  I bought two small loaves this morning.  Rosemary-Olive Oil and Garlic-Olive Oil and they are so fresh and tasty I can't wait to go try some more!

This is my all-time favorite place for soup & sandwiches in Lincoln Park! The Oaxacan pork sandwich is my go-to order. My boyfriend usually orders the daily specials. We've been going to Panes for close to 10 years now, and we have yet to be disappointed!  Yummy, yummy, yummy!

For the longest time I've wanted to try this place, but we'd always just end up going across the street to Pompeii instead. Wow, was I missing out! For $5.50 (cash only) you get a sizable sandwich and your standard handful of chips. The sandwiches are pretty original, and there are quite a few vegetarian options. Both the portabello and tuna are delicious. And you're able to substitute for any of the bread choices, which means you never have to get stuck ordering the same thing. Panes, you are my new Lakeview sandwich shop of choice.
Fresh, healthy sandwich shop with a friendly atmosphere and great service

I kind of love this place.  I've been here twice and while I didn't love everything, I'd go back tomorrow and be quite happy.   On a really nice night, the patio is beautiful.  We sat outside today for a long time and it was comfortable and lovely. BLT = fabulous.  The bread is great, the bacon, the lettuce/tomato...everything.  I'd say in general all of the bread is good.  We had the hummus, it was a bit weird but it tasted pretty fabulous on  chips.  I also had the garlic + butter bread, and it was pretty much just chunks of garlic on bread, which wasn't bad but some of the pieces were a tad overwhelming (and I LOVE garlic with passion).  The banana bread was good.  Lastly, and a bit sadly, both me and my dining companion were disappointed in the cookies.  I can't explain why exactly, but they were not tasty.

I normally don't leave reviews for places that have so many already and obviously don't need my help, but I was so impressed with Panes I'm going to make an exception here. ;] It's a great place with a definite lunch feel to it, and you know me -- I LOVE lunch!  You wait in line, put in your order, take a number, have a seat, and they bring you your food when it's ready. Went with my sister and husband with $40 in gift certificates.  I can't think of anywhere else where that $40 could have been better spent!  We got 4 sandwiches -- 3 to eat there and 1 to take home, but I don't think any of us even finished in the first place.  Comes with chips and water is free, but we got drinks anyway (we were struggling to get to $40). Large sandwiches on freshly baked bread loaded with natural and tasty ingredients that made my mouth sing and my body feel better for having eaten there.  Not gut bombs here!  And how do they charge only $5.50?!  Incredible deal. To stretch the gift certificate, we all got desserts which were equally as delectable.  That homemade cheesecake is killer, and the cookies are so soft and moist. Just... yummmm. Decor is also super happy.  Bright colors and neat art all over.  It reminded me of Mexico in some ways and I loved it!  If you have a chance (or the need, of course), go to the bathroom there.  It's downstairs and I just thought it was so cute. :] To be honest, even after all that gorging, our order still wasn't $40, so they just gave me cash for the remaining $8 and change.  How killer is that?!  Big plus in my book. As far as a sandwich place goes, for the price, quality, and quantity of the food, Panes is truly as good as it gets!

I'm never disappointed when I eat at Panes, great food at a great price. The sandwiches are a good size and they don't skimp on the meat and cheese. The soups are always tasty, the lentil is my favorite. I love their stuffed mushrooms. Saturday and sunday they have brunch items too, fluffy delicious omelets among other things. The lemon cream with blueberries and the monster cookie will satisfy a monster sweet tooth. They have delicious looking cakes too. BTW, the bread is amazing.

Adorable, cheap, delicious. Great banana bread! I got a whole loaf for three bucks! The cookies look to die for so I can't wait to go back. My only complaint is that they don't take credit. Overall, love

How have I possibly lived so close to Panes for so many years without eating anything here other than the monster cookies?? Well, I'll tell you, a girl doesn't need much more than a monster cookie. But last night for dinner, I DID need more than a Monster cookie, and  wow is other stuff at Panes delicious!  We got a tortilla salad and a super panes, and basically split them (the salad was mine, but I liked  the sandwich so much that I ate a lot of that too.) The bread that came with the salad was so good that I put the leftovers in my purse. They were delicious for breakfast today.  My only complaint is it's cash only, and I never have cash, but that's probably good since otherwise I think I'd start going at least weekly.

This is a great place to eat! They have a variety of different things on their menu, but I went for a greek salad and flan. It was all very tasty, and it all came at a reasonable time considering the music fest that was going on just up on Belmont a bit. It has plenty of seating indoor and outdoor, and they have amazing freshly made breads! I wish I lived in the neighborhood so I could stop by to get bread for myself there! I give it 5 stars and I can't wait to go back to try some sandwiches!

This place is a gem. I stumbled upon it while running errands and will be back. Everything looked really good and they had a nice selection of sandwiches. I had a yellow squash, tomato, spinach, fresh mozzarella cheese and basalmic vinegar on a foccica roll. Divine!!

I'm pretty sure this is my new favorite sandwich place and I wonder why I didn't discover this place sooner! As indicated in previous posts, at $5.50 per sandwich + chips for delicious ingredients on warm, fresh baked bread, how can you go wrong?! Today, I had the roasted beef with avocado, spicy mayo, grilled onions, tomato, and Monterrey jack cheese.  Delicious! Last week, I had a special that seems similar to the sloppy pollo with barbeque chicken, grilled onions, and pepper jack.  Also delicious! This place gets crowded on Saturday afternoons (for good reason).  All in all, a great value and a great sandwich!

Terrific sandwiches and delicious breads for $5.50. Does not get better than this!  The decor of Panes Bread Cafe was really hip and colorful. The entire room was filled and painted with bold, bright colors that gave off a very energetic yet chill vibe to the cafe. My friend and I ordered our sandwiches at the counter and waited for them to come. It is important to note that Panes Bread Cafe is cash only so bring your money and leave the cards at home. Won't be needing those today!  We ordered the Todo Italiano and The Popular sandwiches. I got to taste both of the sandwiches, because my friend traded half of her sandwich for my half. Great way to try more than one thing! And both sandwiches were delicious. The Popular sandwich was served on a tomato bread that was so soft but still toasty and crunchy on the outside. Cannot go wrong with both of these sandwiches. Can't wait to go back and try the others!

it's all in the bread... that's what make a sandwich a sandwich and panes has definitely mastered that.   i'm normally at panes when i'm "working from home" or "sick" as i'm normally too hungry to wait in line over the weekend.  my last visit, 11AM  on a weekday, i still waited...and waited...and waited.  deliciousness takes some time, i get it, but it was bordering ridiculous time span given a) they are sandwiches not steak or souffle people! and b) there were only (2) other people ahead of me, also staring into space awaiting their order.  once my bag of caprese sandwich and chips is in hand, i seem to forget about the painful wait as i continue to go back...

Great bread = Great Sandwiches! This place is the best for sandwiches and their salads are delish too. My two standby's are the Pollo Diablo or the Tortilla Salad -  finished off with a Monster Cookie of course. Plus, they're loaves are totally reasonably priced for sides, appetizers, etc. and so good (try the Rosemary and Olive Oil). Just remember they're cash only.

Now that I have used up all of my Pompei Groupons (across the street) I can finally go to Panes more often. Low prices and great taste make this one of the best cafes in Lakeview. The "Spicy Philly" was like nothing I've had before. Roast beef, red peppers, onions, mushrooms, and a secret sauce. I also tried some of the tortilla salad and it was great. The interesting decor and cash-only aspect give this place a cozy feel.

I used to go here for a to go cookie and coffee when I lived in the area. One of the employees there was never really friendly every time I went in. They open late for a bakery and their coffee is super weak. The sandwhiches are good though- nothing to write home about though. If you do go- make sure to get a loaf of bread to take home.
Great cariety... veggie chilli a bit too spicy... only takes cash.  Their bread is made fresh daily.  So yummy!  Try the Turkey Turkey or the Italiano..
Great place for a sandwich and pretty cheap too! There rosemary olive oil bread is amazing. I always get the pollo diablo- a spicy chicken breast sandwich...delicious!

I would have given this place 5 stars if they had a few more vegetarian options on the menu. Out of 18 sandwiches there are only 2 are meatless options. True, you can order anything without meat or substitute, but Panes makes such wonderful food I would like to see a few more options for non-meat eaters. The Portabella sandwich is very hearty and tasty! I would love to see them add an eggplant sandwich to the menu because their Cavatapi pasta sounds delightful and I would love to try that in a sandwich form. Their sandwiches are $5.50 and come with chips. It is a great deal for wonderful food.
I love this place. Sandwiches and pasta are great and the prices are low. The bread is fresh and the desserts are delicious! Just make sure to bring cash because they don't accept credit card.

This place was excellent. My sandwich was on fresh multi grain bread with great toppings. I went with the spicy chicken, they did have a fancy name for it. It truly was one of the better sandwiches that I've had. It was reminiscent of Rolling To Go in Evanston. My only irk was that they only offered chips and didn't have a healthier option. I will be back here and you really can't beat the $5.50 price!

Great for a quick, casual meal. I've been coming here for years and the food has always been consistently fresh tasting and good. Totally non-pretentious atmosphere and they are really nice about substitutions. Great selection of Italian entrees, sandwiches, salads, soups, and pastries! Very inexpensive for the area. They've got outdoor seating in the summer too! Just remember they are CASH only.

I Love, LOVE Panes and I'm pretty picky.  I stumbled upon this place because my best friends lived across the street. Was really sick of Chicago's pizza so this was a life saver. I usually get the turkey turkey which is one of the best things I have ever tasted. I moved away and I miss this sandwich! The ham and cheese it amazing as well. No matter what time you go there will be a wait, especially since they put some time into making them. Downfall like most said was that it's cash only, it definitely is worth a trip to the ATM

Oh how I love this place. Everything I've ever ordered there was just a crunchy, gooey marvel, especially the Turkey Turkey  - and I normally hate turkey, so winning me over in this category is really quite impressive. If you are in the area and need a really good, non-chain sandwich, this is your place. My only holdup is that the service is on the Germanic side, so if you're looking for TLC, you shall look in vain. Who cares though? I'd rather have a great lunch served with grunts than studiously polite ickiness.

Best place to get a sandwich in the Lincoln Park/Lakeview area! Their sandwiches are so good!  Fresh soft bread and the perfect amount of meat/fixings!  My favorite is the Chicken club (they use real chicken, not deli chicken), but I have never been disappointed with anything I have ordered!  Their tortilla salad is also tasty. If you are in the area and looking for lunch - hit up Panes!  They only accept cash though, so make sure you have a few bucks in your wallet before ordering (sandwiches are usually $5.50).

Bring cash and order the "Turkey Turkey"... thank me later But in all seriousness. Really a fun little cafe in Lakeview. They now have some outdoor seating which is great because they tend to get pretty crowded during lunch hours. I usually just call in my order and pick it up to save time.  Have also had the Tortilla salad and it was plenty big. Pasta salads are also fun to share if your on the hungry side.

Been going here about three times a month for the past 5 years.  The woman working the counter still acts like she has never seen me before, but I love everything else about this place.  Their desserts are ahhh-mazing (york pepperment brownies?!),  their sweet french bread is heaven and the BLT is one of the best I've had in the city.

This is my favorite sandwich place in Chicago hands down. I used to live right down the street from them and it was great. I'd eat it once a week. I now live further away and still will make the 15 minute trek over there just to get my fix. The Pollo Diablo is delicious.

This places just makes for that warm and fuzzy feeling ! Nothing over the top - just good ol comfort food in a cozy setting. Never a miss if you just want a quick brownie or bread or to sit and have a coffee and sandwich with pals.

Panes (plural for bread in Spanish and pronounced "pah-nehs") has now become my new favorite lunch place.  Why? Well you asked for it: -They bake their own 'pan' or bread daily in many different varieties. My favorites are the Sweet White (which most sandwiches come on), Rosemary and Sourdough. -They offer unique and extremely tasty sandwich creations...and of course your childhood favorites like the classic B.L.T. (hands down the best i've ever had!).  I'd also recommend El Parisino and Sloppy Pollo sandwiches.  Every sandwich is very reasonable at around $5-6, plus a side of chips!  It's one of the few places in the city to get a meal under $10. -Every day they have two or so different soups to offer. -Best of all, do not skip out on The Monster (a peanut butter, chocolate chip, M&M, oatmeal cookie that is sure to impress).  I'd eat it all by itself as a meal, plus it's a good source of fiber.  I would also recommend their peppermint patty brownies. -Beyond the great prices, quality and fresh food, you can't yourself from noticing all the fun Latin American artesanias or handcrafted art. Panes is owned by two previous chefs from Cafe Ba Ba Reeba.  Now all they need is a space larger than 10 tables and Sangria! *Keep in mind that it's Cash Only and limited on space.

The wife and I needed to do some shopping in the Southport area and wanted to find a place to lunch at nearby. Doing a search on Yelp brought up Panes and I'm glad it did. I had the Pompazo which is a spicy chicken breast, pesto, tomato, and provolone cheese sandwich that was great. My wife had the California Sunshine which was a veggie sandwich that had a great lemon flavor to it. We only had sandwiches this trip but I can't wait to go back and try the cookies, truffles, and other desserts.

I've never had anything at Panes I didn't like.  Though I'm not a big fish fan in general  the Tilapia sandwich is nothing short of amazing.  Try it, even if you're not a 'fish person'. Their cookies, pastas and breads are yummy. Downsides: waits (both in line and for your food once you order) can be long, especially at lunch (those IL Masonic people jam in), service can be crabby, and has been noted, it's cash-only.

I went in expecting more of a bakery and was surprised that a "bread cafe" would have so little bread and other baked goods.   Despite the change in plans, the sandwiches were decent.  Just decent and worth the long wait-time and the scowling cashier. I'll go back to try other sandwiches and deserts, but I know not to expect anything epic.

After a painful Sunday morning, struggling from hangover mixed with Sunday anxiety, Panes is what gets me through the day.  The ambiance, atmosphere, environment, location-- it all seems perfect to me come Sunday at 1p.m.  I am a sucker for good lighting, and thank you Panes, cause I can hide my hangover glare in your dimmed room.  Everything I've ever eaten here is TO DIE FOR. If you're not a creature of habit, try a new sandwich every time you go in. I promise you, Panes refuses to disappoint. Also, the pasta dishes and quesadillas are g.d. awesome and the prices cannot be beat.  I don't know anyplace in Chicago that I can get a gigantic sandwich for $5.50 that tastes sooo right. For the sweet tooth's out there, the monster cookie (cookie, cookie cookie?), chocolate chip cookies and the buckeyes (screw OHIO), are spectacular. Pick one up with your Turkey Turkey, Pompazo, or Portabella Sandwich next time.  xoxox Panes. I'll be seeing you shortly.

Panes is one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The food is a mix of sandwiches, salads, soups, and pastas. The also sell fresh bread that is fabulous. I tend to get the Super Panes when I go there, which is one of their great sandwiches. I have also had a pizza there and have tried a few of the other things they serve. The staff is friendly, the space is clean, and the food is very reasonably priced. One thing to keep in mind is that they only take cash, which can be an issue for some people. I would recommend Panes to everyone, it is truly a great place to eat!

I love this place.  I love their sandwiches.  I think about them constantly, and I'm on the precipice of stalking.  Can you stalk an establishment? Yes. Yes, you can.  In fact it is fairly easy since it doesn't move. I think their desserts are underrated as well.  I recommend spending a little extra on them. Don't forget the fresh bread.  They have giant baguettes behind the counter.  I have no need for a giant baguette.  I would probably use them for sword fights, but it's nice to know it's there.

For all the people that left bad reviews I would ask, did you ever try the Todo Italiano, Chicken Club, or Pompazo? Those are the 3 I've had and it's hard to believe anyone wouldn't be impressed. They are REALLY good sandwiches, and at a great price! I especially recommend the Chicken Club....mmmmmm.
Best food ever !!!!!!!!!!!!! tortilla salad is always AMAZING monster cookie is to die for totally sucks that they dont take credit only cash otherwise id give them 5 stars

I love Panes Bread Cafe, this place is a true gem.  It's very affordable (about $6 for a sandwich), and the food is out of this world.  It can get very crowded, so you might want to get there early if you plan on eating there.  I generally get the turkey, roasted red peppers, avocado, and spicy mayo on tomato bread, and it's absolutely delicious.  The Chicken Parmesan sandwich, which I haven't ordered strangely since I love Chicken parm, looks delicious.  This is one of those places you take for granted until you can't have it regularly.  When I'm back in Chicago, I'll be here for sure.

Big fan of Panes Bread Cafe! Walked by it so many times since I lived down the street.. finally gave it a shot one day with a friend and sure happy I did. He got the goat cheese pizza and I had some kind of a veggie sandwich with hummus on their asiago roll, I believe. Absolutely killer. We also tried the tomato bisque soup which was incredible. I've been back a few times to pick up bread for dinner. It's not really a place you go to eat out at, more like stopping by for a snack or quick lunch. They have many desserts and cookies to choose from. Definitely recommended if you are in the neighborhood.

Was not "wowweeeeeeed." That's all I kept thinking.. The glorious Panes....the mecca for sandwich lovers, Chicago's claim to sammie fame. And, hmmmm...fell a bit short for me. Truthfully, the "cash only" policy has kept me at bay for quite some time...I'm just not a cash carryin' kind of gal, but hey...if friends want to lunch, you hit the ATM and make a deal.  Turkey sandiwich on tomato bread: are we seriously doing this like...cold cut turkey style? Salty and sort of slimy. Oscar Meyer like. Not good. Bread was interesting enough, but that nitrate soaked turkey just tripped my wire. Alarms: abort mission! The baked goods look sweeeeeet (pun intentional), and the salads could be worth a shot, but hey...after all, peeps come here for SANDWICHES. I tried. I obviously just don't get the hype.  *cash only *Wellington Brown *some street parking *good fountain Diet Coke.  *busy at lunch, but ample tables.  I'll save my cash.

Waiting 25 minutes for a cafe-style sandwich is way too long.  The lady working the front register also scowled like Al Gore would at "non-believers" every time another customer walked in, appearing to inconvenience her.  The sandwiches we took home were decent, but a little lacking the meat department.  Also, the chips were something I would have eaten 15 years ago.  They should at least get some kettle chips or offer cole slaw with sandwiches instead of just giving chips.  If I go back here I'm definitely ordering from home and going to pick it up.  Overall, very average.

Mmmm Mmmm Panes, where have you been all my life?! Clearly not missing out on all the other Yelpin' bellies, that's for certain. Lemme just be thankful to say you have finally at last made your way into mine!  Panes truly rocks it out on the lovely lunch tip... a quaint little 'order at the counter' type spot, the low key digs more than make up in terrific taste for what they lack in foofie style. Besides, I'm sure we can all admit going to lunch all comfy 'n stuff in your workout gear doesn't suck one bit (ain't that right, Robio??).  The menu is comprised mainly of yummy fresh salads and sandwiches, but you can certainly glutton-out too if your baked macaroni and goat cheese pizza lovin' heart is desiring a more hearty fare!! My svelte group, however, opted for the former and went balls-to-the-weight-watchin-wall with a myriad of soups, sammies and my favorite, the feta chicken salad featuring a healthy barrage of romaine lettuce, artichokes heart, red peppers, grilled chicken, kalamata black olives, feta cheese and tangy greek dressing. Panes Perfection!  Adored the slightly sweet - and utterly delicious - soft, freshly baked bread that came out with everyone's meals. Heck, it was enough to get this carb shy girl singing a bonafied challah chorus. Amen, it's not to be missed!  Pick up a lovely (and generous) cookie sample on your way out for a positively sweet finish to a superb lunch. Thanks, Panes, you're tops in my lunch book!

Went here for a quick dinner one night and was not disappointed. I had a Greek salad, my friend had a Turkey, Turkey, and we split some hummus. All tasty. It was a little crowded, and it's cash-only (which I just find annoying), but other than that, nothing to complain about. It's a little out of the way for me, and for that reason I probably won't be hustling back anytime soon, but if you ever happen to be passing by, it's worth stopping in.
Great sandwiches, great baked goods and awesome prices.  My favorite lunch spot in the city!

Ok ...so this place has been around the corner from me for years... and I never have gone...  I went the about a month ago and again a few times ... the food is good ... but the prices are better... this is what makes it ... the bread... it is good ... the truffles in the desert case are good... the soups are good ... I would not say this is gourmet food but for the price it is just as good if not a bit better then another Italian sandwich shop very close by on the same street.... hmmm.... Do go here for a quick well priced meal.

Easily one of the best sandwich joints in all of Chicago.  They have a ton of other stuff too like pasta, pizza, and salads but there sandwiches are just ridiculous.  Staff is friendly, service is quick, restaurant is clean and the prices are very fair.  Don't miss out on dessert, especially the chocolate chip cookies!

Panes is one of the best family owned treasures in town.  They do gourmet sandwiches, salads, pasta and great cookies/desserts.  Got to try the Monster Cookie and you're lucky if you get there and I haven't already bought out all of the Chocolate Clouds.

The sandwiches are large and in terms of taste and quality, they're way above average.  This ain't no Jimmy John's.   I wouldn't go there if you're in a rush. When they take your order, you're given a number and your food comes out after you sit down. Tables with different numbers may experience different delivery times. If you sit outside you might begin to worry they forgot you.

panes is delicious.  everything i've had has been well above-average.  don't forget, it's cash-only :) the tortilla salad is great, as is the todo italiano.  i highly recommend the chicken club.  the only thing i wouldn't get again is the hummus appetizer.  it's just so-so.  but their bread is incredible.  definitely the highlight of every meal there.
Still a HUGE fan of the Turkey Turkey and I think I enjoy it more each time! I now add bacon and it just makes it out of this world. 50 cents well spent!

Really? With 184 reviews and an average star rating of 4.5, I expected much more from this place. And I didn't even know about the positive yelp reviews until I logged on to write this utterly Meh review, but I had heard people say in passing it was good. I attribute this to the Kuma's phenomenon - that a place gets so much hype for how good it was in its heyday that the word from those days lives on while the present day just can't or won't live up to the legend. I got the portabello - it was decent, but not that flavorful. A friend got the turkey sandwich and he was grossed out by the fact it was pressed and processed turkey as opposed to sliced turkey. I got a fountain coke, it was way watery as if it didn't have enough syrup and when I asked my friends about their fountain drinks, the root beer had too much syrup, but the diet coke was just right. I heard the chicken soup was divine, but the bread that accompanied it had a moldy taste to it. Due to the coke tasting oh-not-so-good, I got a glass of water. It had some funky taste to it.  Doesn't take credit cards - cash only - doesn't affect my review, just a nice FYI to have about a place! Darnit for making it after the legendary days in the Meh days.

I highly recommend this restaurant, and I've brought my friends here several times.  I love the tomato bread and El Diablo sandwich.  Lots of food for the price.  But minus 1 star because their salads are boring with substandard lettuce, and pastas are just average.  But any of their sandwiches and desserts are EXCELLENT!  Plus nice outdoor seating for summertime.

I was sent here by a friend that loves the place.  I must say - it didn't meet my expectations.  I thought my sandwich was very bland and the room was freezing.  Granted it was a cold day, but this little hole in the wall needs a little heat!  The person behind the counter that took my order, on the other hand, was very nice.   I won't run back.

Very strong lunch option, but be prepared for a wait even with a relatively empty restaurant.  Seems a little more than it should for 2 sandwiches and 2 small sodas ($16).  Not cheap, just that there aren't many chips and the sandwich isn't large at all. However, the quality is there.  Had the Spicy Philly, which was juicy and tasty, although I was expecting something really somewhat spicy, which it was more of a mild taste than anything. Looks like a diverse menu and the counter staff was helpful in making a final decision (which is tough).

We absolutely love the sandwiches here!!! The menu is extensive and extremely reasonable regarding prices. We usually order the Turkey Turkey and the Todo Italiano with avocado, however always have a tough time deciding what we want while perusing through the menu. In addition, we travel 30 minutes just for one of those sandwiches! On another note, I usually enjoy ordering for pickup rather than dining in because last time it took about 30 minutes for a sandwich to be prepared for dining in. On the contrary, pickup usually takes 15 minutes and you can cut in front of those people holding up the line because they can't make a decision on what to order.   My wife also feels as though they should specify what type of bread goes with each sandwich on their menu (and I agree). Only sandwiches with tomato bread are specified. She prefers wheat over white being the healthier choice. Could of been our bad for not just saying wheat instead of white.

oh my oh my. finally tried the pasta at panes and it was amazeballs. the cavatapi is to die for. fresh goat cheese... ahh! i'm in love. i've also been stopping by regularly for desserts lately - try the peanut butter brownie if they've got it. yum. i'm a firm believer in nothing being even remotely bad here. still need to try the pizza.

This place is AWESOME!!! Great location, right off of the Brown line Wellington stop. I live right around the corner so it's great to grab a quick dinner if I get home late from work.  The menu is very diverse and super cheap. The desserts look amazing! I have only had the monster cookie, but I am obsessed. They are best if you get them warm. I have had the vegetarian sandwich (can't remember the name) and their goat cheese pasta. Both were wonderful! The bread really is awesome. Despite previous reviews, I thought the pasta was well worth it.  I really don't know what people are talking about in regards to the "unfriendly" staff. They were super nice to me! Greeting me at the counter and bringing my order to me (they call out your order number but I was lost in thought and missed mine). I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Love Panes. Potbelly/ Jimmy John's prices but amazing quality and variety of options. Their bread is amazing, whenever I am close by I pick up a loaf (1.75!!!) to bring home with me. Had a Roasted Beef sandwich today, 5.50 with chips, and it was amazing. Really moist, tender roast beef, avacado, tomato, spicy mayo piled on their awesome freshly baked garlic olive oil bread. I coulg only eat half so I brought that plus my extra loaf home. Their ingredients are fresh, the menu is large, and I am never disappointed. Oh! They have amazing house made truffles. AMAZING.   Only caveat, they only take cash.

Great sandwiches at a great price.  Traditional stuff and some different types as well.  Their bread really makes the difference though.  Also, have wonderful desserts.  I understand their cult following.
Special shout-out for the BBQ chicken pizza - my favorite item.  You can't go wrong here....soup, sandwiches, pasta, a wide variety of desserts.  All for a great price.

After the wife decided to hack off most of her beautiful hair, we celebrated with a first-time lunch at Panes. The cream of tomato soup they were serving up today  was the best I've ever tasted.  Being an old E. Lakeview resident, it was nice to get down to the old hood for a bit.   Panes seems like a nice place to grab a sammich.  I like the fact that it's on Sheffield, so it's a little off the beaten path, at least in East Lakeview.  Even so, around lunch time, the line can get pretty long and that can be a Pane (HA HA HA, GET IT!?! TASTE THE PUN BEOITCHES!!) Anyway, I really enjoyed the Super Pane, which is basically a club sandwich.  The wife enjoyed her chicken and prosciutto.  The homemade bread is good, and I like that you can grab a loaf for $1.75.   Anyhow, if your in the neighborhood, don't loaf around.  Get over to Panes, and tell them Mike sent you.  When they give you a confused look, pay full price for your food and carry on.

Thank you fellow Yelpers for helping me find this unassuming sandwich spot. I must say that when everyone said it was so affordable, I was concerned. We were looking for hearty, but healthy sandwiches after a night of debauchery and Panes delivered. We arrived around 5pm for linner and promptly ordered at the counter. Then, we found a sunny spot next to the window (we were practically the only ones there) and had our food delivered in no time. I ordered a vegetarian sandwich and was pleasantly surprised. It was loaded with veggies, seasoned nicely, and served on yummy, toasted sourdough bread. My husband also enjoyed his diablo chicken sandwich immensely. So, we'll definitely be back.

Read reviews about this place when I was looking for a cheap, healthy place to eat. Finding such a place that is unique and "unfranchised" is hard! I have to admit that I went in with low expectations. After all, it's a sandwich shop, how good could it possible be? Well I'm happy to report that it rocked my socks. The best way to describe Panes is by saying their sandwiches are fancier, heartier, and the same size if not bigger than Panera but half the price. My personal favorite is the turkey turkey. Instead of ordering it on tomato bread I like to opt to have it served on their delicious handmade French bread.
