Another favorite is their Blackened Tilapia Sandwich which is typically served on weekends. Call ahead to ask for their "specials". I tried their chocolate chip cookie which LOOKS good but honestly, I was pretty disappointed. Subway has better cookies.. Their chocolate ball thingys though, they were quite tasty :)  By the way, THIS PLACE IS CASH ONLY

Awesome, homemade breads and baked goods. This place is a great lunch spot! I've taken many friends here and it's always a hit. Be prepared to wait a bit if you go around the lunch time hour. Normally pretty cleared out by 2pm. They are also open really late for a take out dinner option. Cash only!!

fresh ingredients, delicious bread, inexpensive my group had: the todo italiano (warmed pesto, chicken, roasted red pepper and cheese sandwich), the spinach chicken pizza and the quesadilla special (artichoke, goat cheese and roasted red peppers) with a side salad, white chocolate rice pudding and a monster cookie.  All recommended... even though the quesadilla was small and the rice pudding looked a little scary (but apparently tasted great).

I choose this restaurant at random after reading a few positive reviews.  I met a friend for dinner and it wasn't too busy, although I am guessing it is more of a lunchtime spot.  Lots of people were in and out for take out orders though.   The menu is pretty large, with lots of salad and sandwich options and a few choices of pasta and pizza.  I was shocked by how low the prices were and then surprised by how much food we got.  I got the veggie cabra because I am a fan of most anything with goat cheese.  I asked for multigrain bread, which was a good call because the sourdough that it usually comes on is very thick and would have dominated the sandwich.  The multigrain was delicious, as were all of the vegetables and goat cheese.  I also had a house salad, not much more than some lettuce and cucumbers, but a good amount for the size.   My friend had "the popular" sandwich which was chicken, cheese, caramelized onions, and spinach I think.  It was also quite large.  Based on recommendations we got monster cookies to go and these did not disappoint.  They had oats, chocolate chips, M & M's and peanut butter.  Very soft, they must have been made today. I would definitely go back for a very casual dinner, it was affordable and filling.  Pretty quick service too.

In my opinion, what makes a sandwich great depends a lot on the bread and my multigrain bread definitely completed my sandwich. Ingredients are fresh and I thought one sandwich was pretty filling.  Don't leave without trying their monster cookie. That stuff is genius...but made me feel very guilty finishing it off in a few minutes.

The sandwiches are worth it for the bread alone, though I'm happy to say the bacon is pretty darn great too--crispy and tasty.  I had the BLT, so I can't really give an opinion on any of the other meats.  My bf, though, had the Super Panes and really, really enjoyed it, so that's sort of an endorsement.  We also ordered the potato salad and the mashed potatoes, and both were good.  The potato salad is very, very garlicky--almost exactly like the garlicky potato salad served at tapas restaurants.  The mashed potatoes were creamy and satisfying, and the serving was HUGE. Because that's the other thing--the amount of food you get for not a lot of money is great.  There were all kinds of tempting desserts at the counter too, but we stuck with a couple of the truffles each, and they were super yummy too.  I'm quite sure we'll go back for different sandwiches, loaves of bread, and some of the beautiful desserts.

I think I'm done with Panes. Today I ordered the Tuna Blanca sandwich for carryout from the less than enthused woman behind the counter, and waited approximately 20/25 minutes for the sandwich. I should also probably mention that it was approximately 2:30, and there were maybe 3 tables occupied (so not the height of lunch rush hour). After waiting maybe 15 minutes the woman behind the counter tells me my order is coming up. After about 20 minutes she asks me what my number is, and I tell her I never received a number....she then tells me, "Let me check on the order" only to come back and ask, "What did you order?" Huh, really? After 25 minutes?   I finally get my food and head to my office only to find the sandwich has cheese melted in the middle of the tuna, which the menu description mentions nothing about... and I cannot eat cheese... While I've always enjoyed the food when my order is right, but I've had enough of the subpar customer service, messed up orders, and cash only payment. Done, done, and done. +Good food when your order is correct +Great breads and deserts -Orders are often incorrect -Does not accept credit or debit -Long wait time, even when ordering ahead by phone -Staff is not super friendly

My favorite turkey club in the city.  I enjoy the delicious deserts and good service.  The atmosphere is very cozy and the prices are reasonable.  I go quite often.  I have not tried the soups, but my girlfriend thinks they are great.  A must have if you are in the area.

I live right near Panes and it is a blessing.  Love the courtyard where you can sit with your dog and read a book.  Love their monster cookies.  Love their selection of sandwiches.  Love their oaxacan pork sandwich.  Love peanut butter truffles.  Love.  Love. Love.

Delicious, I cannot wait to go back!  You can't really go wrong with a sandwich place that makes their own bread, and wonderful, delicious bread at that.  There were scrumptious looking baked goods in the case, including homemade truffles, which I highly recommend grabbing one of these little chocolaty delights.  They're a little pricey for a single piece of candy, $.50 a pop, but absolutely worth it, especially if you're anything like me and crave a little sweet after a meal.  Although speaking of prices, I really shouldn't complain at all, all the sandwiches were between $5-6 which in this world of $8-10 sandwiches you absolutely can't beat for the size of the sandwich or the quality.  I can't wait to go back and try to eat everything on the menu!

I abosolutely love this restaurant! They have amazing Desserts and sandwiches!  I've gotten a few of their sandwhiches and omlettes and i've never been disappionted! My favorite is the Turkey Turkey with tomato bread, avacado, red peppers and spicy mayo. It's to die for!  I came accross Panes as I was walking down Sheffield one lazy Saturday afternoon, and I am so happy I decided to stop inside and grab lunch with my friend. It's a great cozy hole in the wall restaurant and I suggest everyone does themselves a favor and visits it as soon as possible. But, be aware of the fact it's cash only, and I suggest getting there before noon if you want to grab a table and miss the lines.

Now these are some truly tasty sandwiches...far removed from those of the chain store variety...clearly crafted by folks who worship at the feet of the sandwich gods.  You cannot and will not go wrong here.

I've been coming here for a while now and I always order the same thing - Cheese and Tomato Sandwich. It's not on the menu, but it's tomato, mozz cheese, roasted red peppers with a vinaigrette. I remember when I first ordered this it was a FULL sandwich and it was awesome. As time as gone on this sandwich has dwindled down to mostly just bread. I ordered this tonight and felt I had to review for the mere fact that this is shitty. I cannot handle 1 slice of thinly sliced tomato on each half along with a couple red peppers and maybe just maybe one small (TINY) mozzarella ball on each half. That's just crap. I think I'm thoroughly upset tonight.
Prices are very reasonable, the sandwiches are adequate. Could be much more imaginative with the menu. Fluffy french bread is reccomended.

Holy CRAP!  Where have you been all my life?  My friend took me here for lunch the other day and it was the best decision he ever made for me. The crabcake sandwich was the special and it was.  Everyone ordered something bizarre and yet appealing to the inner gourmet and everyone was happy.  Incredibly happy.  Honeymoon happy.  (Sick, isn't it?).   The outdoor seating was a huge plus, particularly on the gorgeous day we went.

One of my favorite sandwich spots in Chicago! My good friend had just moved to the neighborhood and raved about it! A few weeks ago we decided to stop in for a nice nosh. We sat outside on a gorgeous day, and their modest outdoor area was really cute. And the food was AMAZING! I am so sad I've been living in Chicago for five years without Panes in my life! Yum!

ok.  panes.  we know, your sandwiches are the best in chicago, we got it. but seriously, why why why does it take 15 minutes to make a sandwich no matter how many people are there?  i would eat you everyday, but i just don't have that kinda time!  even though i dream about your oaxacan at least once a week. mmm.

This is the only place that I have ever, and may ever, buy a vegetarian sandwich. I agree with an earlier poster that usually they are dead boring but Panes changes that-- my personal favorite is the Veggie Cabra. No one has yet mentioned their pizza which happens to be phenomenal! And, their soups? Spectacular, especially considering that right now a bowl of soup which comes with bread and butter is less than $3. The Cream of Tomato soup is out of this world!

One would think that a place with ~150 positive reviews wouldn't need another, but I'm compelled to review Panes due to my love for it, and due to the fact that I feel offended, outraged, and disheartened every time I meet a Chicagoan who hasn't been there.  So perhaps adding one more great review will get more people there (but not too many, not sure if the lines can get any longer!) Peanut butter filled chocolate balls, brownies with peppermint patties in them, and I haven't even gotten to the real star of the show, the sandwiches yet. Every sandwich comes on their freshly baked, delicious bread, and not just a sliver either.  Sometimes I'm convinced they're giving me a quarter of a loaf for a sandwich--almost a text book case of too much of a good thing...but I digress.  The sandwiches are amazing, made fresh to order with top notch ingredients, I've never had a bad one, let alone one that was less than stellar.  If you like a bit of a kick, I'd shoot for the Pollo Diablo...it's sinister in how good it is.
Love this place. The sweet French bread is amazing!  When you order their sandwiches - you can request the sweet french bread!!  I recommend the chicken pesto sandwiches - yes both of them are great!

It's pretty obvious that my review is not needed here since  everyone has covered all that is great about Panes.  What I would like to say is that the monster cookies are amazing and the Pompazo Sandwich is the best around!

While I am still trying to figure out how to pronounce the name, I am certain that Panes serves up delicious sandwiches. I don't normally like toasted sandwiches, but these ones are A-OK by me. YUMMY! Their salads are ok - not up to par with the sandwiches, but I think they set the bar pretty high with those! I highly recommend this place, and I would also recommend eating in as well - although beware, their desserts look pretty tasty so you may not be able to resist.

Love it.... everything is homemade and it's inexpensive. Cute, great service, and they have Fresca! Every soup, salad, sandwich, and dessert I have ever had here has been finger-licking delicious, and I will keep coming back at least once a week.

LOVE IT! it's absolutely adorable! i had a pasta dish, which, although i asked for it without cheese (i'm vegan), i'm not positive did not have cheese in it (maybe they took off major cheese ingredient but not minor cheese in sauce?), but regardless, it was DELICIOUS. everyone loved what they had in our party (sandwiches, salad, banana bread). cute place, lots of yummy options (even for veggies, there are some good ones!). could use some vegan bakery good though because the bakery case looked so delectable and soooo off limits (butter/milk/eggs GALORE!). i'll definitely be back.

Great sandwich shop. Very inexpensive, and everything is very high quality. Flavor combinations impressive. The Potbelly down the street would be out of business if more people knew of Panes. I can't say I like them quite as much as Patoral, but they're not trying to be epicurean; rather just make great sandwiches with homemade bread and quality ingredients.

One of my favorite places to get a sandwich in chicago.  Daily selections of soup are delicious and there is always a vegetarian option.  The bread and ingredients used in the sandwiches are fresh and tasty -- i definitely recommend this place to get a sandwich for vegetarians (and meat-eaters).
Love me some Panes bread... Good Sunday brunch too

"Loaves of Bread" is the translation from Spanish, for the word "Panes." I have no idea if that is the orgin of the name; but if so, the owners are not doing their cafe justice.  The homemade, fresh-baked bread is outstanding, but only one part of their quality menu. Panes offers appetizers, salads, pastas and homemade desserts, but the stars of the menu are their delicious sandwiches.  I've been going to Panes for nearly 10 years and have never been disappointed in the consistent quality of their food. My favorite sandwich is the Oaxacan Pork - marinated pork loin, caramelized onions, spicy mayo and roasted red peppers - all on melt-in-your-mouth, warm-baked bread. Flavorful and tender, spicy and sweet - this sandwich is a winner.  I also like the Todo Italiano - homemade pesto grilled chicken, roasted red peppers, provolone cheese and thin sliced prosciutto. Or try The Popular - chicken breast, caramelized onions, spinach, roasted peppers and provolone cheese on tomato bread.  And guess what? All sandwiches are less than $6 or $7.  The only drawbacks about Panes: the crowds can sometimes make the wait a little long, and there is not a lot of seating.  For take-out orders, try calling in advance to avoid the wait.  Panes is one of the best and most affordable little cafes in the city. It's much more than the "Loaves of Bread" name would lead you to believe.

I love Panes. To start, it's super cheap (like $5/sandwich), they have a big menu and always good specials. Their main items are their sandwiches, which are amazing. They make everything on freshly baked bread and they use lots of yummy ingredients. Their specials usually (if not always?) consist of a pasta, which comes in a huge bowl! I love the California sandwich, it's full of veggies and has avocado. Panes also has amazing baked goods. The best is the everything cookie, seriously can not go wrong. The only bad thing I have to say is they always seem to be out of wheat bred. I'm not sure if this is because it's so popular or because they just don't make it much, but either way I wish they had more.

I've been to Panes about 3-4 times over the past 8 months. I've gotten salads and sandwiches and have bought a loaf of bread there. Their sandwiches are very strong. The bread is excellent, some of the best I've had in the city. The elements of the sandwich are tasty and they even toast/warm the whole thing a bit before serving it to you with chips. And they are cheap, about $6 after tax. The one consistent thing is that they tend to skimp on the protein. I had a Turkey Turkey last night and there was about 3oz of turkey on the sandwich, which is not a lot for a store-bought sandwich. This problem hits home a little harder in the salad arena. Their salads are served with rosemary bread, which is the best part of the meal. The salads themselves are alright but are not filling at all. They have way too much lettuce and even if the description says it includes chicken, there are about 4 small pieces of chicken in it. So I definitely recommend this place if you want a pretty good sandwich on fantastic bread. If you are in the mood for a salad, you are best off going across the street to Pompeii.

I cannot recommend Panes enough.  The Pompazo chicken sandwich and the BLT are to die for.  I have heard that the other sandwiches are good too, but I would not know...I also get the Pampazo or the BLT.  Go to this cool little cafe and enjoy!

While I live within walking distance today was the first time I've ever sat down to eat here. My mistake! Well made sandwiches, diverse menu and of course fresh bread. The ingredients were great and every one within our party was more than pleased with their meal. Great spot for lunch outside if you're lucky enough to grab a spot. Plenty crowded on weekends so take out may be better choice for drivers. I'll definitely be back.

Of course this place has been reviewed a ton! Because it is absolutely, lick your fingers, go home and take a nap afterwards, good. Everything is homemade here - from the soups to the sandwiches and the loaf of bread you can get to go.  You know, I would usually get a little bothered by the fact that there is always a line to wait in. Or the fact that if you are one of the lucky ones to get a table, you are usually bumped up next to your neighbors table who still reeks of booze from the night before. Or the fact that sometimes I have to circle the block 7 or 8 times to find a parking spot. But not at Panes...Paines...Paynays...however you say it.  My fav sandwich is the Parisino. Fav soup is whatever's on tap that day. In the summer they have a little outdoor patio. And make sure you take the good ol green stuff - they don't take credit cards here.

Panes has pretty good sandwiches and bread at reasonable prices.  I don't care too much for their salads, though - it seems like something is missing, although I can't really put my finger on what.  I know people rave about this place (my roommate eats here like, 6 days a week), but to be honest I'm not entirely sure why.  It is good, and I like supporting a neighborhood business, but I wouldn't say it's amazing.

panes has amazing sandwiches!  my favorite is the turkey, turkey, mainly due to the tomato bread.  the bread is slightly crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  the turkey is standard deli fare, but the avocado and spicy mayo make this sandwich wonderful.  also, since i'm a huge fan of crunchy sandwiches, i put a few of the potato chips inside.  perfect.   a sandwich with a small pop is a little over $7, and it  keeps me full all day.  yum.

A place called Panes needs to have good bread. And it does! Love the neighborhood atmosphere in there. Even when it's busy I get my sandwiches in a good amount of time. Very clean and the kids love it too.

You simply cannot get better quality for this price. My favorite is the portabello sandwich. It is twice the size of what you would expect, and even that much more flavor. The homemade breads are a great treat as well. My roommates and love getting a fresh loaf of banana bread just around the corner. Panes makes you feel like part of the neighborhood.

I was looking for a local spot for a quick and tasty lunch from a place I have never been before. As you can see this place is highly recommended, and I was not disappointed. I had the Todo Italiano, and it was an all around good sandwich. They had an interesting selection of sandwiches, a spicy marinated pork caught my eye. Also, a special board to the right when you walk in. With the side of chips (included in the price) and a bottled iced tea, I walked out with a bill just over 8 dollars. The food was great, the price was even better. I will definitely be back to explore the menu.

I love this place so much. I can't think of a single thing from here I haven't loved. Sometimes when we go on Sunday nights, I will get a sandwich AND a pasta dish and then only eat half of my sandwich and half of the pasta and then I have my lunch for Monday. Yeah - this place is THAT good - even the leftovers are better than my other lunch options downtown. Cute decor too!

I am STILL addicted to this place and now that I'm going to the Bar Method - which is right down the street - I have been frequenting WAY too much! Who can resist fresh baked bread, soups and have you ever had the monster cookie or peanut butter balls?!! YUM YUM YUM! P.S. Also noticed they are serving breakfast on Sundays ; )

LOVE Panes and I'm not a big sandwich eater. Everything I've had here has been completely delicious!  Tends to be pretty busy right at noon so call ahead and place an order for pick up if you're in a hurry.   I usually get the Super Panes (turkey, ham, bacon, cheese, lettuce tomato and honey mustard) the Chicken Club (a delicious club with a whole chicken breast) or the Turkey Turkey (so good, on tomato bread)  and I never stop by without getting a peanut butter ball...pure delight!  My boss really likes the Popular and my mom loved the Portobello! Don't forget the cash though, as they don't take plastic!

I was introduced to this place by the bf a few years ago and it is one of my favorites ever since. I kick myself for not knowing about this place as I used to literally live 2 blocks away (I guess I saved some money that way)  I recommend the salads and the portabella mushroom panini. The panini is especially good. Their minestrone soup is filled with veggies and delicious. I do feel like they used to include more in their portabella salad (maybe broccoli?) but it a nice fresh salad or lite meal.  I have tried some of the veggie pastas too, the portions are nicely sized.  And the baked goods and freshly baked bread?? Cant beat it... The seating is cozy and they have little twinkly lights around, which I happen to love. In the summer they also have a few tables to sit outside.  If you are on the corner of Wellington and Sheffield, pick Panes. Don't go across the street for Pompeii. (there are always flies there. ugh!)  Two small vices with this place: 1) How do you pronounce the name?? (Who cares, it is delicious) and 2) I believe that on Saturday they have a special with bacon in it. The entire place smells like bacon. If you go with someone who keeps kosher (as I did) expect an adverse, kind of hilarious reaction.  YUM Panes!

It was a windy, rainy night in The Briar, and we were all wearing sweatpants. Everyone wanted dinner, but no one wanted to go out. If Chili's delivered chips and salsa, we'd be golden, but they didn't. So, we yelped all the pizza places we hadn't had before. Dominic was "trying to stay away from dairy *hand motion*" and annie wanted to tear up a peetz like whoa. So then she mentioned Panes, a place closeby with lots of delicious options to keep us eating during "The Real Housewives of New York City." We got kind of wild with it, ordering sandwiches, salads and pastas. and a cookie. what? it was that time of the month -- i needed a dessert.  it was just a lot of shit. 3 bags for 4 people. so much food. but, after eating everything they had to offer, we basically concluded that the only thing worth it are the sandwiches. Just stick to those and you're golden. And they're only $5 and really big! So enjoy.

Pane's is amazing!  You can get a great sandwich with chips for only about $5.  There are a bunch of different sandwiches to choose from, as well as soups, salads, spaghetti, etc.  There are also great desserts to choose from and the truffles are awesome.  The only downsides are that it is pretty small, so when it does get crowded forming a line can be kind of hard.  Also, cash only!!

Wish it had more seating but love its prices. Where else can you get a big salad for $5 these days? Ha. Wonderful bread (of course) and a great atmosphere for a quick, healthy lunch (if you skip their desserts that is).  Mmmmmm

Warning: Panes only takes cash Don't worry though, it is well worth leaving the debit card in the wallet for. My suggestion is the Turkey Turkey sandwich on tomato bread. You will not regret it! The potato salad is also quite nice. There's a little bit of a wait, but it gives you time to admire everyone else's food and get ready for yours. If you haven't been to Panes, you are missing out on a great Chicago sandwich place.

Some of the best food in Lakeview. I've never had anything here that I was less than totally satisfied by! This cozy neighborhood stop cooks up some of the best sandwiches, pastas, and desserts in the area! Most includes their delicious and hearty homebaked breads, which unlike the fancy breads of nearby Bittersweet, are much more rustic. Lets start with the appetizers. I almost always get an appetizer when I am here, because they have two of my favorites in town: GOATCHEESE CROSTINI - which is their toasted bread with huge helpings of amazing goat cheese and sundried tomato relish and HONGOS RELLENOS - which as large mushrooms crammed with mouthwatering cheese, spinach and chopped mushrooms, all in a tomato basil sauce. Yum! I've not tried any of their Pizzas or Salads, but I've tried most of their Pastas and Sandwiches, and have no complaints. Standout pastas include the SPICY PENNE and FUSILLI CON JAMON. My favorite sandwich is the SUPER PANES (bacon, turkey, ham, swiss, lettuce, tomato and honey mustard) but my mother always likes getting the Portabella mushroom sandwich. They have a white board inside that changes with daily specials, always offering some great non-menu options (their soups are always spectacular).  At the end of the meal, grab a dessert (I recommend the lemon custard with fresh blueberries, if they have it) and don't forget to grab a loaf of savory or sweet bread to take home with you! The only two things to watch out for are 1) It is a small place and it gets crowded around rush times. During the summer there is a bit of outdoor seating, which is lovely. 2) They only take cash! One time I tried to pay with a travelers cheque, which is basically the same as cash, and it was a no go - kind of annoying since I usually pay on my VISA, so make sure you have some cash on you.

Panes is a unique place. It's the essence of an anti-chain sandwich shop, which is a good thing (for the most part).  Pretty good selection of sandwiches, although many if not most of them are vegetarian. That's great if you're into that kind of thing, but me, well I'm just not. If we weren't meant to eat animals, then why are they made of meat? Why are they so delicious? They serve breakfast until late; I think 3pm. The omelet was good, the portions were large, and anything you order comes with a side of "toast" (which isn't really toasted but is good nevertheless) and "salsa" (which isn't really salsa but is good nevertheless). They hooked it up with a free refill on the coffee.  Not much impressed by the following:  - The line has nowhere to go but woven amongst the tables, which can be awkward. - Many of the tables are pushed together in an effort to get them all to fit in the restaurant, which means you'll likely be dining elbow to elbow with a new friend. And some other people in a line right next to you. - Cash only. Get with the picture, friends, it's 2009. I know plenty of business with much smaller revenue that accept credit cards, so don't play the "I'm the little guy" card. I like it though. I'll go back.

I AM cookie monster. Anyone that knows me, knows I am a chocolate chip cookie fiend, And if there is one thing that will make me detour out of my way for, it is the Monster cookies (with M&M bits) at Panes!!!  I once lived 1/2 block on Wellington from Panes, so I certainly had my share of their homemade breads, soups, sandwiches and cookies!! Their banana bread is excellent and their portabella and veggie sandwiches and soups are so tasty. I'm glad Panes has stood the test of time because they are truly a great gem in Chicago!!

Wow, their sandwiches are simply AMAZING.  I always get the rosemary bread w/ turkey and I seriously don't think I've had a better turkey sandwich in my life, and I have eaten A LOT of turkey sandwiches! I can't speak for the cookies and other baked goods but I would imagine they'd be great!

By far the best in the neighborhood! -if you want something very tasty & reasonably priced.  And I just found out they started delivering!  My favorites are the Tortilla salad, the BLT w/ cheese and Chilaquiles Verdes on their Sunday brunch menu.  YUMMY!!!

seriously what beats a bread cafe with cheap prices and a cozy ambiance?  i can't think of much...well, much that is G-rated anyways... honestly you can't beat these delicious sandwiches.  they are 1) massive and 2) made on all sorts of tasty breads.   a personal fave is the traditional ham and cheese.  while it may seem boring, i assure you you've never had one quite like this.  its baked on a sort of sweet bread with the american cheese perfectly melted.  and it comes with original lays potato chips (like all of their sandwiches).  its big enough to share, especially if you pair it with one of their fresh, homemade soups (that comes with more of their amazing bread) or one of their several salads.   i also enjoy the portabella sandwich which comes on their mozzarella and tomato bread.  and a few others...but i generally stick with one of those.  other things to try while there: 1) potato salad - hol-eeeee-shit.  yummmm to all its creamy-garlic goodness. 2) monster cookie - they are massive - they also have a whole glass case of other desserts that i'm sure are tasty too. 3) again - ALL of their soups.   4) oh and their version of mac and cheese is a force to be reckoned with... give the little bread shop a try.  you won't be disappointed.    *but remember your dollar bills.  this place is cash only!

I used to live right near this place, and I agree that the sandwiches are really good.  The side dishes are tasty too! Had to take away a few stars because the flan was the nastiest I have ever tasted, and the employees are always a pain.  The cash-only policy never bothered me, but something was definitely always bothering them... maybe they ate the flan or something.

Cheap, fabulous sandwiches.  That's all you need to know, really, but I'll tell you more, of course.  I adore the pollo diablo sandwich and have a hard time ordering anything else, but I've forced myself to try the tortilla salad, which is delicious as well.   I have not indulged in any of the treats on display, but they look fabulous.  The bread here is really what makes the sandwiches here, but the other ingredients are always fresh and tasty also. I have to say, the staff are not always the friendliest, but they are certainly never rude, just all-business.  As long as they keep making me my favorite spicy chicken sandwich, I'm all good with maintaining a professional relationship.   I've never ventured downstairs to the bathroom since I usually order take out, so no comment about those accommodations. You really must check out the sandwiches here.  It gets crowded with the Illinois Masonic crowd around lunch time, so I'd recommend calling ahead or showing up past 1pm to avoid waiting.

No lengthy explanation needed here.  Panes is the best sandwich shop on the north-side.   This was a must-have when I lived a few blocks away from Panes...I now live on the west-coast and it's a must-have when I'm back in Chicago.

Hands down the best sandwiches ever!!!  The bread is just unbelievable.  It's so soft and fresh and amazing!  They have a lot of creative sandwiches to choose from - my personal favorite is the Sloppy Pollo.   The have fantastic baked goods too - their monster cookie is to die for.  I get salon services from Studio Within and after all my appointments I walk next door to Panes Bread Cafe.  It's like a treat to me!!  Make sure to bring cash!!  Enjoy :)

Simply put, this place is second to none.  The best there ever was and ever will be.  If you like sandwiches (who doesn't?) then you'll want to move in here after your first trip.  I love it.  I crave it.  I need it.

The last time I walked out in the snow, all bundled up, I was rewarded with a delicious plate of chilaquiles at Panes Bread Cafe. This time I just got cold and I realized how nice a plate of savory chiliquiles would be and figured that since it is now all snowy and icy in Seattle perhaps they would like to open up a location here? We don't have any good sandwich shops like this, and we certainly don't have any that are this cheap! You could charge more here if you wanted and I would happily pay the price for your generous portions, fresh ingredients, and that rice pudding.  If you live in Chicago and you don't go to Panes on a semi-regular basis I say, "Shame on you."

I'm not crazy about vegetarian sandwiches. They are basically regular sandwiches minus the meat. Boring. However, the sandwiches at Panes Bread Cafe are rock solid. Even fungus haters like me will find the Portabella Sandwich absolutely delicious with the -fresh- creamy mozzarella, nutty pesto, and soft and chewy homemade bread. I also had the Smoked Penne minus the chicken. While the sauce was a little runny, the smoke gouda was so good-a! Panes is a great place for vegetarians in the mood for quality, fresh sandwiches! Definitely NOM-worthy.

I've totally dropped the ball on this place. I went to DePaul, lived in Lincoln Park (most unfortunately) for two years. Two yuppy encrusted, frat-boy, buttsweat guzzling, expensive-ass years. But I never knew about Panes bread cafe?! Unacceptable. I should have my Yelp Elite status revoked!  I'll go right out there and say that I think it may be the best sandwiches in town, both in terms of quality and price. The amazing fact is that if the sandwiches were $8.95 a pop, i'd still be writing this review. However, they're not. A mere $5.50 get's you what a potbellies could only dream of offering. REAL fresh baked bread. Excellent meats. Delicious vegetables. Adventurous combinations. Phenomenal.  When I first walked in, I was amazed by the warm and relaxed atmosphere. Huge latino-inspired murals adorn the walls, almost in a Diego-Rivera style. I ordered the Oaxacan pork loin sandwich and a cup of the Soup 'o the day. The soup was most certainly homemade, the broth being nice and rich, but not too salty. I like when restaurant let's you salt your own soup. They also gave me a big chunk of bread with the soup and at that point, I was sold. The sandwich came on a really dense and crusty bread, similar to ciabatta. The juicy pork loin was seasoned with a magical combination. Seriously, I think the secret ingredient may have been magic. I could detect chili spices, cinnamon, chocolate, lime. It was absolutely amazing. For $5.50, it was unreal. As well, I shared a chocolate chip cookie, which was huge...being about two inches thick. It too, was excellent. The chocolate peanut butter balls?! They could put Reese's out of business. This place is the best.

I love Panes!  I think it's the best sandwhich shop in town.  My friends and I frequent the place and i've yet to have anything I don't like.  Definatly skip all the chain places and give Panes a try!

Skip Subway, Potbelly's and all the generic sandwich shops and discover the tasty wonders that come from this bread cafe. Their sandwich creations are offered at prices that must not have changed in ten years: $5.00 - $6.00 sandwiches that don't suck are hard to find. Here's a hint, Panes has got em.  Pastas, soups, salads and desserts are awesome too!

I really really love the Turkey Turkey. It's spicy mayo with turkey and avocado on a tomato bread roll. It's freakin' awesome. Everything they make is from scratch. They often have some sort of dessert or potato salad that I can't pass up. Their garlic potato salad is to die for as long as you don't have anyone to kiss... or anyone who will mind your stanky breath after the garlic anyway.  The ladies that work there aren't always the most friendly, but if you get the owner, she's quite nice. AND they have awesome fountain drinks. It's pretty hard to mess up fountain drinks, but oddly enough most places do. But Panes always mixes it perfectly and I love them for that as well. I'm simple. What can I say? Even during lunch hours, give em a call and your food will be ready in 15 minutes or less.

Yum. I love the turkey with avocado sandwich, tomato soup and gigantic cookies. Skip it between 11:30 and 1ish...all the working bees in the area swarm the place. But, if you must have it between those times, its worth the wait.

I told my friend who lives in the burbs that I'd bring over lunch. I found Panes through Yelp and decided it was a good option. I tried The Popular sandwich and my friend had the Turkey, Turkey. I also picked up a small container of potato salad. I really liked the tomato foccacia bread and the potato salad was nice and creamy. I'm definitely going to head back there and try other sandwiches!

The people are right about this place, and I'm going to pile it on.. My suggestions:  -bring cash (no cc's accepted) -add the pesto to The Popular.   -go with tomato bread. On anything. -get a choc/peanut butter ball for desert This place is the real deal.  All homemade breads and attention to details.  Pricing is modest.  Taste is exceptional.

Oh my gosh!  This place is amazing.  The bread is so fresh and the menu is great.  I don't think you could go wrong.  I ordered portobello pesto sandwich served on sun-dried tomato bread.  Mmm... hmm...!  And the price is definitely right.  It was only $5.50 for a sandwich that could have been shared with another person or easily made into two meals.
The only problem is that they don't take cash, otherwise perfect. Fantastic food and prices. Check out the Todo Italiano: roasted red peppers, pesto, provolone, beautiful sandwich.

Best Sandwich Spot in Chicago!  My work ordered this place for lunch one afternoon, and since then I have been hooked. The Oakacan Pork sandwich is to die for, and my fiance loves the Chicken Club. Also, the monster cookie is brillant. If you haven't been you MUST check this place out. What is most surprisingly is the cost. It's SO cheap! I would certainly pay more for the quality they give, but it's certainly nice. The only downfall is that they only take cash. I don't usually carry cash on me and only use my debit card, and if anything I tend to avoid places that only take cash, or come with minimums for debit card purchases. This place is worth the stop at the ATM before you go though. Just have to make sure I remember each time.

Just had one of the single best sandwiches that I have ever eaten.  It was their Blackened Tilapia sandwich.  All I can say is that it was the best fish sandwich - ever.  The blackening that they did to it was soooo spicy and so tasty.  BEWARE - this sandwich is not for those who dislike cajun, it will definitely bring your blood up a couple of degrees.  AND it was only $5.50 for a very great sandwich on amazing bread.   The only thing that was annoying was that I did not know that it was a cash only place.  So I was forced to go back to an ATM.  But, it was totally worth it, so good.

This was the place I picked for lunch my first day working in Lincoln Park/ Lakeview area and I've been going there ever since. The people working always seem a bit stressed, but the service is so quick (time allotted for cooking) that I think anyone would be worn out from serving so many people-always busy when I go there.  I have never been disappointed with their food and truly appreciate the fact that they pay attention to small details (like the lemons set out for water).  Cash only is the small inconvenience to this place, but maybe its how they keep their prices low.

My roomates joke that I keep Panes in business because I literally eat there 4-5 times a week. I am a firm believer that the bread is the most important part of any sandwich, and Panes delivers! The sweet french is to die for and the garlic rosemary is a close runner up. The feta chicken salad is delish with roasted red peppers, artichokes, feta cheese and this really yummy dressing that ties it all together. All of their sandwiches are great, but the specials are the best! I go for the curry chicken salad sandwich (with whole grapes and a smooth curry cream sauce) while my boyfriend craves the blackened tilapia. The bacon-cheese scrambled eggs are a must on Sundays! The staff are totally un-friendly and sometimes borderline rude, but the food is so superb that it doesn't matter. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Never had their sandwiches- I live nearby and mainly go for their bread, which is fantastic.  The atmosphere of the place is great, it's really a neighborhood treat. The prices are incredibly reasonable and they seem to get a steady crowd. Yes, it's cash only but that's probably for the best for me. Otherwise, I'd OD on carbs every week.  The one thing that keeps me from giving this place five stars is that the people who work there always look miserable. I've been there many times and never see anyone so much as smile. It seems like a small thing but it really does make a difference to me- I would look forward to going so much more if I knew my friendliness would be returned. But their bread is worth the surliness.
Went to Panes....again. The Popular sandwich is super good. Oh and my friend had their famous "Monster Cookie" which is apparently madd good.

Let me start right off with what is wrong with this place ... they only take cash. I've been to places that don't which is fine but when I'm in need of a Panes fix, I don't have cash on me. What freaking bad luck is that and I can only take it out on Panes - blaming me for not having greenbacks is not an option.  Other than that, this place rocks in many levels. The bread is fresh and tasty and a good start to some great sandwiches. They have awesome sweets like monster cookies and my favorite the carrot cake! And they even do breakfast on the weekends as I usually get their chiliquiles. So here is the best part, the prices are more than reasonable. I can honestly say I will not find a sandwich as yummy tasting as the ones I get from Panes anywhere in the city for around the same price ... although trying will be fun!

Sometimes the service can be iffy - at times I feel like they really don't want customers to be there.  However, their carrot cake more than makes up for it.  Oh sweet heaven I love their carrot cake.  They could kick me in the shins before giving it to me and I'd come back for more.  Who cares about the sandwiches?  Come for the cake!  (Just leave me some, k?)

This place makes me so incredibly happy every time I go there.   I cannot say more about the sandwiches than what has been said already - I just plain fiend for them!!!  I've lived in Chicago all of one week, and including a couple of visits prior to moving, I've been to Panes 4 times!! And I wish I could be there now...   but the cherry on top for me is the side of mashed potatoes.  Now, next to brownies, mashed potatoes are my favorite food.  And these are just the most perfect side to my Panes Sandwich.   Panes - thanks for making Chicago my new home.

I have been going here for about a year now.  Kinda sucks that they don't accept credit cards; but who cares, because the monster cookies themselves are worth it!  They bake bread fresh on site, and all sandwiches are made to order.  I have to admit, I haven't had anything but the sandwiches..well, mostly the pollo diablo, with spicy mayo on the side.  For the quality of the sandwich, meat, bread, etc, the prices are decent, too!

YUM YUM YUM!!! Quite possible the best sandwiches ever. I have lived around the corner for 2 years and have not seemed to get sick of this place in the million times that I have eaten here. And as a veggie with limited options, flavor has not taken a backseat at Panes. Also, they are much more reasonably priced than their neighbor Pompeii! The employees are not friendly at all... ever... and never will be. But you are so busy enjoying your sandwich that you hardly will notice. Go now!

Hands down, this is my favorite place to go for hot sandwiches. I always get the turkey club. The bread is always extremely fresh and with the warm cheese the sandwich seems to melt in your mouth as you eat it. The portion sizes are great too leaving a little for leftovers. This is a great place to go for lunch or a very low key dinner. It's more of a carry out or fast food kind of place so probably not a great place to take a date on a Saturday night.

As a rule I don't like sandwiches. Something about too much bread, dried insides and gooey sauces makes me want to run. However, Panes has converted me.  They have reinvested the sandwich for me making it tasty, exciting and particularly edible. I love the homemade fresh ingredients and the Mexican flair giving the food extra flavor. My fave is the bbq chicken and I always consider the soup since it too, is homemade. Save room for dessert since it is exceptional.  Note this place is one of a kind and on weekends it is super busy but well worth the wait.
Amazing for what it is.  Delicious sandwiches.  An automatic four stars for the bread, the service, and the simplicity.  Tack the fifth on for the fact that a meal for two is just 12 dollars.
my first meal as a resident of chicago! delicious! i'm going to be a regular, its decided.  the food as well as the personaility is fresh fresh fresh! and tasty. i want some now.

A family business similar to a Corner Bakery or a Panera Bread...but with better food.   I actually didn't like my sandwich that much - I had the Veggie Cabra sandwich - mediterranean dressing, portabella mushrooms, yellow squash and spinach (and goat cheese, but I had mine without).  The spinach that came on the sandwich was cooked, which made it a bit too slimey for my taste.  I'm also not sure what was in the "mediterranean dressing", but it seemed like some sort of garlicky and perhaps tomatoey olive tampenade....made everything a bit too sour for me. But the sandwich was gigantic, and the bread that it came on was amazing - a thick toasted whole wheat loaf, light and crisp on the outside, soft and not too dense on the inside.   And the huge sandwich along with chips only came to $5.50.  I'd pick this place over Panera any day.  I just need to find the sandwich that suits me.   Also! They have quite the tempting case of desserts - homemade truffles!  cream puffs!  white chocolate rice pudding!  I will be back!

For sure my favorite lunch place. I have tried most of the sandwiches and have never been disappointed. Everything is so fresh and homemeade. The specials are also a safe bet if you are looking to change it up, but usually that is hard for me to stray.  I have a friend who goes there just for the desserts.  I do recommend eating it there, because sometimes by the time you get it home its just lost some of the oomph.  The prices are so reasonable- just remember cash only.

Seriously, amazing.  Best sandwich in chicago no question.  The bread is just like something you've never tasted before, you could get a bologna sandwich here and it would be amazing (don't quote me on that, i'm not even sure they have bologna, but you get the idea).  Plus, im not gonna lie, somehow there's always nice looking patrons in here ;) Cash only has annoyed me a couple times going in here, but not enough to not 5 star this place.
This place rocks and is always busy but you can call in your order to be ready ahead of time. Dont forget... cash only though!

CHEAP & YUMMY!! You won't find a better sandwich for the price.   Great specials daily & tasty breakfast on the weekends. Good selection of drinks (non-alcoholic) & not overpriced. If you need a fresh loaf of bread, look no further. Many other great items on the menu, but I primarily get sandwiches here. BEST COOKIE EVER...The "Monster Cookie" (only $1.00 & Huge)!! * Look at the menu, walk to the register to place your order, grab a table & wait about 5 minutes for your food to come out to you (they give you card with a number on it so they can find you).  It helps if you bring your basket & trash up to the corner left of the register since they don't have a dedicated wait staff (helps keep the menu so cheap I'm sure).  ENJOY!!!  You'll come back I'm sure & don't forget the Monster Cookie!!!!!

This adorable little cafe/restaurant is one of the best deals in Chicago.  Everything they offer is baked fresh and homemade.  They are the sweetest people and are very dog friendly.  The patio out front is perfect for a nice day.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is always great.   I am a vegetarian and they have so many options for me and the meat eaters  :)   You will not be dissapointed with the prices or the food!

I frequent Panes regularly, as my office is 2 blocks away. This place is a gem like you cannot believe! It really never gets old, either. The menu has many options and the daily specials never let me down. I am a big fan the Super Panes sandwich or the Tortilla Salad. Or the Sloppy Pollo! The Monster cookie and PB balls are to die for. Yes, it can be quite chaotic during the lunch rush. But, the staff is very friendly and this place aims to please. Karen(and her husband) are the owners- Karen is very funny and friendly and she knows her regulars! The menu is inexpensive and they only take cash or check! Which is slightly annoying, but I will forgive them because they just might have the best sweet french bread in America. See you next week, Panes!

I managed sandwich shops for 7 years, so I try to avoid sandwich places, but this one is really pretty good. Huge portions, amazing prices (especially for the neighborhood), good service. Lots of veggie options.  Seating is a little close, but everyone is friendly, so it works. Probably the best option for a sandwich in the neighborhood.

best bull's eyes (chocolate covered peanut butter ball) ever! sorry mom. the real treat are the sandwiches. every time i go there, i rotate and make sure i get something different and you can never go wrong. every sandwich there has amazing flavors and breads. i think my fave would be the diablo or the popular. i even venture the salad from time to time. one suggestion... get a credit card machine!

UNLIKE VEGETARIANS THAT REVIEW STEAKHOUSES... and slam them when they aren't fans of meat, I will write my review of Panes as if my very existence revolved around my love for bread and sandwiches.   ***deep breath...you love carbs, you really do...a sandwich is a perfectly acceptable dinner meal...exhale*** Wow!!!  Panes really impresses with its tasty selection of sandwiches on thick sliced, freshly baked bread.  Try the pollo diablo!  Okay, I can't do it.  I DO like sandwiches (a pastrami from Katz's in NYC could be a last meal on Earth on a given day), but Panes just didn't do it for me.  I found the bread fresh, but way too dry on my pollo diablo.  The bread to filling ratio was way out of whack for my tastes as I like to have more toppings than bread in my sandwich.   Honorable mention:  I really enjoy the breakfast menu here.  Great omelets at reasonable prices.

I used to work across the street from Panes, so I was there for lunch almost three times a week.  And I was glad. Karen is a super great baker, the food is delicious.  She came to anticpate my love of the tomato soup, the Oxacan truffles (they are bliss), and the enjoyment of the chicken sandwiches.   They are cash only, no credit cards, but it's worth the inconvienence.

Can you say "Monster Cookie?" Panes always has the freshest ingredients and they make everything from scratch so the food does take a little bit longer then fast food. The prices here are phenomenal and the portion sizes are great. A huge sandwich and a bag of chips for $5.00, that is a deal in today's world of F&B. Another thing to note, try their great soups of the day. it changes randomly, but do not miss the Tortilla, Black Bean or Corn Chowder. If you are making dinner at home, stop and pick up a fresh baked baguette or a loaf of sourdough.  The Key - If you are taking out, call ahead and it will be ready when you get there and all of the people waiting will look at you with envy. I have the number programmed in my phone.

I hadn't been here for a few years, but I found myself on that corner the other night, vaguely sniffing for Pompeii when I saw Panes and ducked in there. I had a chichen sandwich with proscuitto and pesto and roasted red peppers (comes with potato chips).  I washed it down with a fountain drink and even though that DEMOLISHED the spot, I couldn't resist the peanut butter buckeyes they were selling for $0.50 each.  I'm glad I didn't.

Great sandwich place. It's a bit claustrophic so the next time I go I might consider getting my order to go but the sandwiches are worth the tight squeeze either way. My husbands BLT was about the best I have ever tasted. Thick pieces of meaty bacon, gobs of mayo, crispy lettuce, sweet tomatoes all in between this yummy bread. I could have died right there and then and would have been totally satisifed.  Make sure to bring cash because they don't take cards and be prepared for a bit of a wait as the place is pretty popular!

This is a GREAT sandwich shop. They have amazing bread. The ingredients that they offer are top shelf. The pastries are good as well. The chocolate balls are fantastic. I like to get some of the bread to take home. Check out the daily specials. I recommend anything with goat cheese. Oh and its not your imagination, the servers hate you. Eh, you can't have everything in right? I'm still giving them a strong 4 stars for ambiance and food. cash only fyi

What a great little local shop for some well-deserved comfort food on a chilly March afternoon.  I've subtracted one star because the service was a little slow and a lot unfriendly. Maybe we caught them on a bad day; who knows...but I'd like to give them the benefit of the doubt. Hopefully the next time I come back they will be much more pleasant. They're primarily known for their bread. Because of my innate and unwavering hatred for sandwiches (except the GC, of course) I opted to go a route whereby the main ingredient was not bread. But, I did order the hummus appetizer (which sadly came at the same time as my entree AND my salad) which came perfectly spread on some Panes bread and it was absolutely delightful: both the hummus and the bread. I also ordered the Mac n' Cheese and was in food heaven. Very tasty and one of my favorites yet since I've moved to Chicago. There was nothing extra special about it; no fancy cheeses or finely grated green apples to adorn the top; just good ol' mac n' cheese with cheddar and parmesan. Simple, not overly done, but yummy for the tummy! I will definitely be back. Thank you Panes for a wonderful food experience. I hope the next time I am there, your service provides a similar experience.

No question, easily, hands down, unanimously the best sandwich shop I've been to in Chicago. Have I been to many Chicago sandwich shops? No. But how many better shops can there be? I had a turkey pesto sandwich once when it was -5 degrees outside. Amazing. Not the cold. The sandwich.
Believe the hype....this is an excellent sandwich shop with some truly tasty breads. My personal fav is the chicken club w.  bacon and avocado, 5/5 that one.
All sandwiches are $5.50 (including chips)                Lots and lots of sandos to choose from Loaves of bread start at $1.50 Cash only, yes.  But why complain when lunch is only five bucks?

The bread is delish -- outside is crusty and the inside is soft and warm and just YUM!  The cream puffs with the chocolate get worthy mention -- they were quite good.   Pompei is across the street and I was feeling Pizza but for some reason went to Panes instead -- again, it was better than places that only sell pizza.  The ingredients were good and it was filling and a good price.   They lose a star for the people they hire to help at the counter/register.  Whoever is doing the baking and preparing is doing a phenomenal job, it's such a shame that they hired this rude girl (I guess she's a high schooler with a definite chip on the shoulder) to detract from an otherwise phenomenal experience.  There's another woman who is much nicer.

I love love love this place! This was one of the first places I tried when I first moved here a month ago. It really is as good as the other reviewers say. I highly recommend the BLT with cheese and the goat cheese crostini. The salsa with it is really great. It is a lot better when you eat there when everything is warm, I have picked up food and brought it home in the freezing cold and it was so much better eating there! Oh, and the monster cookie has everything you want in a cookie, yum yum yum. It is really inexpensive too, but remember to take cash! My boyfriend got a sandwich on one of the herb breads and it was sooo good. Next time I go, I want to buy a loaf of the herb bread he had, it would be great for appetizers at home with friends, or to eat as a sandwich!

Best restaurant in the neighborhood.  This place makes me feel like I stopped by my parents' for dinner.  It has  a very cozy feel and homemade, delicious food.  The baked macaroni is a favorite of mine! I usually go with whatever the specials are.  Excellent. Love the soups. I recently discovered the cookies.  YUMMY! :)   My only negative comment is that they don't take credit cards!  And I very rarely have cash so I always have to plan ahead.  I'm sure it helps drive the costs down but I still don't like it.  I can't wait to sit outside this summer.

Just a note to let everyone know that Panes is changing its menu TODAY (2/22/08) to reflect new prices.  With everything going up these days, it's no surprise that it's more expensive to provide quality food.  They would have to up their prices SIGNIFICANTLY to keep me from coming, though.  There are so few places where I'm consistently pleased with the food, which is impressive considering I've been dining here for 8 years! Panes is a staple of my life - I probably go about once a week.  It's easy to get to (right off the Wellington Brown Line stop) and the food is dependably fresh and delicious!  And SUCH a good price for such super food, it's hard for me to feel sorry for the yelpers who are turned off by the cash only part of it.  $5 for a large FRESH sandwich on homemade bread with chips?  Can't be beat.  I recommend the Parisiano sandwich and most of the soups.  Also, all of the salads I've had have been great - every  now and then the tomatoes are lackluster, but, what do you expect in January?  The pumpkin cheesecake and orange bread pudding are definitely  worth the calories.  And it's not that crowded at 6pm on weeknights, or before 10am on weekends.

Usually I'm stuck inside on weekdays for lunch, eating at the lunch table with my students. A few glorious Fridays ago, I actually got to go out to lunch. Now to most people, it's not a big deal, but to me it was freedom, I actually felt like an adult! Panes was a great place to munch on a yummy sandwich and bowl of soup while reveling in the freedom of eating lunch with other adults. It gets very crowded, the line was almost out the door, however we seemed to beat the rush, so we ordered and received our food very quickly. I had a grilled cheese sandwich and a bowl of french onion soup. They were both heaven. The grilled cheese was on thick bread, that perfectly accompanied the soup. The only two negatives were that it is cash only and it gets extremely crowded. Go a little before or after lunch time to avoid the rush.

This is one of the BEST spots in the city!! We have been going to this spot for the last 5 years on a pretty regular basis. The food is ALWAYS good and is always fresh.  Cute atmosphere and very easy on your bank account.

Yum this place was delicious.  The Oaxacan Pork Sandwich was full of spicy goodness and the Tortilla Salad was great.  We went during the week so it was hard to judge the crowds, but I can see why people flock to Panes.  The soup was also well done--Chicken Minestrone.  The prices were surprisingly affordable.

Panes is fucken unbelievable.  Every sandwich I have is better than any other sandwich from anywhere else.  The sandwiches on the tomato bread are the dank.  Stop wasting your money at other places (even potbellys which i love) and get your ass to Panes.  It's worth it.

It's officially winter. It's blustery. It's bone-chilling. And it's bowl-of-soup-sounds-like-heaven weather.  Since I've been wanting to try Panes since I moved to Lakeview in July, I decided that tonight was going to be the night. I called ahead to see what their soup du jour was - Chicken Rice or Cream of Tomato. Although I will go for the tomato 9 times out of 10, tonight I wanted something lighter. To my delight, the Chicken Rice soup was delicious! Hearty and full of vegetables, it filled me up real good. To accompany my soup, I ordered a bruschetta appetizer. And just as I was about to pay, the White Chocolate Rice Pudding caught my eye.  Minutes later, I trekked through the cold, night air to my apartment a couple blocks away. As I slurped my soup, nibbled on the bruschetta and savored the rice pudding, I couldn't help but think that Panes perfectly captured the concept of comfort food.

Panes is truly a great find in Lakeview. Their sandwich menu is unique, extensive and delicious. More importantly, their food is filling and inexpensive. I live right down the street and find myself ordering from here several times a week. I recommend calling in orders (good food takes time) and checking which specials they have (they're normally amazing).

Great local sandwich shop! I'm lucky I live right around the corner. You order, you pay, and they bring your food out to you. Water is self-service, which means you don't have to ask anyone for refills while you're trying to nurse the hangover. Most sandwiches are $4.95 and come with chips!  Anything with pesto and provolone is delish!  Tuna salad is also very good. Definitely worth the 10 minute wait for their sandwiches. The seating area is very tight - I actually like Panes better in the summertime because of their outdoor seating on Sheffield. It is annoying they don't take credit cards, but if that means $4.95 sandwiches, I'll take it!!!

I had never heard of Panes but my brother lives right down the street and said I had to try it.  Yummy!  When we got there the line was to the door but it moved fairly quickly and we were actually able to snag a table.  We tried a couple of appetizers (the bruschetta con jamon and the goat cheese crostini - both were pretty good) and then split a few of the sandwiches (The Popular, Sloppy Pollo, Turkey Turkey and a special of the day - all delicious!)  I think it's really the fresh bread that makes them so tasty.  The people next to us had a pizza and it looked and smelled amazing... Big portions at very reasonable prices, friendly service, scrumptious food... I think I'm going to have to go back soon! :-)
Food is five-star, but attitude takes it down to four.  Can be quite slow making the sandwiches during peak times.  Don't forget to bring cash, as they don't take credit cards.

There is a special little place in my heart and stomach for this place. I've had lunch here and taken out and I have had some of their bread as well. Their olive oil and garlic french bread needs nothing else, I will eat alone with nothing else. So mouth watering tasty. I got a loaf for a party, I should have ordered two because I nearly ate one of them all by myself. Sandwiches are a good size and their soups are good. Prices are fair and reasonable and the staff is friendly and approachable with questions and recommendations.
This place is full of great sandwiches, specials, and I'll be honest -bachelors!  Don't leave without a monster cookie!

This is one of the best lunch places in the city! All the sandwiches they have on the menu are $4.95 and the salads are huge and delicious as well. It is always busy, so be prepared to wait a few minutes while waiting for your food. I recommend the Tomato soup (if they have it that day) - unbelievable!
Me encanta el Super Panes!  Also, Best BLT I've had in a long time.

Outstanding food, excellent prices, friendly staff, fresh ingredients...honestly, what else could you ask for? Fresh baked bread, fresh cut meats and cheese...yummmm. Some of the best pastas and omelets in town too.  $5 will pretty much get you anything on the menu, and that includes their salads, and the majority of their pastas. Don't waste your time spending twice as much money at Clarks.
Chicken Pompazo...BEST SANDWICH EVER.  The other sandwiches on the menu are superb as well, but the Pompazo is a party in your mouth.  Don't tell the owners, but I'd pay triple.

Panes offers great food at an inexpensive price, but how do you say the name?  I go here often with my girlfriend and we generally each get a soup or sandwich and split a salad.  The tortilla salad is our favorite, as is the chicken club.  They use quality ingredients and bake excellent breads.  We don't partake of their desserts too often, but their cookies are very tasty. This is a fantastic neighborhood sandwich place.  I only wish there were one in every neighborhood.

this place is awesome. i had the panes deluxe sandwich and it was fantastic! the bread was wonderful and they used some sweet sauce that went perfectly with the sandwich. it was the perfect amount of food. i was fully satisfied. it felt somewhat healthy too. AND the best part is that it was super cheap. most sandwiches were around $4.75 and salads ran about the same price. i am now a regular here.

Always good.  Always cheap.  Most sandwiches and salads under 5 bucks.  The bread is excellent.  The salads are huge.  The outdoor seating is small but perfect.  We go here almost every other weekend!

Sandwiches constructed by God, for the godless. This tiny sandwich shop has somehow escaped my ire until recently, hiding in a miniscule cubby between Chicago Pizza and an unnamed salon.  I always thought it was a coffee shop, so ignored it entirely for several months.  What a mistake! Their menu proudly proclaims their history, and the pride they take in baking fresh bread, using real sourdough yeast, and so on, but none of that does justice to the food itself.  I ordered the chicken club, which is a ridiculously inexpensive combination of avocado, chicken, bacon, and awesome. I asked for their spicy mayo for that final succulent kick, and I seriously wanted to cry after  biting into it; it's ambrosia for sandwich connoisseurs. And their sandwiches are damn huge.  The bread is gigantic, and the fillings, an entire avocado in the case of the chicken club, are overwhelming.    One can easily stretch two meals, and for the price I paid, it's almost an insult to the quality of the food.  If you're ever on the brown line on the way to Belmont, go a little further to Wellington, and give this place a try.  You won't regret it!

Do not go to Panes if you are on a low carb diet (who does that anymore anyway?) or are in a big hurry.  This place is usually pretty crowded and its NOT fast food, but it's crowded for a reason!  Trying the bread here is an absolute MUST.  There are a ton of reviews on here already, so I am going to try to keep it simple.  They have a great array of sandwiches and salads, mostly under $6.  Everyday they have a couple sandwich, salad and entre specials.  I have never had anything less than delicious here and I have never walked way unsatisfied.  Cash only, blah blah blah.  Just try it!

Although this place is only 6 blocks away from me I don't eat here nearly enough.  They make great sandwiches on fresh baked bread.  Definately a step up from the subway/panera type chains that populate the lunchtime sandwich world.  Always fresh and often with a nice spicy twist.  I'm told the soups and sides are fantastic too.

Great little neighborhood spot, just down the street from the Wellington Brown Line. For $5 you get a pretty large sandwich and a bag of chips. I haven't tried any of the soups but they look quite tasty, too. Back to the sandwiches...fresh, unique ingredients and tons of variety. Try the "Todo Italiano" which has grilled chicken w/ pesto, prosciutto, cheese, and roasted red peppers. CASH ONLY and bring a few extra bucks so you can buy a fresh loaf of bread to take home!

This is the kind of place that keeps a neighborhood just that.  As many times as I've been here, the tiny thrill of stepping in to the scent of freshly baked bread still hasn't worn off.  The sammiches are my favorite.  The Pollo Diablo is a standout, and lately I've had to force myself not to eat it because, hey, there's a few other things on the menu, too.  The Popular and Super Panes have been getting the bulk of my attention lately.  Also, they usually have a choice of the day in each of the three categories (sammich, pasta, salad) that doesn't normally appear on the menu, and that's the only time I forgot what a Pollo Diablo even was. I've had a few salads, and been happy each time, but really, this is a sammich place.  I refuse to acknowledge that there is such a thing on the menu like pasta or pizza.  The last thing my nervous system needs at this point is more choices.  I almost feel guilty that I haven't tried different menu items.  Strange. Baked bread and desserts in the display case and in bins on the wall. Oh yeah, and they have Fresca for those of you who suffer from that particular little perversion. A warm inviting space with artwork on the walls and friendly staff (not on the walls). Go there.

Love this place, been going there for the past three years and it's great every time. They have amazing bread, try the tomato bread UMMM! SNAP! as well as awesome cookies and sandwiches.  Just wanted to add to all the wonderful things already written below.
This place is just flat out pretty damn good.  I had a great chicken breast sandwich... a touch of spicy to it... incredible bread, pesto, provolone... yep, a great lunch indeed.

Panes is good place for sandos.   They build their sandos on fresh breads, sometimes foccia, sometimes ciabatta, sometimes sourdough - you will find no wonder bread weakness here. Now the insides of that sando are mighty tasty. They have something for every taste bud - savory, smokey, cheesy, veggie.... there isn't a sando here that can't soothe some sort of craving. Panes also has a variety of spreads they use in their creations such as a spinach spread and even a spicy pepper spread, which bring an average lunch from tasty to delicious.

I have been coming to this place for years and even though I no longer live in the neighborhood, I still try to treck out here every couple months. In fact, in reading everyone else's reviews, I'm thinking I really need to get out of my comfort zones and try new things. I really like the Pollo Diablo and the California Turkey, but I am also partial to their Mac&Cheese and once I even had enchiladas! The soup is also very good and you always get some of their homemade bread. They make all of the breads here and will even do a custum sandwich for you. It could be 2pm on a weekday or Noon on a weekend and the place is usually jammed. My favorite recent story is the older couple that sat at the table next to me in January. They were on a date and the man had brought wine, a corkscrew and two wine glasses for them to enjoy with their lunch. I was pretty impressed by his game. Sure, it was a little much for a casual sandwich shop-- but hey? Aren't those the kinds of snapshots we love from living in a big city?

I used to go here for lunch probably once a week when I lived in the neighborhood.  Now when I'm in the area, I always stop by for a tuna sandwich and monster cookie.  The bread is really good too though I try to stay away so as not to exacerbate my carb addiction. Note:  They don't take credit/debit cards, so make sure you have cash!

Two words: monster cookie.  OK, I'm actually drooling a little bit thinking about that.  Sorry. On to the review. Very nice alternative to that other place across the street. Limited menu, but they switch up the specials pretty nicely. So far, my favorites have been the French Onion soup and the tuna melt. Pasta's been fine, too. I wasn't particularly impressed with the white chocolate rice pudding, but I'd defintely not equate the chocolate cloud to the plague. Actually, it's pretty good. Oh, and did I mention the monster cookie?
Awesome oven-baked sandwiches and soups.  Homemade bread, also sold by the loaf.  Affordable prices.  Highly recommend the Oaxacan pork sandwich.  Good luck with the correct pronunciation...

Since discovering Panes a couple of months ago, I have gone there 3 to 4 times a week.  I always get the same thing:  A cup of soup (only $2.25, and it comes with a side of Panes' legendary bread) and a sandwich (only $4.95).  I have tried every sandwich on the menu and I've never been disappointed.  The Super Panes on tomato bread is definitely the round winner, but you can't go wrong with the Oaxacan Pork, the Sloppy Pollo, or the Pompazo. If you live close by, I definitely recommend calling your order in for pick up (they do not offer delivery).  Panes gets busy and it can be a 10-15 minute wait for your sandwich.  If you're going to call, be sure to ask what the special soups and sandwiches are for the day - they usually have something creative and tasty on the specials board.   And remember...Cash Only!

I love Panes.  My only complaint is everything on the menu sounds fantastic.  Oh yeah, my other complaint is that they only take cash - very annoying since I live off my debit card.  I have only gone to Panes about 50 times instead of 100, because the other 50 i didn't have cash or the desire to go get some.  Hell, I think a good quarter of the times I've been to Pompei (kitty-corner) were times I went to Panes before realizing I was dollar bill free.  It's 2007, come on!  Credit card machines don't charge THAT much.  Raise your prices 2%. But I digress... like I was saying, the food is awesome. The bread is all fresh and homemade (as is everything else I think), and I have enjoyed, salads, sandwiches, soup, pizzas, maybe even one pasta, and dessert.  I have yet to be anything but thoroughly pleased. Just remember the cash.

Am I the only person who had a bad experience at this restaurant?  Mine and my friend Michelle's meals were nowhere near YUM.   I was attracted by the smell of the restaurant coming from my apartment (I live right around the corner).  When we got there, she got a chicken sandwich, I got some pasta, and we split pizza bread.  The sandwich had hard bread and cold innerds (spelling?).  My pasta was ok, but the sauce was pretty bad.  The pizza bread reminded me of something I would have made in a 7th grade home ec class. Maybe I am just the minority here, but I won't be giving anymore business to this place.

Went to Panes for the first time with a good friend and fell in love with it from the moment I walked in.  I had the Seafood Chowder and the Sloppy Pollo - both were wonderful.  Felt like home cooked food!  When we got there the place was dead and when we walked out there was a line outside the door.

I've been going to Panes for a good 10 or so years ever since I was in high school and the kick ass prices and quality has not changed a bit! Panes' food is always fresh and like others have said, seems almost homemade. Whenever I need a good loaf of sourdough (garlic-oregano is my fave), I always come here since they make it fresh everyday. The cavatapi pasta with veggies and goat cheese I can eat everyday, but I also like to grub on a portabella or popular sandwiches (tomato foccacia - yum!) every now and then. And the monster cookies... oh the monster cookies... those are a must for dessert.

I went here for the first time on Friday and it was really good.... I had the portabella sandwich and it was huge!  I was very full by the end.  I want to go back and try more because everything on the menu looked great!

I have only had a bowl of soup from Panes once, so I can't comment much on the menu, but the bread here is wonderful. I stop in frequently to pick up a loaf or two. It is always fresh, soft and delicious, not to mention cheap.

Prices are good, and the sandwiches are awesome.  Well, most of them are.  Very few items on the menu could be considered uninspired in my opinion.  The Pompazo and the Pollo Diablo are my personal favorites.  I also love that they have cans of Squirt and fresh desserts.  I always buy far more than I intend to when I go in there, but that's a good thing.  None of it is a rip-off.
Bomb soup and sandwiches! Great service with reasonable prices are a norm at Panes. Plus, you can order it from one of the local pubs in the area. You can't beat that!

This is a great alternative to all of the large chain sandwich shops. The food is fresher, there is a great selection of entrees and more healthier options than say, Panera or something similar. I always order the quesadillas, which come with mashed potatoes. The are considered an appetizer but I can eat them as a meal. They make amazing desserts, such as chocolate clouds, which is low-fat chocolate mouse with cinnamon cookies. It is great. Another fantastic aspect is their wide array of diet beverages. I have diabetes and I am always looking out for places that sell more than diet coke. This place has a lot, fountain diet sprite as well as many other offerings in cans, namely fresca. My only complaints are that the fresh dressings seem a bit heavy and the cashier never ever smiles. Other than that I would recommend this place highly. Oh, bear in mind, they only accept cash and personal check. No debit cards.

wow, you can see by the sheer number of reviews, this place is popular, and for good reason. it's a cute little bread cafe (hence the name) with a nice selection of sandwiches & salads. We had the BBQ chicken sandwich & the sloppy pollo sandwich - essentially the same sandwich, just slightly different. The sandwiches were terrrrrriffic. The bread was warm, soft & chewy with a nice crust. The chicken was juicy, with nice bbq flavor. My sandwich also had sauteed red onions which added some nice flavor. It's on a great stretch of sheffield too. We'll definitely be back to try more lunches.

Came in to get some take-outs. I ordered some pasta, doesn't compare to the other pastas I had. The portion could be bigger as well. Inexpensive but small portion. Suits the size! Tiny place, warm environment. Need another visit, so 2 stars for now since there's no option for 2.5.
Great little sandwich shop and it's called a 'bread cafe' for a reason - yum yum.  I also recommend their homemade cookies - the 'monster' rocks.

I have been to this place quite a few times now. Since I'm usually there during peak hours (lunch time) there is always somewhat of a wait, but nothing to the point where it's driven me to insanity. Plus, no matter how long the line or how busy it seems, by the time you order a table or two always seems to be free. And of course, you can always do carry-out. Never seen it really busy during dinner time.  Something that hasn't been mentioned yet is that they have a small breakfast menu on Sundays (until 2 or 3, I think). My bf had the french toast w/apples and he said it was "damn good" & I had a taste and agreed. I've stuck to sandwiches & salads, but have never been disappointed--- except for the fact that I was under the impression that they make their own salad dressings (as the Spartan salad came w/an obviously homemade Greek dressing) but once I got a salad that came with a packet of honey mustard. Go figure.  If you are calling in carry-out, I would you suggest you ask about what the specials of the day are.
