If in this little restaurant, these are written on a wipe-off board up high on the right wall if facing the counter--- it always lists a unique soup, salad, sandwich, and pasta dish not usually found on the menu.  Some of the deserts look tastier than they really are, but you can tell they are homemade and I can appreciate that. However, I find it hard to pass up a cream puff for less than a buck. :-) Lastly, the people are really nice. Once when we did carry-out and they messed up my bf's sandwich (he abhors mayonnaise). He called & explained & they apologized for their mistake, and even wrote down his name so he could come in and get a free sandwich on his next visit.

there is some good stuff happening here.  particularly good-their cookies and desserts (except for the "chocolate clouds" one-avoid that one like the plague) and bread.  you really can't get any better than a loaf of their country white or rosemary olive oil.  it makes a pretty bad ass grilled cheese at home.   they also have some pretty solid sandwiches and daily specials to mix it up.  i don't have anything great to say about their salads or pizzas, however.  a little sub-par...but not BAD, per se.  do yourself a favor and stick with something fantastic-like the chicken club.  it's fabulous!

Panes is awesome, i even took my ladyfriend here for v-day one year, because everywhere else was booked.  we got a little table by the window and she was like butter. sandwiches on homemade bread are the draw and they do not disappoint.  i always get the super panes with a side of mashed potatoes.  Soups and salads are also good and come with some bread goodness. tip: if your late-night takes you to chicago pizza next door, take a peek into panes and you may see them in the back, baking away for the coming day.

What a cute little spot! I've lived in the 'hood for years and have never been here.  Why??!!!  Allison's & Julia's reviews reminded me why I've always wanted to check this place out.  So often I just want soup and a sandwich.  Panes hits the spot! It's nice to sit outside. I wish they had a carry out menu you could take home though.

I just discovered Panes and their fresh baked bread is absolutely wonderful.  I just wish it was closer to me!  I thought the sandwich I had was tasty  but overall it felt a little too simple (yum, but not "wow").   Additionally, while the Tortilla Soup had a really good base flavor it felt 'empty' --too much broth and not enough of the good stuff.  I plan on going back and buying the bread to take home.  It's inexpensive and worth the trip to check it out and make your own sandwiches!

Everything on the menu at this little discreet cafe is wonderful, especially their baked pasta al horno and their yummy, and fairly unique, salads. Offers Panera-esque menu items with a homemade and less assembly-lined taste, which I love. My boyfriend lives in the neighborhood and eats here about 4 times a week! I make it in at least once a week.  And... how could I forget to mention... it's VERY inexpensive.

For a girl who doesn't adore sandwiches, 4 stars is a big freakin' deal.  Panes bakes some tasty bread and oh lord, their Sloppy Pollo sandwich is so damn good--I'm talking good like the stuff-drips-down-your-chin-good.  Also high on my list are the curried chicken salad, the pulled pork and, sandwiches aside, their homemade rice pudding (no surprise there) and buckeyes (you know, those peanut butter chocolate delights).  The hub loves their Pollo Diablo, as does everyone else on Yelp, apparently. Every time I've been to Panes the line has easily stretched to the door and while it's difficult to stand there drooling over everyone else's lunches, it ends up being worth the wait.
This is an amazing deli option. The soups and sandwiches are fresh and delicious, but the "monster cookies" (peanut butter/oatmeal/m&m all in one) are the best reason to make the trip!

Excellent fresh bread and sandwiches, small and cozy dining room, reasonably priced.  Their tomato focaccia is perfect -- take a couple home with you for dinner, or get your sandwich on one.  They also have a specials board to the right of the counter, which is easy to miss.

This is a great, cheap place to grab a sandwich.  I've never had the pastas or salads, but they look tasty!  I like eating at the cafe as well, it's a very relaxed atmosphere. If you love bread, you can buy a fresh loaf for very under $2!

Panes is a great little bread place off the Brownline Wellington stop.  It is really close to where I live and even though there are some things that bother me about it, the more I go the more I like it.  I think the quality of service and product increases exponentially with the more buzz/traffic it gets.   Things that annoy me:  Panes only takes cash and this can be a real buzzkill on a hung over morning when you want a sammy but your pockets are empty from the night before.  Also, it tends to be VERY crowded on the weekend. Ugh, I feel trapped inside one big yuppie-fest.  Yikes!  I don't really like eating "in" here unless I am able to sit near a window. For food, I tried the BBQ pulled sandwich and was not impressed (too blah).  The salad I tried was bland and boring (but looking at other diners' salads recently, they look better so I may have to try again). Now the good: My favorite here is the BLT sans mayo.  The BLT is SOOOO good (and worth all the stars).  Honestly, the BLT is one of the best I have ever had.  Seems weird I would find my salty pork love at a bread cafe, but you never know!  The vegetable sandwiches and goat cheese sandwiches are also pretty good.  The bread is fabulous.  Try the tomato bread - no need to add anything to it!   All in all, Panes has won me over - especially when I'm achin' for some bacon.

Great little place.  The bread is fabulous & it's reasonably priced.  Not once have I had a bad eating experience here.  When I used to eat seafood, I gorged on the tuna salad sandwich.  Now I get legitimate vegetarian options, but they're still all delicious. Definitely recommended.

my first apartment in the city was right down the street from here and we went there on the first day we moved in....so great!  good bread, good sandwiches, good everything....not much atmosphere but who cares, i never ate THERE, i always took it home, do the same....the tuna salad is really good and to top it all of....IT'S CHEAP!!

Love it. Cheap. Tasty. A bakery first and restaurant second, all the sandwiches are served on fresh-baked bread. The Super Panes is my favorite, although the special Chicken Parmesan is gaining on it.

Good sandwiches at a good price.  It's always hard to decide, though;  the roast beef is good, as are the veggie sandwiches.  I like to get mine to go, so I can pair it with a beer at Sheffield's down the street.

This is a great little family-run bakery and sandwich shop that I really should go to more often. The best fresh-baked bread in the neighborhood, salads, pizzas, pastas, pastries and toasty sandwiches, with interesting combinations like the Pollo Diablo, Veggie Cabra, and daily specials. This time I had the Crabby sandwich with crabcake. It was excellent. Most sandwiches are $4.95, which is fine. What would really be nice if they at least had a lunch special for maybe $6.50 that includes a small version of any of the pastas or salads as a side, rather than potato chips. Better drink options would be good too, like a homemade lemonade or ice tea.
